description: In a long narrow run behind the poultry house at John Bowne High School in Queens, a chastened peacock clucked quietly on Tuesday.

title: Ryan Carries Load While Romney Readies for Debates
description: CEDAR RAPIDS, Iowa  With Mitt Romney keeping a low profile, Representative Paul D. Ryan was the face of the Republican ticket once again on Tuesday, blitzing morning television shows and skipping between battleground states, fully embracing the role of tormentor in chief of President Obama.

title: Representative Charlie Rose, Tobaccos Friend in the House, Dies at 73
description: Charlie Rose, a former United States representative from rural North Carolina who fought to protect the tobacco industry and its farmers when political and regulatory pressure on the industry were on the rise and smoking in steady decline, died on Monday in Albertville, Ala. He was 73.

title: Giants Secret Weapon No Longer
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  The biggest difference between last September and this one for Victor Cruz is not his endorsement deals with soup and soda companies. It is not his occasional encounters with models like Kate Upton while dashing about town, nor is it the increase in celebrities numbers, including President Obamas, that he now has saved in his cellphone.

title: Names of the Dead
description: The Department of Defense has identified 2,091 American service members who have died as a part of the Afghan war and related operations. It confirmed the death of the following American recently:

title: Words Not Spoken
description: Not many people know it, but the Democratic Party supports a ban on assault weapons. Its a position that, if enacted, could save many lives by reducing the lethality of mass shootings, but you have to flip more than halfway through the partys new 26,500-word platform to find it.

title: As a Taxi-Hailing App Comes to New York, Its Legality Is Questioned
description: New Yorkers have long adopted their own techniques in the fine art of hailing a taxicab, a theatrical, frustrating, competitive ritual of the city.

title: A Tribute to Kennedy and a Tweak for Romney
description: The Democrats honored one of their liberal lions, the late Senator Edward M. Kennedy, and used him to tweak Mitt Romney, who challenged him unsuccessfully for the Senate in 1994. In a video tribute, Mr. Kennedy was shown debating Mr. Romney over abortion rights during that campaign. Mr. Romney insisted he supported Roe vs. Wade, a position he later disavowed.

title: Iran Supplying Syrian Military via Iraqi Airspace
description: WASHINGTON  Iran has resumed shipping military equipment to Syria over Iraqi airspace in a new effort to bolster the embattled government of President Bashar al-Assad of Syria, according to senior American officials.

title: Welcome to the MSNBC, Er, Democratic Convention
description: It started in the bathroom at the Charlotte airport.

title: Judge Allows AMR to End Pilot Contract
description: The AMR Corporations American Airlines won court approval Tuesday to throw out its labor agreement with pilots, ending a dispute with the only union it had failed to reach a deal with on concessions as it goes through bankruptcy reorganization.

title: Ohio Delegates at the D.N.C.
description: Delegates from Ohio discuss President Obama and the Democratic Party's platform at the 2012 Democratic National Convention.

title: If This Brooklyn Kingmaker Is Asking, Saying No Is Risky Option
description: A few years ago, Elliot G. Sander, the executive director of the Metropolitan Transportation Authority at the time, got a call at home from Vito J. Lopez, the assemblyman and Brooklyn Democratic leader. Mr. Lopez wanted his son-in-law, a transit manager named Keith Summa, promoted. Mr. Sander was dubious, and soon after called Mr. Lopez to say it would not happen.

title: Two Hungry Nations Collide Over Fishing
description: VELLAPALLAM, India  Drifting on the strait between India and Sri Lanka, an Indian fisherman named Sakthivel cowered in his boat. A Sri Lankan naval officer, who took the mans photograph, delivered a warning: If we find you in Sri Lankan waters again, you will never leave.

title: Israel: Trappist Monastery Is Vandalized
description: Vandals burned the door of a Trappist monastery at Latrun, near Jerusalem, early Tuesday and scrawled anti-Christian slogans on the walls. The Israeli authorities said they suspected it was the work of Jewish extremists avenging recent moves against unauthorized settlement outposts in the West Bank. The graffiti included Jesus is a monkey and the names of two small outposts where security forces have destroyed structures several times. The vandals also wrote mutual concern, code in settler circles for the policy of exacting a price for army and police actions against the outposts. Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and other Israeli leaders condemned the act, as did regional leaders of the Roman Catholic Church.

title: Brooklyn Rabbi and His Brother Plead Guilty in Section 8 Fraud
description: An influential Brooklyn rabbi and onetime chaplain in New York Citys jails who drew notoriety several years ago for arranging a lavish jailhouse bar mitzvah for an inmates son pleaded guilty on Tuesday to making false statements in connection with a federal housing fraud scheme.

title: Candidate on Virginia Ballot Poses Worry for Romney
description: WASHINGTON  Virgil Goode, the presidential nominee for the conservative Constitution Party, qualified Tuesday for Virginias ballot in November, complicating Mitt Romneys chances of winning the key swing state. Polls show a tightly contested race between Mr. Romney and President Obama.

title: Facebook Moves to Aid Its Shares
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Stay focused and keep shipping may be the motto Facebook has sought to follow since its flubbed public offering three months ago. But on Tuesday, the company seemed focused mostly on how to stabilize its hemorrhaging stock.

title: Matt Bai on Carter and Clinton
description: Marcus Mabry and Matt Bai discuss the roles of former Presidents Jimmy Carter and Bill Clinton in the presidential election at the 2012 Democratic National Convention.

title: Joe Frazier Wins Belated Embrace as Philadelphia Starts a Fight
description: PHILADELPHIA  The three-story brick building stands like a ghost of what it once was, the letters Joe Fraziers Gym stenciled across the facade in washed-out letters. A former destination for aspiring fighters and children seeking refuge from the gang violence of North Philadelphia, the gym is now a discount furniture store.

title: Banks Face Suits as States Weigh Libor Losses
description: The scandal over global interest rates has state officials like Janet Cowell of North Carolina working intensely behind the scenes to build a case for suing the nations largest banks.

title: Lottery Numbers
Matchup: Dallas Cowboys at Giants
description: Time: 8:30 p.m. Eastern, NBC.

title: Legislators Debate Expulsion in Sexual Harassment Case; Lopez Vows to Remain
description: ALBANY  A defiant Assemblyman Vito J. Lopez said Tuesday that he would not resign from the Legislature over multiple sexual harassment allegations, even as elected officials began to debate whether to seek to expel him and the states ethics commission met to discuss an investigation.

title: Mexico: Major Drug Suspect Is Arrested
description: A presumed top leader of the Gulf Cartel, one of the countrys largest and most powerful criminal groups, was caught by the Mexican Navy on Monday as he was carrying a large gun. The kingpin, Mario Crdenas Guilln, was detained in Tamaulipas State, where violence has surged in the past couple of years. The navy did not detail what kind of gun he had, but said he was also in possession of cash, ammunition, fragmentation grenades and other arms. Mr. Crdenas took over the group  reluctantly, some analysts say  when his brother was killed by Mexican forces in 2010. The Gulf Cartel has waned as a spinoff group, the Zetas, has battled for its turf.

title: Matt Stopera on Delegates at the D.N.C.
description: Jim Roberts and Matt Stopera of BuzzFeed talk about the sights, sounds and characters of the 2012 Democratic National Convention.

title: New Cab Fare Calculus: New Decal + New Meter
description: It is a rare breed headed for extinction  a New York City taxi charging the old rates after the city allowed cabbies to charge new, higher fares.

title: Edward M. Kennedy's Legacy
description: Marcus Mabry and Jeff Zeleny discuss the influence of Senator Edward M. Kennedys legacy in the Democratic Party at the the 2012 Democratic National Convention.

title: Searching for Answers After Violence Mars Parade
description: The only reminders of a spirited and clamorous parade a day earlier were a few blue wooden barricades lying on the sidewalk that had been part of heightened crowd-control efforts by the police.

title: Critics Say California Law Hurts Effort to Add Jobs
description: LOS ANGELES  Environmentalists in this greenest of places call the California Environmental Quality Act the states most powerful environmental protection, a model for the nation credited with preserving lush wetlands and keeping condominiums off the slopes of the Sierra Nevada.

title: In a Forthright Campaign, More Unmentionables Mentioned
description: FOR those who need another sign of how much franker Madison Avenue has become in discussing subjects that were once mentioned in whispers and euphemisms, if at all, there is to be quite a large one on display at Penn Station on Thursday: an inflatable prop, 18 feet high, shaped like a pill bottle.

title: Former Mayor Koch Is Hospitalized for Anemia
description: Edward I. Koch, the former three-term mayor of New York City, was hospitalized on Tuesday for anemia, said George Arzt, his former press secretary and longtime friend.

description: Megan Liberman talks with Representative Debbie Wasserman Schultz of Florida, the chairwoman of the Democratic National Committee, at the Democratic National Conventions.

description: An employee with the New York City parks department was fatally stabbed on Tuesday near a recreation center in Queens after a fight with a fellow worker, the authorities said.

title: How Voters View Bipartisanship
description: From Charlotte, N.C., Charles M. Blow and Frank Bruni discuss what voters participating in a Google Hangout thought about President Obamas struggle for bipartisanship.

title: Gold in Them Thar Hills
description: Administrivial Thursday Puzzle Heads Up Alert! The Thursday, September 6 puzzle will be offered in all of the usual manners  Across Lite, PDF, Java applet  but there are elements in the puzzle that are impossible to reproduce in Across Lite. I strongly urge you to print out and solve the PDF for a better visual experience.

title: With Lead All but Gone, Yankees Dwell on the Finish
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla.  For days, if not weeks, the Yankees have been holding dear to one irrefutable fact of the American League East race. As poorly as they have played, and as well as the Baltimore Orioles and Tampa Bay Rays have performed, the Yankees have still held the lead.

title: Better and Worse
description: Whether the economy is doing better or worse than it was four years ago can depend on when you start counting.

title: A Heros Welcome for a Convicted Killer Reignites Tensions
description: MOSCOW  Ramil Safarov stepped uncertainly off the plane in his native Azerbaijan last Friday, returning home after spending eight years in a Hungarian prison for a gruesome murder. But it took only a few minutes for the celebrations to begin. There was a pardon, a new apartment, eight years of back pay, a promotion to the rank of major and the status of a national hero.

title: Players, Coaches and Fans Must Adjust to Replacement Refs
description: Long before 11th-hour negotiations to resolve the N.F.L. officials lockout devolved into dueling news releases and lost hope last weekend, a former league executive used to say that there were two teams on the field, not three. That pointed barb about the perceived place of officials is one the N.F.L. would surely like fans to remember this week.

title: Egypts Economic Struggle
description: Eighteen months after Egypts revolution, President Mohamed Morsi, the United States and the International Monetary Fund finally seem to be pulling in the same general direction on the question of how best to revive the countrys devastated economy. Their efforts are long overdue and will require a sustained commitment as Egypt struggles with its transition to democracy.

title: Are You Better Off? The Answer Is Less Clear Than It Was in 1980
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C.  When Ronald Reagan asked voters a week before the 1980 election whether they were better off than four years earlier, he turned a race that had been nip-and-tuck for months into a landslide victory  and showed how a pointed question can be a lethal political weapon.

title: Out on a Pier, Putting On a Concert for the Birds
description: On Tuesday morning, Jose Modesto Castillo, retired from a job in a plastics factory, walked just about as far west in northern Manhattan as it is possible to go, to the end of a long pier fingering into the Hudson River at Dyckman Street. A harmonica rigged to his head was just a breath away from his lips. Lashed to his hands with hair ties were 17 miniature percussion instruments made from items like a Snapple cap, the lid of a prescription bottle, a Spider-Man figurine, the shells of plastic eggs that once held toys from supermarket vending machines.

title: As Are Hitting Home Runs and Beating the Odds
description: OAKLAND, Calif.  The faded yellow wordmark of the Oakland Athletics  neat, cursive script, with an underline  watches over baseball games at the Coliseum from high atop the center-field seats. It is printed on a canvas that will come off Monday, when the Raiders open their N.F.L. season, and obscures what was once a crisp view of the Oakland hills.

title: Its Mitts World
description: Mitt Romney has been criticized for not discussing foreign policy. Give him a break. He probably figures hes already said all that he needs to say during the primaries: He has a big stick, and he is going to use it on Day 1. Or as he put it: If Im president of the United States ... on Day 1, I will declare China a currency manipulator, allowing me to put tariffs on products where they are stealing American jobs unfairly.

The Benefits of Middle-Age Fitness
description: Americans are living longer, with our average life expectancy now surpassing 78 years, up from less than 74 years in 1980. But we are not necessarily living better. The incidence of a variety of chronic diseases, like diabetes and heart disease, has also been growing dramatically, particularly among people who are not yet elderly.

description: When sports fans think of game-used memorabilia, baseball bats, hockey sticks and jerseys come to mind. In tennis, players, not teams or leagues, control many of the rights to their gear, and they have not been selling much of it.

title: Massachusetts: Sex Change Is Ordered for Inmate
description: A federal judge in Boston on Tuesday ordered the Massachusetts Department of Correction to provide an inmate with a sex change. Doctors for Michelle L. Kosilek, a transsexual prisoner who was convicted of murdering his wife in 1990, say gender reassignment surgery is the only way to treat his severe gender identity disorder. Corrections officials had denied the surgery, saying that it could create security problems. In his decision, Judge Mark L. Wolf found that the denial of the surgery, which would be financed with state taxes, amounted to a violation of the Eighth Amendment, which prohibits cruel and unusual punishment. He is believed to be the first federal judge to order gender reassignment. Mr. Kosilek is serving a life sentence without parole. He sued the Department of Corrections over the matter in 2000.

title: Martin OMalleys Speech at the D.N.C.
description: Governor Martin OMalley of Maryland spoke about the differences between President Obama and Mitt Romney at the 2012 Democratic National Convention.

title: Pentagon Says Book Contains Classified Information
description: The Pentagon press secretary, George Little, said on Tuesday that the Defense Department believed there was classified information in a new first-person account of the raid that killed Osama bin Laden. Mr. Little did not specify what the information was or do more than repeat threats of legal action. The book, No Easy Day, written by a former member of the Navy SEALs, Matt Bissonnette, with a co-author, Kevin Maurer, went on sale on Tuesday. Pentagon officials say Mr. Bissonnette violated nondisclosure agreements he signed with the government, but Mr. Bissonnette and his lawyer say he did not. Penguin, the publisher, is printing 575,000 hardcover copies, placing No Easy Day among the biggest books of the year.

title: Hong Kong Airline Bans Shark Fin as Cargo
description: HONG KONG  Cathay Pacific, responding to pressure from an array of environmental groups in Asia, has announced that it will no longer carry shark fin on its cargo flights.

title: Jets Make Late Punting Switch
description: The Jets changed punters Tuesday, jettisoning T. J. Conley in favor of Robert Malone. Conleys inconsistency frustrated the Jets, whose hope for a spirited competition in training camp never materialized. After Conley beat out two challengers, Travis Baltz and Spencer Lanning, the Jets went with Malone, who ranked higher in both yards per punt (44.8 to 44.0) and net average (39.9 to 37.9) during the preseason. Malone, released two weeks ago by San Diego, has appeared in 13 N.F.L. games across the past two seasons with Tampa Bay and Detroit. The Jets also swapped defensive tackles, waiving Isaako Aaitui and re-signing Marcus Dixon.

title: News Quiz | September 5, 2012

title: Sharp Criticism for Mamata Banerjee in Muslim Officers Book

title: The Obamas Party
description: After Ann Romney spoke in Tampa, Fla., last week, much of the next days conversation revolved around whether the convention organizers had made a big mistake by having her precede Chris Christie to the lectern. Her speech was praised to the skies, his was criticized for being self-serving and self-absorbed  and by leaving the last word to the New Jersey governor, critics argued, the convention swept the spotlight off her husband and undercut the power of her pitch.

title: Relations Between India and Sri Lanka Sour
description: Last week, while traveling down the coast of Tamil Nadu for  my article about the fishing wars between India and Sri Lanka, I noticed pilgrims walking along the side of the road. They trudged along, despite the heat, as they walked kilometers on a pilgrimage to Christian shrines in the state of Tamil Nadu. What I had not realized is that some of the pilgrims visiting the state were from Sri Lanka.

title: Did Barack Obama Save Ohio?
description: The way John Kasich sees it, he is fulfilling a grand design, a mission for which he was chosen by God, to save Ohio. Its like what whats-his-name told the hobbit, Ohios Republican governor told me as we flew on the plane that ferries him around the state. Whats that guys name? Gandel? Gandorf? A pair of young aides seated across from Kasich called out helpfully over the drone of the engine. Gandalf, Kasich repeated. Do you remember what he told the hobbit?

title: Aggressive on Abortion
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C.The Democratic Party emphasized abortion rights on the first day of the convention, with a video on reproductive choice, remarks from Nancy Keenan, the president of NARAL, and an aggressive aside from Deval Patrick, the Governor of Massachusetts, on the partys pro-choice record.

title: Concerning the Pitter-Patter of Tiny Feet
description: Dear Diary:

title: Daily Report: Facebook Tries to Lift Stock Price
description: Facebook is taking steps to stabilize its stock, which has lost more than half its value since the companys public offering in May, Somini Sengupta reports in Wednesdays New York Times.

title: Sharply Drawn
description: In his East Village studio, the artist Jeremy Everett puts on a solo show in falls svelte new overcoats. More

title: A Closer Look at Jobs Claims
description: One of the more frequently cited statistics at the Democratic National Convention on Tuesday was the claim that the United States has added 4.5 million private-sector jobs since the beginning of 2010  but the figure does not tell the whole story of the labor market under President Obama.

title: Amid Hacker Attacks, Security Start-Ups Draw Attention
description: As hacker attacks swell, so do the fortunes of security start-ups.

title: In Latest Update, Leapster Adds More Power
description: The Leapster game system from LeapFrog has undergone several revisions over the years. This summer, it slimmed down while gaining a bit of muscle.

title: Wednesday Reading: When Restaurant Prices Vary by Reservation Time
description: A variety of consumer-focused articles appears daily in The New York Times and on our blogs. Each weekday morning, we gather them together here so you can quickly scan the news that could hit you in your wallet.

title: R.B.S. Insurance Unit to Cut 900 Jobs
description: LONDON  The insurance unit of the Royal Bank of Scotland plans to cut almost 900 jobs as it looks to reduce costs ahead of an initial public offering.

title: Clip: Keep the Lights On
description: A scene from Ira Sachss film Keep the Lights On, about a couple in a dysfunctional relationship, featuring Thure Lindhardt and Zachary Booth.

title: Lord & Taylor Owner Hudsons Bay Explores I.P.O.
description: Two of the oldest department store chains in North America are on the verge of a public stock listing.

title: Still No New Pynchon Photo, but Heres Emily Dickinson
description: In her own words, Emily Dickinson said she was small, like the wren; and my hair is bold, like the chestnut burr; and my eyes, like the sherry in the glass that the guest leaves. (She also had a strange propensity for accepting rides from carriage drivers who are the physical embodiment of Death.) But what did that celebrated Massachusetts poet, who died in 1886  long before the ubiquity of Instagram  actually look like? Until now only one authenticated portrait of Dickinson as an adult, a daguerreotype showing her sitting upright in a chair, was known to exist. But as The Guardian reports, a second image of Dickinson, with a smile on her face and a friend by her side, may have been confirmed.

title: What Were Reading
description: Slate: A gravely obsessive Pepperidge Farm fan samples every variety of the labels cookies and emerges with alarming insights like this: I dont quite understand how a Milano slice is really a Milano  it would seem an open-faced Milano would be a contradiction in terms, seeing as the sandwich structure of the original is the defining feature. Willie Wonka, meet Jacques Derrida.  Patrick Farrell

title: Canine Conservationists on the Move
description: The high energy levels of many dogs in animal shelters can be off-putting to some people seeking to adopt one as a family pet. When that happens, the dogs can end up as candidates for euthanasia. But wildlife conservationists have found a way to capitalize on that intensity, enlisting canines to track threatened species and thereby help protect ecosystems.

title: The Breakfast Meeting: A Fall Book Bonanza and the New Cosmo Girl
description: The book industry is looking forward to some good news for a change. This fall, the big publishers are unleashing a murderers row of authors  including Salman Rushdie, Zadie Smith and Junot Daz  in what it hopes will be a huge season. The two biggest swings: Tom Wolfe writing his first novel in eight years and a work of adult fiction by J.K. Rowling, the creator of Harry Potter.

title: Obama Convention Speech Moved From Stadium
description: 11:09 a.m. | Updated CHARLOTTE, N.C.  President Obamas plans to deliver his acceptance speech on Thursday evening at an outdoor stadium rally has been foiled by a forecast of rain and heavy thunderstorms, aides said Wednesday, forcing organizers to scramble and move the final night of the Democratic National Convention indoors.

title: Greenhill Expands Capital Advisory Group
description: Greenhill & Company, the boutique investment bank, is building up its division for private equity and real estate clients as it turns to new sources of revenue.

title: Microsoft and Nokia Unveil New Lumia Phones
description: 12:39 p.m. | Updated  Adding market and analyst reaction.

title: Why Not Carry Different E-Book Readers?
description: From my e-mail bag:

title: Wheelies: The Transatlantic Crossing Edition
description: In which we bring you motoring news from around the Web:

title: Key Figure in Scandal That Felled Bo Xilai Is Charged
description: BEIJING  The once-powerful police officer at the center of a scandal that felled the senior Communist leader Bo Xilai was charged Wednesday with defection, abuse of power and corruption.

title: A Real Tea Party
description: Now that Schoolhouse Rock! is no longer around to whip young children into heady waves of patriotism, nonfiction picture books are doing the job  only far more accurately and without putting songs in your head.

title: Kurds and (the Turkish) Way
description: ISTANBUL  When I first started covering Turkey in the early 1990s, my foreign colleagues and I were sometimes mocked for referring to the brewing resentment in southeastern Turkey as the Kurdish problem. There was no sectarian or ethnic discrimination, we were told; the problem was terrorism. The Kurdistan Workers Party, better known as the PKK, resorted to violence and extortion, which no civilized society could abide.

title: A Tool for Those Who Fall Behind on Student Debt
description: Have you fallen behind on your student loan payments? The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau this summer introduced an online tool to help you evaluate your options.

title: Michelle Obamas Dress in High Definition
description: IT says a lot about politics today that it was possible, during a speech by Michelle Obama that was described as genius for its subtlety by both David Brooks and Mark Shields, that a parallel conversation was happening online, and in real time, about her shimmering brocade dress and matching fingernails. If you were following along on Twitter, where comments reportedly reached a peak of 28,000 a minute by the end of her speech, you might wonder how many people were really listening to what she was saying.

title: Shifting Views on Climate Change
description: President Obama and his Republican challenger, Mitt Romney, have spelled out their views on climate change in a bit more detail than they usually do on the campaign trail in response to questions from a group of scientific organizations.

title: Roundabout to Revive Talleys Folly in February
description: A revival of Lanford Wilsons two-character romance Talleys Folly will be part of the Roundabout Theater Companys 2012-13 season, the theater announced on Wednesday.

title: Stereotypes in Toeshoes
description: Calendars for the coming ballet season have now been announced across much of America. As usual, story ballets abound. But what stories do they tell? Narrative ballet remains a heritage park: an Old World never-never land. How many of us would actually like to inhabit those onstage worlds? Which choreographers are telling stories for our time?

title: Desert Stories: Claire Vaye Watkins Talks About Battleborn
description: Claire Vaye Watkinss first book, Battleborn, a collection of short stories, arrives with notable provenance (the stories originally appeared in The Paris Review and elsewhere) and an unusually compelling author biography. Ms. Watkinss father, Paul Watkins, was once a member of Charles Mansons family. In Vincent Bugliosis Helter Skelter, hes described as a good-looking youth with a way with women who had been Mansons chief procurer of young girls. In a recent e-mail interview, Ms. Watkins discussed learning about her fathers life, the hold Nevada has on her imagination, her obsessive and controlling sense of play when she was a child and more. Below are edited excerpts from the conversation:

title: Q&A: Setting Up A Wireless Printer
description: Q.

title: In China, Drogba Draws Crowds and Controversy
description: BEIJING  With five defenders smothering him at the top of the penalty box, Didier Drogba, the former star player for Chelsea in Englands Premier League, calmly slid a lead pass to his new Shanghai Shenhua teammate Cao Yunding, who was dashing full-speed through the box. The nifty pass caught the defenders and the goalkeeper off guard. With a near-open net, Drogbas teammate hesitated, perhaps perplexed by how easy it had seemed, then fired the ball past the dumbstruck goalkeeper.

title: Eating Where It Feels Like Home (But You Dont Have to Do the Dishes)
description: The cookbook author and New York Times food writer Mark Bittman has had enough of white-tablecloth restaurants, he writes. He wants his own place, wherever he is in the world, and hes got some specific requirements for it:

title: Marriage Equality Goes Prime Time
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C.

title: At the Democratic Convention, an Emphasis on Social Issues
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C.  On Monday night, Michelle Obama told the nation that her husband wants everyone to succeed no matter who we love.

title: Tiger Triplets Make Their Debut in the Bronx
description: It is a busy time for local youngsters. Just as the citys children prepare to go back to school, three 4-month-old Siberian tiger cubs made their debut on Wednesday at the Bronx Zoo (see video below or click here).

title: New Yorker Festival to Include Cloud Atlas Premiere
description: The first United States showing of the film version of Cloud Atlas  as well as a rare showing-up by its co-directors Andy and Lana Wachowski  will be one of the marquee events of the 2012 New Yorker Festival. On Wednesday organizers announced the lineup for the annual festival, which runs this year from Oct. 5 through 7 and features public events with various cultural luminaries and contributors to The New Yorker magazine. Among its highlights is a premiere screening of Cloud Atlas, adapted from the David Mitchell novel, followed by a conversation with the Wachowski siblings (The Matrix, Speed Racer) and their co-director, Tom Tykwer. (The Cloud Atlas team will be interviewed by Aleksandar Hemon, who wrote about them in this weeks issue of The New Yorker.)

title: Business and Pleasure
description: In Atlanta, where hip-hop rubs up against notorious strip clubs, rappers who want to make it big get their start by making it rain.

title: Image of the Day: September 5
Bespoke Tailors in New York
description: Designers like Martin Greenfield and Peter Frew charge thousands of dollars for a single custom-made suit. So why arent they rich?

title: What Should the President Say?
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C.Only 38 percent of respondents in a new Gallup poll said Mitt Romneys performance at the Republican Convention was good or excellent, the lowest approval rating for any presidential candidates acceptance speech since Gallup started asking the question.

title: Breaking It Down: Ferrer vs. Gasquet
description: In Malcolm Gladwells 2005 best-seller, Blink, he focused on the subject of thin-slicing  the ability to understand what is important from an extremely narrow moment in time.

title: Why the Minimum Wage Doesnt Explain Stagnant Wages
description: Until the mid-1980s, only a single state  and one of the smallest in population, Alaska  had set a minimum wage higher than the federal minimum. But with the federal minimum remaining unchanged at $3.35 an hour for most of the 1980s, more states began to set higher floors for wages.

title: Start-Up Offers a New Way to Shop for Office Supplies
description: The renaissance of e-commerce has brought us new ways to shop for pants, diapers and eyeglasses. Next up: office supplies.

title: Yankees Borrow a Page From the Mets
description: In New York, its the Mets who normally have a copyright on collapses. They fell apart after the All-Star break this season, going 11-29; they blew an easy shot at the postseason in 2008 with some unbelievable bullpen mayhem in the final weeks of September; and they made history by blowing a seven-game division lead with 17 games to go in 2007.

title: Obama Counts on Clinton to Help Sway Independents
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C.  Former President Bill Clinton tried to rebut Republican arguments against the re-election of President Obama in a major speech at the Democratic National Convention Wednesday night, saying Mr. Obama has taken steps to turn around an economy left in shambles by Republicans.

title: Pruning Hedge Fund Regulation Without Cultivating Better Rules
description: Fresh from having declined to constrain money market funds, the Securities and Exchange Commission has moved to loosen marketing constraints on hedge funds.

title: Video of Quebec Gunmans Rant After Shooting at Separatist Rally
description: As my colleague Ian Austen reports, the leader of Canadas separatist Parti Qubcois was hustled offstage during a speech after her partys victory in a provincial election Tuesday night when a 62-year-old man opened fire outside the rally, leaving one man dead and another in critical condition.

title: Safeway Plans I.P.O. of Gift Card Unit
description: Safeway, the supermarket chain based in California, said on Wednesday that it planned to file for an initial public offering of a minority stake in its fast-growing gift card unit, Blackhawk Network Holdings. Shares of Safeway were up 5 percent by midday.

title: The Get | Van Cleef & Arpels Touch Wood Vintage Alhambra Pendant
description: After discovering a trove of letter wood in the attic of the brands Place Vendme maison, Van Cleef & Arpelss North America president and CEO Nicolas Bos and team decided to honor the find and use it to create the touch wood Vintage Alhambra collection. Each necklace, bracelet and earring in the collection is limited and numbered and set in rose gold  a first for the brands signature, four-leaf clover-shaped Alhambras. Its a warm color and the modern alternative to yellow gold, Bos says of the choice to use rose gold. With the wood it was an interesting feeling  more of a vintage feeling that still felt like a very new combination. Charmed, for sure!

title: Polls: Little to No Bounce for Romney
description: Several new polls show that in the immediate days after the Republican National Convention, Mitt Romney, the Republican presidential nominee, did not see much of a boost to his campaign, although slightly more Americans now see him as someone who can understand the needs of the middle class.

title: Lincolns Handwitten Draft of the Emancipation Proclamation Is Coming to Harlem
description: The Schomburg Center for Research in Black Culture in Harlem will be the first stop for the New York State Museums traveling exhibition of the only surviving draft of the preliminary Emancipation Proclamation in Abraham Lincolns handwriting.

title: Barbara Marcus to Lead Random House Childrens Books
description: Barbara Marcus, the childrens publishing veteran who acquired the seven Harry Potter books when she was an executive at Scholastic, has been chosen to lead Random House Childrens Books, the company announced on Wednesday.

title: The Envelope, Please: Candice Childress
description: Candice Childress, a student at Las Vegas Academy of International Studies, Visual and Performing Arts in Nevada, is one of eight high school seniors who are blogging about their college searches.

title: Folk Art Museum Picks New Director
description: The American Folk Art Museum in New York, which almost went out of business last year because of financial struggles, has appointed a new director, the museum announced Wednesday.

title: How Hard Is It to Make a $4,000 Suit?
description: When the rich get richer, luxury-goods proprietors often see their fortunes rise, too. (For evidence, check out the decidedly pre-Lehmanesqueheft of the September issue of Vogue.) But as Adam Davidson notes in this weeks column, bespoke suit makers, maybe the worlds second-oldest profession, are struggling to survive. This is puzzling on a number of levels, the most obvious of which is that there are huge markets of wealthy guys who care about whether their jacket is double-breasted or single-vented, and for whom $4,000 is not an ungodly sum to spend on a garment. So why wouldnt they want the best possible value for their dollar  a suit hand-sewn just for them?

title: Publishing Stardom for an Ex-Navy SEAL
description: Business Day Live: Publishing stardom for an ex-Navy SEAL member. | Generating new revenue at the U.S. Open.

title: Surprise! More Rain at the Open
description: 1:10 p.m. | Updated Play has begun on all the feature courts, with Maria Sharapova playing Marion Bartoli on Ashe Stadium and Sarah Errani playing her fellow Italian Roberto Vinci in Armstrong Stadium.

title: Business Day Live: Bin Laden Book Release Moved Up

title: Europe to Investigate Chinese Exports of Solar Panels
description: CHENGDU, China  Defying Chinese threats of retaliation against European wines and industrial materials, the European Union is preparing to begin on Thursday morning a broad investigation into whether Chinese companies have been exporting solar panels for less than it costs to make them.

title: Real Life Intrudes
description: Dealing with matters filial. I will try to put up a couple of posts, but limited time and access.

title: MoNique  Lends Support to  Ailey Gala
description: The actress and comedian MoNique will serve as the honorary chairwoman of Alvin Ailey American Dance Theaters gala benefit performance on Nov. 28. The evening will kick off the companys five-week season at City Center and will also feature Aileys signature 1960 work Revelations, with special guest musicians. Featured vocalists will include the Tony Award-winning actors and singers Audra McDonald, Brian Stokes Mitchell and Anika Noni Rose. Ticket and additional information is available at www.alvinailey.org.

title: W Hotels Seek to Attract Local Residents, Too
description: W Hotels has announced that 11 of its 28 North American properties are undergoing a $100 million renovation, the biggest overhaul in the nearly 15-year history of the brand. But guests arent the only ones in mind: much of the change is focused on public spaces.

title: How to See Falls Leaves for Less
description: IT feels like summer in the Northeast, but if you have yet to make reservations for a fall foliage getaway, youre behind schedule.

title: A Sandal Samaritan
description: Dear Diary:

title: Bits of Mystery DNA, Far From Junk, Play Crucial Role
description: Among the many mysteries of human biology is why complex diseases like diabetes, high blood pressure and psychiatric disorders are so difficult to predict and, often, to treat. An equally perplexing puzzle is why one individual gets a disease like cancer or depression, while an identical twin remains perfectly healthy.

title: Close Encounters With Homo Sapiens Closest Kin
description: In recent months Ive become familiar with the work of the nonprofit group Seacology, which scours the world for opportunities to conserve island ecosystems and cultures. Investments are made in infrastructure  from solar panels to school equipment or medical clinics  in return for community commitments to protect environmental assets. Duane Silverstein, the groups executive director since 1999, recently sent a Dot Earth postcard following a visit to two different projects in sub-Saharan Africa working to conserve Homo sapiens primate kin, chimpanzees and gorillas:

title: McDonalds Vegetarian Restaurants: Latest in Long, Tough Battle to Woo India
description: The announcement by McDonalds on Tuesday that it would open a few vegetarian-only restaurants in India next year marks the fast-food chains latest attempt to appeal to consumers in an unlikely market.

title: Newspaper Publisher Journal Register Files for Bankruptcy and Plans for a Sale
description: The Journal Register Company, whose newspapers include The New Haven Register and The Trentonian, has again filed for bankruptcy protection and hopes for a quick sale, said Digital First Media, which operates the company along with the MediaNews Group.

title: Ryan Cites Policy Kinship With Bill Clinton
description: ADEL, Iowa  From tying President Obama to the economic stagnation under one former president, Jimmy Carter, the Romney-Ryan campaign has moved on to offering rosy recollections of another Democrat in the White House, Bill Clinton. In both cases the aim is to paint an unflattering contrast with Mr. Obama.

title: Wicksell Goes To China
description: The idea that we are at the mercy of the Chinese  that terrible things would happen if they stopped buying our bonds  is very influential. Yet its just wrong.

title: Survey Deems JPMorgans Investment Bank Best Place to Work
description: A multibillion-dollar trading loss and multiple regulatory investigations apparently havent made life too miserable at JPMorgan Chase.

title: Volkswagen Previews Redesigned Golf Ahead of Paris Motor Show
description: The Golf, the backbone of Volkswagens global product lineup since its debut in 1974, with more than 29 million units sold, has received a complete redesign for the 2014 model year. The seventh generation of the Golf was unveiled in an elaborate ceremony on Monday in Berlin, at the citys Neue Nationalgalerie.

title: In Clinton and Warren, Competing Messages for the Middle Class
description: If youre a candidate for president, the convention affords you a fleeting window of opportunity, about three hours total of network airtime, to present speakers who will get across your one central message to the wide section of America. In the case of this Democratic convention, though, Wednesdays lineup reveals the essential dilemma that has often made President Obamas re-election campaign, and much of his presidency, seem as muddled as a Clint Eastwood monologue.

title: Former Goldman Executive Joins Strategic Value Partners
description: Stephen J. McGuinness, the former co-chief operating officer of Goldman Sachs Asset Management, has joined the investment firm Strategic Value Partners as a senior managing director.

title: The New Season in Theater: Fall 2012
description: A look at some of the seasons new shows.

title: The UndocuBus
description: The UndocuBus, a rolling platform for immigration activism, painted aqua and covered with butterflies, has reached Charlotte, N.C., after more than a month on the road. It started in Arizona in late July and wove its way through states where there have been immigrant crackdowns: New Mexico, Colorado, Texas, Louisiana, Mississippi, Alabama, Georgia and Tennessee.

title: The New Season in Art
description: A look at artworks and exhibitions of the fall.

title: Eastwood Reconsidered
description: From a Pew Research Center poll on the viewer reactions to the G.O.P convention:

title: Michelle Obamas Children Come First. Should They?
description: At the end of the day, my most important title is still mom in chief. My daughters are still the heart of my heart and the center of my world.

title: Running a Business With Staff Scattered Around the World
description: When Ralph Dandrea needed to hire a handful of employees for his rapidly growing Web design business, he figured he would have no trouble finding information technology professionals. It was 1998, and the technology boom was in full swing. But even though Mr. Dandrea, founder and chief executive of ITX Corporation, based in Pittsford, N.Y., looked all across the country, he struggled to find candidates.

title: Viva la Villa | Palatial Near Pienza
description: Adventures in house-hunting: a writer chronicles her attempt to find the perfect home in Italy.

title: Obama Faces Test From Voters Who Drifted Away
description: Dahlgren and Robert McElwain, retired business owners who live outside Kansas City, were in agreement in 2008. Despite their nearly lifelong support of Republican candidates, they made a bold move together and cast ballots for Barack Obama, enchanted by what they saw as his intelligence and charm.

title: TimesCast Politics and Democratic Convention Day 2 at a Glance
description: 5:57 p.m. | Updated Democrats on Wednesday will try to continue to build on the energy from Tuesday nights speeches, highlighted by an emotional address from the first lady, Michelle Obama.

title: Are Your Employees Really More Productive Working at Home?
description: Ralph Dandreas company, ITX Corporation, has 128 employees but only 46 of them report to the main office in Pittsford, N.Y. The rest are scattered internationally (72 in Argentina, plus Peru, Spain, Uruguay and Venezuela) as well as in the United States (California, Missouri, Oregon, Washington, Virginia). Its a lot of fun working this way, Mr. Dandrea said. But there are always challenges.

title: A Plebe First, a Player Second
description: Larry Dixon was looking for someone to hug. He had just scored the first touchdown of his collegiate career, a 2-yard burst straight up the guts of the Tulane defense to tie the game.

title: As Iran Assists Syria, Iraqi Airspace Becomes a Diplomatic Battleground
description: Michael R. Gordon reports in Tuesdays Times that the airspace over Iraq is becoming a complicated proxy of Iraqs relations with the United States and with its neighbors across the Middle East.

title: Before Heading Into Space, Photos Will Land at Bryant Park
description: While the Curiosity rover searches the surface of Mars, an artist will be sending his own microvision of life on Earth into space this fall.

title: When Fairness Opinions Are Used Outside of Mergers
description: Jill R. Goodman is a managing director at Rothschild, where she leads the firms practice representing special committees of independent directors in M.&A. transactions.

title: Exploring Islam, Pompeii and the Factory
description: Dates and touring sites are subject to change.

title: Anna Dello Russos Fashion Shower
description: Teaser videos are the new thing in viral marketing, as H&M demonstrated with the introduction of its Lanvin collection two years ago, using clips that showed the humorous side of Alber Elbaz. But after its latest campaign, you will never look at Anna Dello Russo the same way again. Ever. Not if you poke your eyes out.

title: A Button for Every Delegate
description: Are you left-handed? A cat lover? If youre at the Democratic National Convention and you support President Obama, there is a button for you. No group is too obscure to profess support for the presidents re-election. Pearl divers, rejoice.

title: 2 Injured at Power Plant in France
description: PARIS  A steam release from a chemical reaction on Wednesday at the Fessenheim nuclear power plant, Frances oldest, gave two workers slight burns on their hands but did not cause a fire or radiation problem, government and fire officials said.

title: Motorola Introduces First Phones of Its New Google Era
description: After being quiet for nearly a year, Motorola Mobility, recently acquired by Google, is returning to the mobile market with three new smartphones.

title: Women, Women, Everywhere  but Not Much About Their Paychecks
description: The stage at the Democratic National Convention was awash in women Tuesday night. And its no wonder, since President Obama needs women desperately to win in November. Female voters tend to like Mr.Obama more than Mitt Romney  though Mr. Obamas popularity among women has fallen sharply. So women were very much in the mix. (A nifty interactive graphic on NYTimes.com shows that women was the keyword mentioned third most often Tuesday night  after Obama and work.)

title: Emanuel to Raise Money for Democratic Super PAC
description: Rahm Emanuel, the mayor of Chicago, said on Wednesday that he had stepped down from his honorary position as co-chairman of President Obamas re-election campaign to help raise money for Priorities USA Action, a super PAC founded by two former Obama aides.

title: Fashions Night Out and About
description: WHAT do Justin Bieber, Taylor Swift and Kendall Jenner have in common?

title: U.S. to Retain Role as a Jailer in Afghanistan
description: WASHINGTON  The United States military will maintain control over dozens of foreign detainees in Afghanistan for the indefinite future, even as the two countries prepare to ceremonially mark the hand-over of detention operations to the Afghan government, officials from both countries say.

title: As Arenas Go Green, Will Fans Follow?
description: Can sports make environmentalism more popular?

title: Democrats Restore Language Declaring Jerusalem Israels Capital
description: 6:43 p.m. | Updated  CHARLOTTE, N.C.  President Obama, seeking to quell a storm of criticism from Republicans and pro-Israel groups over his support for Israel, directed the Democratic Party to amend its platform to restore language declaring Jerusalem as the Israeli capital.

title: Philip Roth to Cooperate With New Biographer
description: Philip Roth has a new biographer: Blake Bailey, the author of highly regarded biographies of Richard Yates and John Cheever.  Mr. Bailey said on Wednesday that in June he and Mr. Roth signed a collaboration agreement guaranteeing him unlimited access to Mr. Roths archives and correspondence, and help in encouraging friends to cooperate, and that he had already spent several marathon sessions interviewing the 79-year-old novelist.

title: Two for the Runway
description: DURING New York Fashion Week, editors will seek standout microtrends like the long, tousled side braid of Alexander Wangs spring 2010 collection or the glowing sun-kissed complexion and feathery full brow that went with it.

title: Wacky Meets Khaki
description: UPON meeting the design duo behind the mens wear label Duckie Brown, it is hard to learn who is who. Daniel Silver and Steven Cox, who are partners in business and romance, call each other Duckie. If they use their actual names, watch out: it might get awkward.

title: Harrison Brothers Lose in Doubles Quarterfinals
description: The dream of a showdown between the Bryan brothers and the Harrison brothers at the United States Open will have to wait.

title: U.S. Open Food of the Day: Fish Tacos
description: This is the latest in our daily series of food reviews of items at the United States Open concession stands.

title: Southern Supergroup to Bring Its Barbecue to Meatopia
description: Meatopia, that nine-year-old be-in for carnophiles, is migrating to Randalls Island for the first time, anticipating 3,000 attendees this Saturday at its four-hour bacchanal of pork, beef, lamb, chicken, duck, turkey and quail.

title: Romney to Appear on Meet the Press
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C.  Mitt Romney will make his first appearance of the campaign season this Sunday on NBCs Meet the Press, a move clearly intended to thrust himself back onto the main stage of the presidential campaign after ceding it to President Obama.

title: Regulators Clarify Timing of New Derivatives Rules
description: As Wall Street gears up for an overhaul of the $600 trillion derivatives business, big banks have grumbled that regulators failed to specify when the new policies will take effect.

title: On The Road With Uber
description: After 23 years, Shadid Mahmood traded in his cab to work for Uber, a start-up company that runs an app to help people hail cars more efficiently.

title: Scouting Report
description: OPENINGS

title: Todays Scuttlebot: New Raspberry Pi and Revamping Google
description: Some interesting items that the tech reporters and editors of The New York Times found on the Web recently. See more here.

title: Wearing Two Uniforms at West Point
description: Athletes at West Point, like running back Larry Dixon, have to adjust to the speed of the college game and to the rules and traditions of a military academy.

title: A Christian Album Tops the Charts
description: For the first time in 15 years, a Christian album is No. 1 on the Billboard chart.

title: Apple Denies Giving F.B.I. Device Information
description: Apple on Wednesday denied claims thatit had worked with the government to share millions of device identification numbers, aday after the hackinggroup known asAntiSec claimed to have obtained numbers from an F.B.I. laptop.

title: What the Democrats Didnt Say
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C.  After years of waiting for Democrats to acknowledge President Obamas pre-eminent achievement  health care reform  it was good to hear them talk about it with pride from the convention stage on Tuesday night. Speaker after speaker reminded the audience of the law, vigorously refuting the Republican dogma that it is an Orwellian disaster.

title: Bank of America Adopts Simpler Checking Account Disclosure
description: Bank of America recently became the last of the three biggest United States banks to adopt simplified checking account disclosures, as advocated by an arm of the Pew Charitable Trusts.

title: Consumers Say No to Mobile Apps That Grab Too Much Data
description: The Federal Trade Commission on Wednesday nudged application developers to take steps to protect consumer privacy. But many consumers seem to be already taking steps to guard their personal information from data-grabbing apps.

title: An Award for Oscar de la Renta
description: A week after Ann Romney wore a cherry red Oscar de la Renta dress to deliver her speech at the Republican National Convention, the designer himself was being honored with a lifetime achievement award at Lincoln Center.

title: Scene City: A New Benefit in the Hamptons Ecosystem
description: Cindy Sherman hosts the inaugural fundraiser for the Azuero Earth Project.

title: Leaving a Footprint for a Cause
description: THE word sustainable has become very popular in recent years, almost as popular as benefit parties in the Hamptons. Last Saturday, the Azuero Earth Project, a nonprofit organization with the lofty mission of preserving the earths ecosystems and protecting biodiversity, broke into the very competitive fund-raising ecosystem of East Hampton.

title: Engine Coolant Leak Prompts 3rd Recall of 2013 Ford Escape
description: Ford is recalling about 6,100 of its 2013 Escape crossovers because a coolant leak may cause fires, the automaker told the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration. It is the third recall of the redesigned Escape and the second involving a fire risk.

title: For Blue Dog PAC, Cash but Few Candidates
description: The super PAC supporting Blue Dog candidates has a problem that on the surface would seem enviable: tons of cash on hand! But the reason is one no one would wish for a group  it does not have enough viable candidates to support.

title: Greek Government and Public at Odds Over New Cuts
description: ATHENS  Anastasia Kastaniotou, a struggling mother of three, stood near the Greek Parliament building on Wednesday and threw up her hands as she contemplated an 11.5 billion austerity package that her countrys government was trying to tie up this week to keep Greece in the euro.

title: Excluded From Democratic Convention List, Liu Tours Asia
description: SEOUL, South Korea  Two months ago, John C. Liu, New York Citys comptroller, said he was heartbroken that the states top Democrats, skittish about a federal investigation into his campaign fund-raising, had excluded him from their delegate list to the Democratic National Convention.

title: Photos of The Moment | Organic by John Patrick
description: var data;function jsonSlideshowCallback(response){data = response;}NYTD.options = {source: data,cropType: 'blog480',appendTo: 'fullScreenSlideShow',showHeadLine: 'false', renderstyle: "embeddedSlideShowTmag"}

title: Great Free Web Sites for Teaching Election 2012
description: If youre like us, you see the election everywhere on the Web. But finding useful Web sites for teaching the election? Thats a different story.

title: Bill Clinton in 1988
description: Bill Clinton gave the nominating speech for Michael Dukakis in 1988.

title: Congresswoman Time-Travels, and Eyebrows Are Raised
President of Madison Square Garden Sports Leaving Post
description: Scott ONeil, an energetic executive who helped stabilize the Knicks after the controversy and tumult of the Isiah Thomas era, has left his post as president of Madison Square Garden Sports, after only four years on the job.

title: Egyptian President Warns Assad That Your Time Wont Be Long
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  President Mohamed Morsi of Egypt on Wednesday warned the Syrian president, Bashar al-Assad, that your time wont be long, as Syrian warplanes and artillery shelled the battleground city of Aleppo and opposition groups reported heavy fighting around the Euphrates River city of Deir el-Zour.

title: Shell to Test Capturing of Carbon in Canada
description: HOUSTON  In a bid to make oil sands production less polluting, Royal Dutch Shell announced on Wednesday that it would go forward with the first carbon capture and storage project ever tried in the fields of western Canada.

title: Leaning Into the Learning Curve
description: GOTHENBURG, Sweden  From the moment my dad bought me my first pair of cleats (he actually called them spikes, thanks to his running background  at least he didnt call them boots) and shin guards, I have been bombarded with instructions and advice. Some things Ive learned from coaches, videos and various experts have stuck with me over the years, and others Ive chosen to throw by the wayside. In the spirit of my love of lists, heres another!

title: Al Jazeera Wrests Back Its Web Sites From Pro-Assad Hackers
description: Updated | 6:15 p.m. Hackers said to be supporters of the Syrian government temporarily seized control of the Arabic and English news sites of Al Jazeera, the Qatari satellite network, which has been accused of bias in favor of protesters and rebels by the government of President Bashar al-Assad and its supporters.

title: Pictures of the Day: South Africa and Elsewhere
description: Photos from South Africa, Syria, Portugal and India.

title: Highlights and Analysis: Cowboys 24, Giants 17
description: Follow this post for live updates and analysis of the N.F.L.s opening night game between the Dallas Cowboys and the Giants from The Timess Justin Sablich, who also provides fantasy football advice on The Fifth Down. Follow Sablich on Twitter at @JSablichNYT and @5thDownFantasy.

title: Is the Venue Change Good for Obama?
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C.  Obama campaign aides are mightily disappointed that a bad weather forecast has forced them to cancel President Obamas plan to deliver his acceptance speech at a stadium, just as he did in Denver in 2008. Instead hell speak indoors at the smaller Time Warner Cable Arena.

title: The Caucus Click: Gabby Douglas at the D.N.C.
Reaping Secrets Ancestors Sowed
description: The slaves stand around the Louisiana plantation house wearing tattered calico and head scarves. Theyre greeting party guests at Belle Vie, an antebellum manse turned tourist attraction. For $10.75 an hour, its not bad work.

title: Sharapova Advances, With Rain to Rescue
description: Rain may have made a mess of the United States Open for many players, but Maria Sharapova is a big fan.

title: Kaushik Basu Named to World Bank Post
description: On Wednesday, the World Bank announced its new chief economist: Kaushik Basu, a Cornell University economist and the former chief economic adviser to the Indian ministry of finance.

title: Warhol Foundation Will Donate or Sell Its Whole Collection
description: Beginning this fall the Andy Warhol Foundation for the Visual Arts will disperse its entire collection of Warhols, donating some and selling others through Christies auction house as it shifts almost exclusively into a grant-making organization, foundation officials said in interviews.

title: Bill Clintons Night at the D.N.C.
description: Amy Chozik of The New York Times talks about how this moment will highlight just how far Former President Bill Clinton has come to restore his relationship with the Democratic Party.

title: Bill Clinton in 1992
description: Bill Clinton accepted his nomination at the 1992 Democratic National Convention.

title: The No-Waste, More-Work Lunch Box
description: Whats in your childs lunch box? If youre a good parent, that lunch meets all of the big three requirements: its healthy, no-waste and allergen-free. The classic brown-paper-bag lunch of your childhood (P.B. & J. on white, chips, Twinkie, soda) is so last-century. Its not just the nutrition-free content, its the packaging. (Although a few weeks of that lunch would surely get you a note from the school politely suggesting that less sugar might make for more learning.)

description: The new Fox series starts on Sept. 17.
