description: Images of some of the classical music performers this season.

title: Video View of an Endangered Program Cutting Energy Waste
description: I first got to know the photography of Joshua Wolfe through his collaboration with Gavin Schmidt, the NASA climate scientist and RealClimate blogger, on Climate Change: Picturing the Science.

title: On Our Radar: Tar Balls on the Gulf Coast
description: The state of Louisiana closes a 12-mile section of the gulf coastline after Hurricane Isaac washes up oil and tar balls in an area that was a hot spot for inundations of oil during the Deepwater Horizon spill of 2010. Testing must be conducted to verify that the oil is from the Macondo well; if it is, BP will have to help finance the cleanup, officials say. Meanwhile, Greenpeace photographs oil washing up in Alabama and Mississippi. [The Times-Picayune, Greenpeace]

title: John F. Stacks, Writer and Editor, Dies at 70
description: John F. Stacks, a former reporter and senior editor at Time magazine and the author of a well-regarded biography of James B. Reston, the influential editor and columnist for The New York Times, died on Tuesday in Manhattan. He was 70.

title: Art Modell, Influential N.F.L. Owner but Not Always Beloved One, Dies at 87
description: Art Modell, who helped make professional football more popular than baseball and rich beyond its wildest dreams but who broke Clevelands heart by killing his money-losing team, the Browns, to give birth to the Baltimore Ravens, died on Thursday in Baltimore. He was 87.

title: Buoyed by European Commitment to Buy Debt, Markets Soar to a Four-Year High
description: Decisive moves by the head of the European Central Bank to preserve the euro zone pushed the benchmark American stock index to a four-year high and fueled hopes that the rally would have staying power.

title: Danish Art-Rock, and Beethoven, Too
description: THINK of the new concert season at the Metropolitan Museum of Art as the Met Remixed. Limor Tomer, who was appointed in 2011 to run the museums concerts and lectures department, has already staged several concerts at the museum, most notably a 10th-anniversary commemoration of the Sept. 11 terrorist attacks and a celebration in April of the composer Philip Glass and the violinist Timothy Fain in the Temple of Dendur. But the season about to open is the first she planned fully.

title: 36 Hours in Galway, Ireland
description: FREQUENTLY called Irelands most Irish city, this coastal metropolis is a place where Celtic culture and literature have long thrived, often in the traditional Gaelic language. But these days youre just as likely to hear Spanish, Polish or Japanese along Galways crowded streets in this increasingly international college town (the National University of Ireland, Galway, is here). While the fall is less crowded than the tourist-clogged summer, Galways festival culture keeps going strong, with the 10,000-person Galway International Oyster and Seafood Festival in late September and the Galway Theater Festival in early October, to name just two events. Of course, the citys notoriously lively pubs can provide a few pints and plenty of craic (Irish slang for a good time) any night of the year.

title: A Rare Breed: New Operas at the Met
description: ON Oct. 23 the Metropolitan Opera will offer something that has been too infrequent during Peter Gelbs six years as general manager: a new production of an opera by a living composer.

title: Going to Galway, Ireland
description: An ancient arch, shopping on Shop Street and pints at a former dance hall in this city on the countrys western coast.

title: A Watershed Moment For Early Music
description: THE early-music culture skirmish is long over. Proponents of historically informed performances have won, their movement now in the mainstream and their anti-Romantic, anti-self-indulgent principles apparent everywhere.

title: Excerpt: 'Go On'
description: The new NBC series starts on Sept. 12.

title: Spotlight Illuminates Work by 2 Composers
description: APART from dark, tousled hair; a taste for fashionably understated eyewear; and a knack for overturning musical conventions, the composers David T. Little and Olga Neuwirth do not seem to have much in common. Mr. Little, a 33-year-old American composer based in Weehawken, N.J., is known for bracing, rock-infused, politically pointed works; Ms. Neuwirth, 44 and Austrian, is among Europes leading postmodernists, with operas, orchestral works and chamber pieces that demonstrate a formidable grasp of history and technique.

title: An Art Scene Blooms in a Toronto Neighborhood
description: Industrial spaces are turning into galleries in once-neglected Bloordale Village.

title: A Way With Bach, Or Two Or Three
description: THE pianist Angela Hewitt, a wonderful Bach interpreter, once said that the greatest compliment about her playing had come from her father, who said: I didnt hear you. I only heard Bach.

title: Image of the Day: September 6
What to See Next? Gaze at the Horizons
description: What should I see?

title: Fore!
description: This issues artist-created T comes from the 81-year-old conceptual artist John Baldessari, who took inspiration from his days as a grade-school art teacher. Instead of gluing beans or macaroni onto construction paper, he used golf tees, which, he readily admits, made for a bad pun: a T made of tees. The ideal form of this T, he says, would be that every copy of T magazine would have real tees glued onto it. But this is as close as I can come. Its kind of like trompe loeil tees.

title: First-Week Lessons: How to Breathe and Wait for the Bathroom
description: At Harlem Village Academies off East 120th Street, the second stop on Schools Chancellor Dennis M. Walcotts back-to-school tour, Mr. Walcott spent some time helping kindergartners draw and leading a ninth-grade English class in a discussion of the question, Is man a victim or agent of his fate?

title: World Premiere by Craig Lucas Added to Atlantic Theater Company Season
description: The Lying Lesson, a new play about a movie star who may or may not be Bette Davis, written by the Pulitzer Prize finalist Craig Lucas (Prelude to a Kiss), will have its world premiere off Broadway this winter at Atlantic Theater Company, executives for the organization announced on Thursday.

title: What Obama Should Say
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C.Yesterday I asked readers what Obama should say tonight at the Democratic Convention. Heres a small selection of their responses. (To see the rest, go to the comments section of the original article.)

title: Not a Cancer Survivor
description: I am not a cancer survivor, and neither are the women in my cancer support group.

title: The House That Hova Built
description: Its difficult to know what to ask a rapper. Its not unlike the difficulty (I imagine) of being a rapper. Whatever you say must be considered from at least three angles, and its an awkward triangulation. In one corner you have your hard-core hip-hop heads; the type for whom the true Jay-Z will forever be that gifted 25-year-old with rapid-fire flow, trading verses with the visionary teenager Big L  Im so ahead of my time, my parents havent met yet!  on a rare (easily dug up on YouTube) seven-minute freestyle from 1995. Meanwhile, over here stands the pop-rap fan. She loves the Jiggaman with his passion for the Empire State Building and bold claims to Run This Town. Finally, in the crowded third corner, stand the many people who feel rap is not music at all but rather a form of social problem. They have only one question to ask a rapper, and it concerns his choice of vocabulary. (Years pass. The question never changes.) How to speak to these audiences simultaneously? Anyway: Im at a little table in a homey Italian restaurant on Mulberry Street waiting for Mr. Shawn Carter, who has perfected the art of triangulation. Its where he likes to eat his chicken parms.

title: Its Official: Facebook Closes Its Acquisition of Instagram
description: 11:50 a.m. | Updated  Adding details.

title: The Family Barge, Minus a Flotilla of Personal Technology
description: DEARBORN, Mich.  Its one thing to take a 41-year-old station wagon for a Sunday drive, quite another to put it on the road for a six-day, 1,400-mile family vacation.

title: Soldiering Amid Hyacinths and Horror
description: Kevin Powers joined the Army when he was 17 and served as a machine-gunner in Iraq in 2004 and 2005. Drawing upon those experiences, he has written a remarkable first novel, one that stands with Tim OBriens enduring Vietnam book, The Things They Carried, as a classic of contemporary war fiction.

title: Film Is Dead? Long Live Movies
description: IN the beginning there was light that hit a strip of flexible film mechanically running through a camera. For most of movie history this is how moving pictures were created: light reflected off people and things would filter through a camera and physically transform emulsion. After processing, that light-kissed emulsion would reveal Humphrey Bogart chasing the Maltese Falcon in shimmering black and white.

title: Three Days in the Fishbowl, and Here to Tell the Tale
description: Welcome to the fishbowl, the corporate spokeswoman Eileen Murphy told me a few weeks back when I was named public editor at The New York Times. She was right. The scrutiny began immediately, in the form of interviews, commentary from pundits, welcoming messages on Twitter and the dredging up of old stories Id written and forgotten.

title: Worlds First Pizza Museum Opening in Philadelphia
description: Visit any of the nations more than 60,000 pizza joints, and you will find plenty of people who believe that the perfect pie is a work of art. Certainly, pizza has become as embedded in American cuisine and culture as the hamburger and apple pie.

title: The God of Marriage
description: After a month in San Francisco, Townies returns to New York City.

title: Annie for Sun, a New Woolf for Fear
description: Dates are subject to change.

title: Stage Girls in Hard-Knock Competition
description: OF the three coming Broadway musicals about plucky girls persevering against cruel adults and grim circumstances, which show will break out of the pack and become a box office hit?

title: Pakistan May Be Expelling Aid Groups Foreign Staff
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  The Pakistani government appeared Thursday to have moved to expel international staff members at the aid agency Save the Children, apparently over accusations that one of its employees helped the C.I.A. recruit a Pakistani doctor who played a role in tracking Osama bin Laden last year.

title: For Madrid, a Few Encouraging Words From Germany
description: MADRID  Even as the European Central Bank was taking further steps to help Spain and other struggling euro economies, Chancellor Angela Merkel of Germany said Thursday that she had full confidence in the Spanish government and its efforts to deal with the debt crisis.

title: Installation View of Los Angeles
description: THE past year has been a roller-coaster ride for the Los Angeles art scene. First there were thrills galore offered by Pacific Standard Time: Art in L.A. 1945-1980, a celebration of the citys postwar art history to which some 60 institutions contributed exhibitions extending from October through March. Then there was Jeffrey Deitchs bumpy second year as director of the Los Angeles Museum of Contemporary Art, culminating in the departure of the museums much admired chief curator Paul Schimmel and the resignation of artists like Barbara Kruger and Ed Ruscha from the museums board.

title: Ken Price Sculpture: A Retrospective
description: Images from the new exhibition at the Los Angeles County Museum of Art.

title: French Institute Alliance Francaise to Unveil Gould Hall Renovation
description: The French Institute Alliance Franaise, a New York French cultural center, will officially unveil its major renovation of Florence Gould Hall on Sept. 14 with a concert featuring the jazz musician Bill Frisell along with his groups, the 858 Quartet and the Beautiful Dreamers.

title: From We Can to We Cant
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C.Among the more startling lines in Bill Clintons keynote address last nightfor this listener, anywaywas we cant let it happen, which seemed to encapsulate the Democratic Partys shift in pitch from 2008 to 2012.

title: National Ad Campaign for Citibank Reward Program to Feature Alicia Keys
description: Add being boring to the list of reasons to break up with someone. While there are many women who would gladly jump at the chance to date a boring guy, a new television ad for a Citibank reward program features one woman who has had enough of her boyfriends staid ways.

title: Rosemarie Trockel
description: A look at some of the work from the artists retrospective at the New Museum.

title: Heres Looking at You, Conceptualism
description: CONTEMPORARY art is occupying hallowed halls this season: Andy Warhol at the Met, Matthew Barney at the Morgan Library.

title: Going Beyond Marquee Names on Museum Walls
description: IT may be a mite simplistic to divide artists into usual and unusual suspects. But the truth is there are names that dont surprise when it is announced that they are to be the subjects of coming exhibitions, and others that do, and pleasantly. This year such surprises are on the rise.

title: Ai Weiwei
description: In Washington, the Hirshhorn Museum and Sculpture Garden will mount the first American retrospective of the Chinese artist.

title: Bartolis Signatures: Power and Intensity
description: Marion Bartoli hits both her forehand and backhand with two hands. She volleys with two hands and bounces the ball between serves with two hands on her racket. During changeovers, she raises her bottle of water to her mouth using both arms.

title: A Theme Change on Opening Night
description: East Rutherford, N.J.

title: A Dreamer Addresses the Democratic Convention
description: Benita Veliz was only at the lectern at the Democratic convention for a few minutes on Wednesday night. CNN did not even turn its cameras on the stage during her brief speech. But for many Latinos in the hall, her moment under the lights was a stunning surprise.

title: Obama Girls Role: Not to Speak, but to Be Spoken Of
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C.  On Friday, Malia Obama will be at her desk at Sidwell Friends School for the fourth day of high school  hours after waving onstage at the Democratic National Convention with her sister, Sasha.

title: A White House Childhood
description: Sasha and Malia Obama are rarely seen, but they remain an important part of President Obamas public image.

title: Doctor Is Charged in Death of Slipknot Bassist
description: An Iowa doctor who helped run a pain clinic has been charged with involuntary manslaughter in connection with the death of Paul Gray, the Slipknot bassist and co-founder who died of an overdose of narcotics in May 2010, The Des Moines Register reported.

title: Why Such Suspicion of the Submerged State?
description: NEW YORK  In my column this week I write about Suzanne Mettlers idea of the submerged state  the government benefits that Americans receive, like tax credits, or support channeled through nonprofits, which is paid for by the state but which are either invisible or feel as if theyve come from some other source.

title: The Get | Stephen Russell Earrings
description: Known for exceptional estate gems, the fine jeweler Stephen Russell has created a pair of mesmerizing monochromatic earrings that put Old World glamour back in the moment. Modeled after an 18th-century pendeloque shape, theyre made of almost 200 sapphires, their setting upstaged by all that brilliant blue. And about that setting: Russell chose 18-karat blackened gold to augment the vintagelike quality.

title: What Goes Up, if Only in Stages
description: ARCHITECTURE is slow. So slow it sometimes appears not to be moving forward at all. Projects get bogged down  more now than ever, it seems  by financial shortfalls, public opposition, disputes over labor or design. All on top of the mundane difficulties of putting together, piece by piece, the stuff that makes a building.

title: The U.S. Open Chronicles: Summer in the City
description: Irina Falconi, who is playing at the United States Open this year, will write posts throughout the tournament for Straight Sets. She has her own tumblr page, and can be followed on Twitter.

title: Appeals Court Revives Insider Trading Case Against Obus
description: One of the countrys longest-running insider trading lawsuits has just gotten longer.

title: Traveling With Children, With Help From Apps
description: Figuring out an itinerary for children can feel like a game of Whac-A-Mole. That puppet show in Boston that your niece loved during her last stay? Shes aged out of it. Your 17-year-old son is happy to crash lectures at Georgetown during a trip to Washington? His 10-year-old brother is not so into it.

title: Live Updates From Amazons Press Event
description: Amazon.com invited journalists to Santa Monica, Calif., for a briefing on new Kindle products. It showed off the Kindle Paperwhite with a new whiter screen, and a new Kindle Fire HD that is a more direct competitor to the iPad than the old Kindle Fire. The company gave a sneak preview of some new Kindle devices in a TV commercial that was broadcast Wednesday night.

title: The Caucus Click: Axelrod Getting Anxious
The Peanut Gallery Takes On the Democrats
description: Let the historians decide who was the greatest president in American history; I would argue that the best modern commander in chief for comedians is pretty clear. Sure, Nixon is a solid contender, but Bill Clinton, a man with big appetites and a distinctive accent, has given joke tellers a wealth of material. So its no surprise that his return to the spotlight at the Democratic National Convention on Wednesday night in Charlotte, N.C., inspired an avalanche of jokes on Twitter. (Just as the Republicans gathering did last week). Here are a few highlights:

title: France Sends Funds to 5 Syrian Civic Groups in Rebel-Held Areas
description: PARIS  The French government is providing funds to five revolutionary councils in rebel-held parts of Syria to help them restore water supplies, sanitation, health services and bakeries, a senior French diplomat, ric Chevallier, said Thursday.

title: Migrants Die as Boat Sinks Off Turkey
description: ISTANBUL  At least 58 migrants drowned in the Aegean Sea just off the Turkish coast after the fishing boat that was carrying them sank early Thursday morning, local officials told a Turkish news agency.

title: JPMorgan Names New Head of Chief Investment Office
description: As it works to move past a multibillion-dollar trading loss tied to a complex credit bet, JPMorgan Chase has been reshuffling its management ranks  focusing specifically on the chief investment office, the powerful unit at the center of the soured trade.

title: In One Class, Time to Draw, and in Another, a Return to the Olympics
description: The first graders at Young Scholars Academy for Discovery and Exploration in Bedford-Stuyvesant, Brooklyn, know how to write their first names, though not necessarily their last names, as they demonstrated for reporters on their first day back to school. A group of them sat around a tiny table Thursday morning, frowning with concentration as they tried to decide how to draw themselves.

title: BMW Motorrad and Bloomingdales, Riding Tandem
description: In the mens department at Bloomingdales, featured fashions this fall include a $795 Michael Kors Leather Utility Jacket, a $45 Vince V-Neck Tee and a $15,675 BMW R1200R Classic.

title: The Baffling Nexus of Climate Change and Health
description: In 2004, a rare tropical fungus caused a string of respiratory failures and neural disorders along the Pacific Northwest coast, baffling the health community. That same year, Alaskan cruise ship passengers dining on local oysters fell sick with a gastric virus typically found in warm water estuaries. Now Texas, after an unusually wet spring and dry summer, is battling what may become the countrys worst recorded outbreak of West Nile virus.

title: Breaking It Down: Berdych vs. Federer
description: Roger Federer more than doubled his forehand errors from any of his previous three United States Open matches to lose in four sets to sixth-seeded Tomas Berdych, 7-6 (1), 6-4, 3-6, 6-3, Wednesday.

title: Cuomo, in Convention City, Gives Spirited Speech From Small Stage
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C.  Giant clusters of red, white and blue balloons hung overhead and an imposing black rope line stretched across the room. Campaign-style bunting festooned the podium and Bon Jovis Working for the Working Man blared through loudspeakers. A seasoned political spouse leapt to her feet at applause lines, and the candidate shouted to be heard over an adoring crowd.

title: Clinton Was a Bipartisan President, Except When He Wasnt
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C.  Perhaps only Bill Clinton could deliver one of the most brutal partisan poundings of the other party in recent memory and come out of it with people talking about how bipartisan he is.

title: Singaporean Tells China U.S. Is Not in Decline
description: BEIJING  In an unusual public airing of strategic problems surrounding Chinas rise, the prime minister of Singapore, Lee Hsien Loong, warned China on Thursday that it should view the United States not as a declining power, but as a nation with the ability to innovate and bounce back.

title: What to Watch For in Obamas Speech
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C.  President Obama takes the stage Thursday night competing against a formidable array of convention speakers: Mitt Romney, Michelle Obama, Bill Clinton  and Barack Obama.

title: E-Mail Birthday Intrigue
description: The other day, I got snookered.

title: Small Plates Are a Big Surprise
description: NO one at the table notices the duck leg confit trailed by a retinue of chanterelles and peaches; or the whole dorade, dappled with olive oil; or the tangle of linguine, lump crab, grilled corn, mascarpone and rendered bacon. We are too busy eating our broccoli.

title: Focusing on What Is Local, Not Just Organic
description: Like a lot of Americans, Jenn Louis wasnt raised on a noble diet of organic food.

title: Culture Clash With Afghans on Display at Briefing
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  It was billed as a news briefing by American and Afghan commanders on what the allies are doing to stop insider attacks by Afghan forces against NATO troops. The first question, though, was just about the last thing the three generals on the dais wanted to hear.

title: Judge Approves E-Book Pricing Settlement Between Government and Publishers
description: 8:35 p.m. | Updated In a decision that could start an e-book price war in the publishing industry, a federal judge on Thursday approved a settlement between the Justice Department and three major publishers in a civil antitrust case that accused the companies of collusion in the pricing of digital books.

title: Obama Praises Clinton and Talks Stadium Move in Call With Supporters
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C.  Bill Clintons prosecutorial speech to the Democratic convention on Wednesday night went as far as anyone has this year in delineating the differences between the Democratic and Republican agendas, President Obama said on Thursday.

title: Venice Film Festival: Olivier Assayas Returns to the 1970s
description: VENICE  In his previous movie, Carlos, the French filmmaker Olivier Assayas tackled a few big themes of the 1970s  the demise of idealism and the rise of terrorism  through a biopic of the international guerrilla and media star known as Carlos the Jackal. Mr. Assayass new film, Something in the Air, which had its world premiere in competition at the Venice Film Festival, is another immersion in those tumultuous times, but from a very personal perspective. (The film is also being shown at the Toronto and New York festivals, and will be released in the United States by IFC.)

description: In the minutes after Roger Federers stunning quarterfinal loss to Tomas Berdych at the United States Open on Wednesday night, the factoid went shooting around Twitter:

title: Why Cant School Be More Like Summer?
description: From their perspective, the worst thing that happens to my two daughters at the conclusion of each summer is that they have to leave their friends and their joyous days of exploration at their mountain summer camp and come home. The next worst thing that happens to them is that they have to immediately start an experience  school  that feels almost exactly the opposite. The onset of camp-sickness is immediate.

title: A Look Behind the U.S. Decline in Global Competitiveness
description: For the fourth consecutive year, Switzerland is the most competitive economy in the world, according to a ranking from the World Economic Forum. And, for the fourth consecutive year, the United States fell in the rankings  largely because of worsening criticism of the American government  and is now in seventh place.

title: Bernadette Corporation
description: A show at Artists Space gathers together the prolific output of this influential and intentionally enigmatic quasi-corporation.

title: Conversations with Voters: The Economy
description: In a Google+ Hangout, the Op-Ed columnist Frank Bruni and the editorial board writer David Firestone talk to voters from around the country about their views on the economy.

title: Weighing Prepaid Cards vs. Checking Accounts
description: Prepaid cards can be a better deal than checking accounts for some people, but the cards need more consumer safeguards, a new report from the Pew Charitable Trusts finds.

title: Clinton Was Not Always an Obama Fan, Romney Ad Recalls
description: 3:12 p.m. | Updated Bill Clinton proved Wednesday night to be one of President Obamas most forceful and substantive surrogates, but he has hardly been the most consistent. In fact, in a new ad, Mitt Romneys campaign is reminding voters that Mr. Clinton was once a sharp critic of Mr. Obama, in 2008.

title: Blasting Your Way Into the Fall
description: FOR video game players the summer begins after Labor Day. The preceding months have the prestige titles and the intriguing independent projects. In that category 2012 has served up Dear Esther, Fez, Journey and Papo & Yo, to name a few. The fall is the time for blockbusters, many of them sequels with big explosions.

title: New York City Marathon, in Reversal, Will Ferry Bags
description: After criticism from marathoners, New York Road Runners reversed itself and said it would allow runners to check a bag at the starting line of the New York City Marathon on Nov. 4.

title: Navigating Darkness, or Enlightenment
description: HERES the challenge for Eric Kripke, the producer in charge of Revolution, an NBC series set on a future Earth without electricity: Take a horror story and make it a fantasy.

title: Putin Says Missile Deal Is More Likely With Obama
description: VLADIVOSTOK, Russia  President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia sauntered into American presidential politics on Thursday, praising President Obama as a very honest man and chastising the Republican nominee, Mitt Romney, for describing Russia as without question our No. 1 geopolitical foe.

title: Going Straight (or Otherwise) for the Center
description: GAY is the new straight.

title: Video Shows Killer of Gas-Station Worker
description: Police officials are offering a $12,000 reward for information leading to the arrest and conviction of the two men who carried out the fatal armed robbery of a gas station in the Bronx, the chilling exchange captured by video surveillance cameras.

title: A Writers Inspiration? Oh, Brother!
description: LOS ANGELES

title: Amli
description: Inside the Mediterranean restaurant once known as Persephone.

title: French Police Nearby, Girl Hides in Car for Hours Under Relatives Corpses
description: PARIS  Apparently frozen in terror, a 4-year-old girl crouched silently for eight hours below her dead mother and grandmother in the back of a BMW on a forest road in the French Alps while just steps away investigators hunted for clues, officials said Thursday.

title: New Jerusalem
description: Mitt Romney and the Republicans have been working overtime to make fealty to Israel a wedge issue in the campaign and to grossly misrepresent President Obama as insufficiently loyal to the Jewish state. So why did the Democrats give the Republicans an opening to pounce?

title: Week 1 in Fantasy Football: Favorable and Unfavorable Matchups
description: Jason and Justin Sablich will provide fantasy football advice and analysis throughout the season on this blog and on Twitter @5thDownFantasy.

title: Traveling at the Speed of Molasses
description: ZZ TOP has been idling for a while. It tours regularly, playing the road and radio-tested base of its blues and boogie 1970s and 80s catalog with such delicious control over sound and feel and medium-to-slow tempos that you wonder whether this band, in earthly-purpose terms, needs to do much else.

title: Whole New State of Mind
description: ALICIA KEYSS recording studio, the Oven, is on a high floor of a West Chelsea building, with a panoramic city view. The little alcove used for vocals gazes out toward the Empire State Building.

title: Woody Johnson Says Circus Isnt in Town
description: FLORHAM PARK, N.J.  Woody Johnson, the Jets owner, said he was very optimistic that the team would rebound from its disappointing 2011 season but declined to discuss the consequences for Rex Ryan and Mike Tannenbaum if the team misses the playoffs for a second consecutive year.

title: U.S. Open Food of the Day: Burrata
description: Another installment in our daily reviews of food from the United States Open concession stands.

title: Rise and Shine for Richard Chai
description: Pulling up to Lincoln Center this morning for the first day of New York Fashion Week, the first thing that caught the eye was the incredible number of people standing in the plaza to gawk at the fashionistas. There had to be 100 people out there, half with cellphone cameras. Somehow, people just know when theres a big fashion happening.

title: President Obamas Girls
description: Jodi Kantor of The New York Times talks about the vital role that President Obamas daughters, Malia and Sasha, have played in his political life.

title: Errani Tries to Distance Herself From Barred Spanish Doctor
description: Reaching the singles semifinals and womens doubles final in New York continues a career season for Sara Errani, who was also a finalist at the French Open. But she has had to face questions about her connection to the Spanish doctor Luis Garcia del Moral, who recently was barred by the United States Anti-Doping Agency as part of the case against Lance Armstrong, a punishment recognized by the International Tennis Federation.

title: Envelope, Please: Maimuna Abdi Yussuf
description: Maimuna Abdi Yussuf, a Somali student at African Leadership Academy in Johannesburg, South Africa, is one of eight high school seniors around the world who are blogging about their college searches.

title: News and Verse: Our Weekly Poetry Pairings
description: With the start of the school year, we usher in a new season of Poetry Pairings, a feature we first introduced in 2010.

title: The Fraying Hospital Safety Net
description: Slender and in his 60s, the patient had been short of breath for several days, a result of untreated heart failure causing fluid to build up in his lungs. Despite his wifes entreaties, he had refused to go to the hospital, one of the biggest in the city, and waited at home, gasping, until his appointment at our clinic.

title: President Obamas Second Chance
description: President Obamas dilemma has always been that he has been far more successful a president than his opponents claim, but far less successful than he needs to be at making voters see that. Powerful speeches by former President Bill Clinton, Vice President Joe Biden and others did a lot to fix that impression during the convention. But it was up to Mr. Obama to make the case for another term, with a speech that was every bit as fraught with uncertainty and risk as his 2008 convention address.

title: Before School Lets Out, a Basketball-Playing Robot Takes the Court
description: The first day of school was coming to an end at Staten Island Technical High School, but the members of the schools robotics team, Team 375: The Robotic Plague, still had one hurdle to clear. They couldnt wait to demonstrate their champion basketball-launching robot to Schools Chancellor Dennis M. Walcott and other dignitaries who had dropped by.

title: Making the G.I. Bill Work for Veterans
description: Todays veterans have faced incredible challenges, but have also received extraordinary opportunities  like the Post 9/11 G.I. Bill. Each year, it helps tens of thousands of veterans attend college by helping pay for tuition and living expenses. Through this program, many veterans have been able to transition successfully from combat back to civilian life.

title: Romney Isnt Planning to Watch Obamas Speech
description: CONCORD, N.H.  Tens of millions of people are expected to tune into President Obamas acceptance speech at the Democratic National Convention on Thursday night. But Mitt Romney doesnt plan on being one of them.

title: Photo Replay: Sept. 6
description: A view of the day in sports, including the Paralympic Games in London and the 18th stage of the Tour of Spain cycling race.

title: Blistering Bands and Bingo
description: Along with innumerable other starry-eyed provincials, the Miser moved to New York more or less because of downtown. The allure of figures like Laurie Anderson and Spalding Gray, Cindy Sherman and Jean-Michel Basquiat, John Zorn and Jim Jarmusch was difficult to resist for us yuppie-oppressed, MTV-addled Generation Xers desperate for deliverance.

title: Rodents Too Cute Not to Share
description: Our friends at the Wildlife Conservation Society have been inundating us with cute baby animal pix lately, and at some point it might be time to call a moratorium, but Baby Patagonian Cavy Day is definitely not the time.

title: Amazon Updates Its Kindle Line of E-Readers
description: SANTA MONICA, Calif.  Amazon announced a barrage of new tablets and e-readers on Thursday that makes its challenge to Apples iPad a little more serious.

title: Ryan Does Not Bite Back After Clinton Attack
description: COLORADO SPRINGS  A day after Bill Clinton attacked Representative Paul D. Ryans Medicare plan by saying it takes some brass to make the claims he has, Mr. Ryan did not mention the former president at a rally here on Thursday.

title: Honda Introduces an Accord Buffet in New York
description: On Wednesday, Honda introduced the 2013 Accords at Chelsea Piers, on Manhattans West Side. The sedan and coupe were joined by the companys first plug-in hybrid.

title: Fort Hood Shooting Suspects Beard Must Be Shaved, Military Judge Rules
description: KILLEEN, Tex.  A military judge on Thursday ordered officials to forcibly shave Maj. Nidal Malik Hasan, the Army psychiatrist charged in the shooting rampage at the Fort Hood base here in 2009, a move that is likely to delay the start of his trial for weeks as his defense lawyers appeal the ruling.

title: A Thing for Lam and Condemned Men
description: NICOLE KIDMAN, movie star, Oscar winner and red-carpet regular, recently played a cow. Talk about your glamour roles.

title: Theater Talkback: Finding Inspiration in Improvisation
description: During the summer, ArtsBeat invited members of the theater world to contribute to the weekly Theater Talkback column, alternating with the critics Ben Brantley and Charles Isherwood. Trav S. D., a historian of vaudeville, talked about the long bare-knuckles history shared between the boxing ring and the stage; Alexis Soloski, a critic and theater professor, highlighted unforgettable stage entrances; and the playwright Sarah Ruhl explained why critics were not invited to review her Melancholy Play.

title: Putins Ambitions Turn to the Far East
description: VLADIVOSTOK, Russia  President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia is seizing on the Asia-Pacific economic summit conference being held here this weekend to turn assertively to the Far East, hoping to strengthen ties with the Pacific Rim and pursuing ambitious development in Russia itself, starting with this formerly secret naval fortress turned shipping hub on the Sea of Japan.

title: First Day of School, Brooklyn
description: So today is the first day of public school in New York City. My three kids are all old hands at this by now, so the drop-off was easy. Theyre going into second, fifth and eighth grades. For some reason, the eighth grader doesnt begin school until tomorrow, so he got to go back to his elementary school to see off his younger brother and sister. He was fawned over by his old teachers, who seemed truly amazed that he is now a very tall 13-year-old. I could tell he was enjoying the attention until it happened that the director of his middle school has a second grader he was dropping off; my 13-year-old quickly vanished.

title: Harriet Jacobss First Assignment
description: Harriet Jacobs arrived in Washington in June 1862, she later reported, without molestation. Lots of people traveled in and out of the capital at the time, but for Jacobs it was quite a feat. By then a correspondent on assignment for William Lloyd Garrisons newspaper The Liberator, Jacobs was a former slave and author of the book Incidents in the Life of a Slave Girl, which she wrote under the assumed name Linda Brent. Traveling through Maryland, where slavery was still legal, and Pennsylvania, where anti-black animus still ran high, would have made for tough going for most free blacks. Even fewer could have taken in the squalor that Jacobs found among the thousands of refugees from the South now huddled in the capital.

title: The Dangerous Center
description: Many of the Democrats who thrilled to Bill Clintons defense of an active government last night have conveniently forgotten how angry they were every time he tacked to the center, most notably by drastically reducing welfare benefits in 1996. President Obama shares some of those instincts toward ideological concessions, creating a bit of suspense regarding the nature of the second-term agenda he intends to unveil tonight.

title: Partners Create a Superdealership
description: When was the last time an expert from a top auction house dispensed with longtime allegiances and joined forces with someone from the enemy camp? In the fiercely competitive world of Sothebys and Christies, such an occurrence is rarer than a prized Vermeer.

title: BCBG Max Azria: Spring 2013 RTW
description: New York

title: Facing the Camera and Commanding It
description: Beverly Hills, Calif.

title: Knoedler Gallery to Auction Its Inventory
description: The now-shuttered Knoedler & Co. gallery, which is the subject of several lawsuits charging it sold fakes, will sell nearly three dozen works from its remaining inventory at auction this fall.

title: Creatures of the Wind: Spring 2013 RTW
description: New York

title: Pictures of the Day: India and Elsewhere
description: Photos from India, Gaza Strip, Turkey and Lebanon.

title: Lost Tracks
description: Telegraph Avenue, Michael Chabons rich, comic new novel, is a homage to an actual place: the boulevard in Northern California where Oakland  historically an African-American city  aligns with Berkeley, whose bourgeois white inhabitants are, as one character puts it, liable to invest all their hope of heaven in the taste of an egg laid in the backyard by a heritage-breed chicken. The novel is equally a tribute to the cinematic style of Quentin Tarantino, whose films its characters study and discuss, and whose preoccupations pepper its pages: kung fu, cinematic allusions and the blaxploitation films of the 1970s; and an interest in African-American characters and experience. Chabon and Tarantino make an unlikely duo; while the latters films tend toward gaudy eruptions of violence, Chabon bends Tarantinos sensibility to a warmhearted novel about fatherhood in which the onstage violence consists of two graphic childbirth scenes and a 15-year-old boy whacking a chubby thug with a wooden sword. A self-help book in the style of Andrei Tarkovsky would be hardly more oxymoronic.

title: How Does Denzel Washington Take Off?
description: THE art of acting is so peculiar that even its most skillful practitioners (and the co-workers who love them) cant quite explain how they do what they do. When you watch a performance like Denzel Washingtons in Robert Zemeckiss Flight (opening Nov. 2), you want to get under the hood of it somehow, to understand what this remarkable thing is made of and what keeps it, improbably, aloft for two perilous hours. But when you ask Mr. Washington or his co-stars how its done, theyre mostly at a loss for words, or rather, they talk around it, trying to get at its mysterious workings by way of metaphors, anecdotes and the odd sweeping generality.

title: Bill Clinton Draws More Viewers Than N.F.L. Opener
description: More people watched former President Bill Clintons speech to the Democratic National Convention on Wednesday night than tuned in to see the N.F.L. season opener.

title: An Unfit Friend
description: I am inviting several friends on a weeks vacation abroad, all expenses paid. All of the guests (but one) are extremely fit, and Im planning lots of hiking and biking. But I fear that the unfit guest, who is also needy, will ask others to stay behind with her, depriving them of wonderful experiences. The villa has a pool and is near the village, so she should be able to entertain herself. May I discourage her from asking others to keep her company, or ask guests to take turns baby-sitting, or should I let the chips fall where they may? Anonymous

title: Adrift With a Tiger and the Film God
description: YOU become the movie you are making, the Oscar-winning director Ang Lee said in a recent telephone interview. Given that the movie in question is Life of Pi, based on the award-winning, fantastical novel about a boy and a Bengal tiger marooned on a boat for 227 days, Mr. Lee is feeling a bit more at sea than usual these days.

title: Convention Dust-Ups
description: John Stanton, BuzzFeeds Washington bureau chief, on conflicts that have arisen within the party at the Democratic National Convention.

title: Cooling a Computer Server With Mineral Oil
description: When theyre using their smartphones or tapping away on laptops, few people pause to think about the enormous amount of energy needed to power the data centers that store and deliver the information in all those e-mails and on Web sites and Facebook pages.

description: In Forbidden Broadway: Alive & Kicking!, Jenny Lee Stern parodies Elena Roger, the Argentine star of the current Broadway revival of Evita.

description: A sign posted at the entrance to the Creatures of the Wind show at Milk Studios today said it all: Warning, strobe lighting will be used in todays show.

description: Staging Obamas speech. | His term so far. | BuzzFeed on convention dust-ups. | Steve Israel on Congressional races. | Opinion: Charles M. Blow and Ross Douthat.

title: 16 Injured in Queens Bus Crash
description: Updated, Sept. 7 |  Sixteen people were injured, four of them seriously, in an accident in Queens on Thursday afternoon involving a city bus, a school bus without passengers, and other vehicles, officials said.

title: Makarova and Soares, Last-Minute Teammates, Win Mixed Doubles
description: A pick-up team that registered to play with less than one minute remaining before the tournament deadline won the 2012 United States Open mixed doubles championship.

title: Hello, Mummy! Were Here About That Inheritance
description: The curtain rises in The Eye of the Storm with the old lady in bed, angrily grasping at the covers and a life that she refuses to relinquish. Much as she has in the past, Elizabeth Hunter (Charlotte Rampling), an Australian matriarch, lords over all, including her servants and two children, Basil (Geoffrey Rush) and Dorothy (Judy Davis), who have returned to her, reluctantly, skittishly, to secure their inheritance. During their visit Elizabeth fades in and out, by turns raging and murmuring as she fights the world, her seemingly ungrateful children and maybe herself.

description: T plucks the best shoes right off the runway.

description: Michelle Obama's impact. | Previewing Bill Clinton's speech. | The president's competitive side. | Twitter's Adam Sharp. | BuzzFeed interviews a social media star.

title: Breaking It Down: Williams vs. Ivanovic
description: Serena Williams punches you in the mouth so hard and so quickly at the beginning of a match that all you can think about is survival.

title: A Novelist and His Detective Muse (She Prefers Beer)
description: Unlike Darlene OHara, the fictional detective at the center of his novels, Peter de Jonge has opened Milanos only once. For research, he said, sitting in the century-old dive bar on East Houston Street in Manhattan early one recent morning.

title: Betting on Job Growth
description: The latest government figures detailing job growth in August  or lack thereof  wont be out until Friday morning, but some economists are already speculating that the figures may be stronger than expected.

description: The new CW series starts on Oct. 10.

title: A Venezuelan Diplomats Swift Rise Ends With a Murder in Kenya
description: CARACAS, Venezuela  Dwight Sagarays rise in the Venezuelan foreign service was almost as swift as his downfall.

title: Excerpt: The Neighbors
description: The new ABC series starts on Sept. 26.

title: A Chinese Dealer, Trafficker in Mystery
description: The Chinese art dealer C. T. Loo held court at his galleries in Paris, New York, Shanghai and Beijing. From the 1910s through the 1940s, he spoke mysteriously of his friends who could acquire artifacts in the countryside, while he angled spotlights on stone Buddha heads and opalescent jade bowls for sale.

title: Treasures of an Heiress From a Personal Paradise
description: The 1930s modernist home at the center of Doris Dukes Shangri La: Architecture, Landscape and Islamic Art, at the Museum of Arts and Design, is a masterpiece of refined eclecticism. Designed for its site in Honolulu by an architect from Palm Beach, Fla., and filled with treasures from the Islamic world, it unites diverse styles and periods with great taste and, it must be said, great wealth.

title: Israel to Admit 3 of 21 Africans Waiting in Desert
description: JERUSALEM  For days, their blurred images had appeared on Israeli television screens and in the newspapers, a group of 21 African migrants crouching on the desert floor behind the new steel fence that Israel has built along its border with Egypt.

title: At Convention, Obama Surrogates Extol Foreign Policy Successes
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C.  One of the Obama campaigns goals during the Democratic convention is to convince voters that they are better off  or at least no worse off  than they were four years ago. On Thursday night President Obama  along with Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. and Senator John F. Kerry of Massachusetts  will draw on the administrations foreign policy record to make the case.

title: Is This Not the Best-Looking Bug Youve Ever Seen?
It Takes One Grape to Reimagine California Wine
description: KELSEYVILLE, Calif.

title: Common Threads, Uncommon Ties
description: Lin Tianmiao, whose derivative, portentously surrealistic sculpture is the subject of Bound Unbound at Asia Society, is one of a rare kind in China, where she lives: a nationally and internationally renowned female artist. It was an epic journey that brought Ms. Lin to this eminence.

title: Herms and Craftsmanship
description: The question was surely rhetorical. Do you know the right way to eat caviar? said John Martinez, a cater-waiter.

title: Complaints Against Lenders
description: THE new Consumer Financial Protection Bureau received 23,500 complaints about mortgage lenders from last December through this past June, according to a recently released semiannual report. And, not surprisingly, just over half the complaints centered on the problems borrowers encountered when they were unable to make payments.

title: All of Their Business | Bernadette Corporation at Artists Space
description: Since the mid-1990s, Bernadette Van-Huy, John Kelsey and Antek Walczak, operating as the collective Bernadette Corporation, have run a critically acclaimed underground fashion label; published a magazine, Made in USA, as well as a novel, Reena Spaulings; and produced a handful of films, including Get Rid of Yourself (2003), which revolves around the riots at the 2001 G8 Summit and features an awkward star turn by the actress Chlo Sevigny.

title: Live Updates From the Democratic Convention
description: The Times will be providing updates and analysis from Charlotte on our live dashboard. You can also follow along on Twitter @thecaucus, or follow our list of Times journalists covering the convention.

title: Romneys Next Test
description: To put the question bluntly: How will Mitt Romney perform on Meet the Press?

title: Songs of Innocence,  la the Monkees
description: What sweet, silly dreams we have as nave adolescents soaking up popular culture and mooning over the teen idols of the moment. When the Broadway singer Marin Mazzie (Kiss Me, Kate, Passion) was growing up in Rockford, Ill., she recalled on Wednesday evening at 54 Below, she was in the thrall of the Monkees Davy Jones and of David Cassidy and fantasized about being the long-lost Partridge on The Partridge Family.

title: Where Anxieties Roam
description: Frank Moore had a busy, productive career in and around painting until it was cut short by AIDS in 2002. He was 48, one among many artists felled by the disease.

title: Smorgasburg Spreads to Dumbo
description: The Brooklyn Flea recently announced plans to expand on the success of their all-food market, Smorgasburg, by launching a second weekly location in Brooklyn Bridge Park.

title: Obama Would Be Big Favorite With Fired Up Base
description: Theres one advantage that President Obama has that Mitt Romney probably doesnt. If he can get a good turnout from his base, hell be the heavy favorite to win in November  even if Mr. Romney gets a strong turnout as well.

title: The Inspiration Didnt Fade
description: When Foekje Fleur van Duin was an art student in the Netherlands, she read about the masses of discarded containers that float in the ocean. She went to the Maas River near Rotterdam in search of her own plastic soup.

title: Putin Jokes About Orgies to Cast Pussy Riot Protesters as Degenerates
description: In comments broadcast on Thursday, the Russian President Vladimir V. Putin joked about the reputed benefits of group sex for the lazy as he attacked the morals of three women from the punk band Pussy Riot who were jailed by a Moscow court last month.

title: Step and Lunge and Forge Bonds
description: AS a fan of old-school workouts, I find many fitness classes too fancy and gimmicky. But once in a while, something comes along that excites and intimidates the skeptical, hard-core exerciser in me. That something right now is Relentless, a 75-minute class held on Tuesday nights at the 92nd Street Y on the Upper East Side.

title: A Few Hungry Writers, Playing Fast and Loose
description: The Words is a clever, entertaining yarn that doesnt bear close scrutiny. Even superficial examination of this film reveals myriad flaws, despite a compelling performance by Jeremy Irons as a fictional writer in a book also called The Words. At the heart of this story-within-a-story is a tale of plagiarism and ambition.

title: Spare Times for Children for Sept. 7-13
description: HONEY WEEKEND

title: Costello Tagliapietra: Spring 2013 RTW
description: New York

title: Technical Glitch Hits Yahoo Mail
description: 7:33 p.m. | Updated  Adding Yahoo statement.

title: Spare Times for Sept. 7-13
description: Around Town

title: The Enduring Erotic Life Cycle of an Unpromising Relationship
description: When we first meet Erik (Thure Lindhardt), a Danish filmmaker living in New York in 1997, he is on the telephone looking for a casual sexual hookup. He seems fickle and impatient, hanging up on potential partners at the first hint that the chemistry might be wrong, but eventually he finds more or less what he is looking for. Quite a bit more, actually, in the person of Paul (Zachary Booth), even though Paul says he has a steady girlfriend, and Erik is not interested in commitment.

title: Generations United for Improvisation, Refined but Violent
description: You take when a high note comes through, lifting and going and then stopping because theres no place else for it to go, the saxophonist Sidney Bechet explained some time in the 1950s. Thats stepping music  its got to rush itself right off your voice or your horn because its so excited.

title: A Centennial, With Toy Pianos and a Coffee Table
description: For a composer who was a true rebel, a pioneering American maverick, John Cage was frequently celebrated in programs and festivals at the worlds most prestigious concert halls. But he surely would have been delighted to see the centennial of his birth commemorated in New York at Cage100, a three-day festival at the Stone, the nonprofit performance space in the East Village dedicated to experimental and avant-garde music.

title: Where Bronze Takes Fine Form
description: At Modern Art Foundry in Astoria, Queens, the work of prominent sculptors goes big.

title: U.S. Open: Women's Semifinals Preview
description: Some may say that women's tennis is boring, but the women remaining at the U.S. Open are set up for an intriguing semifinals. Lynn Zinser has the latest from Flushing

title: Back to School
description: Scenes from New York City public schools as students returned for the first day of classes.

title: A Towering Career; a Collision With War
description: THE mass imprisonment of Japanese in World War II remains a painful blot on our history. There were no internment camps for the Japanese on the East Coast, but you didnt need to live in the West to be touched by the hand of fear, as Yasuo Matsui found out. Even though he had lived here for four decades, designed one of New Yorks tallest buildings and ran a major construction company, the Japanese-born architect was rousted out of bed on the night of the Pearl Harbor attack, held at Ellis Island for two months and spent the war under house arrest.

title: Todays Scuttlebot:  iPhone 5 Video and Apple TV Delay
description: Some interesting items that the tech reporters and editors of The New York Times found on the Web recently. See more here.

title: Leaps, Flips, Twists and Pyramids Pave Way to Texas
description: Take the nastiness and willful boorishness out of a certain breed of reality show, and what do you have? A series you can actually bear to watch.

title: Dropping the Beats at the Democratic Convention
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C.  As the first notes of Fleetwood Macs Dont Stop rang through the Time Warner Cable Arena here on Wednesday night, the packed crowd whipped into a frenzy, nearly drowning out the song as they cheered for minutes for former President Bill Clinton.

title: Video: Is Womens Tennis Boring? Not at the Open
description: (function($){var data = chameleonData;var ticker = new NYTD.NYTMM.NewsTicker($('#nytmm_embed_834'), data);})(jQuery||NYTD.jQuery);

title: Collaborative and Solo, With a Certain Feminist Bent
description: Collaboration is one of the hallmarks of feminist art and scholarship. The art system doesnt really accommodate this, however. Instead, criticism, art history and institutions are set up to canonize (historically male) individual artists. And for curators, its considerably easier to work with one artist than a hundred.

title: A Walk on Fire Island
description: Island Night is part philosophic dialogue, part poetic reverie and part nature walk.

title: Socrates on the Beach: An Island Walk
description: EVERY summer thousands of New Yorkers go to Fire Island, a narrow barrier island off the South Shore of Long Island, in search of sun, sand, sex and sea breezes. But this year, on the last weekend in August, a motley group of nine disembarked at the Pines, the famous gay resort at the islands midpoint, hellbent on Socratic dialogue.

title: New 9/11 Programs Are a British Task
description: Sept. 11 is approaching, and American television is maintaining a polite distance. Since last year, when more than two dozen new documentaries and memorials were presented for the 10th anniversary of the 2001 attacks, our attention has receded again. Apparently the most appropriate gift for an 11th anniversary is reruns.

title: Democratic National Convention: Day 3
description: Photographs from Sept. 6, 2012.

title: New York Ethics Inquiry Wont Look at Speakers Actions
description: ALBANY  State ethics regulators decided this week not to authorize a full-fledged investigation of use of public money by the Assembly speaker, Sheldon Silver, to finance a confidential settlement with two women who said they were sexually harassed by Assemblyman Vito J. Lopez, people with knowledge of the inquiry said Thursday.

description: Theater
