title: One Has Left Arkansas, but Football Still Bonds Petrinos
description: FAYETTEVILLE, Ark.  One of Paul and Bobby Petrinos favorite ways to have fun was far less complicated than the offensive strategies it produced.

title: Sinful Ways to Start the Day
description: SEPTEMBER means back to school and back to work  and back to morning regimens of low-fat yogurt and sensible breakfast cereals. But before you can say stress factor, well be craving that big glazed doughnut or monster muffin, and triple or quadruple shots of caffeine. Here, in anticipation of slipping back into old habits, are three new places in or near Westchester County that offer excellent high-calorie and high-octane reasons to get out of bed. All are child-friendly and have good spots to tie up your dog.

title: Contenders for Americas Most Popular Car: The Latest Wave of Midsize Family Sedans
description: Contenders for Americas most popular car.

title: Bill Cunningham | On Their Feet
description: New York Fashion Week guests at the clothing shows provided a dazzling display of today's shoe designs.

title: Once a Vagabond Driver, Now an IndyCar Title Contender
description: Ryan Hunter-Reay was a racecar driver who needed a road map. He was not yet 25 when he lost his third ride in three years in the flagging Champ Car series in 2005, and he had to contemplate his future, perhaps one without racing.

title: Fashion Week Inside and Out
description: The views from inside fashion shows, and outside on the sidewalk, during New York Fashion Week.

title: The Cavemen Embrace Aprons and Whisks
description: I RECENTLY had a long-postponed dinner with a dear male friend of mine. After comparing cholesterol scores and the frequency of workouts, we got down to business.

title: What Books Said to One Another
description: If you listen closely at the subtly startling new exhibition at the Jewish Museum, Crossing Borders: Manuscripts From the Bodleian Libraries, you can hear manuscripts murmuring across millenniums.

title: Movie Frenzy, but Still Comfy, Eh?
description: TORONTO  The Toronto International Film Festival is where towering achievement meets buckets of blood, where the cinematic highbrow jostles alongside the middle and lower realms for 11 crammed, ecstatic, enervating days and nights. The essential industry event of the fall, now in its 37th year, it is the promised land for distributors looking for product, producers hunting for money and journalists looking for the next big films and faces. Despite the red carpet events and what feels like a tighter embrace of the mainstream, the festival continues to feel appreciably less glamorous than Cannes. Its homier, more relaxed, which is why you may end up seated near David Geffen at dinner one night or find yourself waiting for vegetarian takeout alongside Paul Dano and Zoe Kazan.

title: Georgia: In Suing State, A.C.L.U. Defends Klan
description: The American Civil Liberties Union filed a lawsuit against Georgia on Thursday for denying the Ku Klux Klans application to participate in an adopt a highway program. The lawsuit says the state violated the freedom of speech of a chapter of the Klan in Union County, near the North Carolina border. State transportation officials in June denied the chapters application to clean trash along a stretch of Route 515 in the Appalachian Mountains, saying the program was for only civic-minded organizations in good standing. Debbie Seagraves, the executive director of the A.C.L.U. Foundation of Georgia, said: There will always be speech and groups conveying hateful messages that are distasteful to some. That is why the First Amendment protects free speech for all. The State Transportation Department said it had expected the lawsuit and stood by its decision to deny the application.

title: Colleges in Three States Report Bomb Threats
description: Three college campuses in North Dakota, Ohio and Texas were evacuated on Friday after receiving bomb threats. The false alarms forced students and staff members to flee in the middle of classes at the University of Texas, Austin; North Dakota State University, Fargo; and Hiram College in northeast Ohio. In Austin, Rhonda Weldon, a spokeswoman, said a man called claiming to have placed bombs all over campus that would detonate in 90 minutes, and officials decided to order the universitys 51,000 students and 24,000 staff and faculty members to evacuate out of an abundance of caution. Classes were canceled for the day. At North Dakota State, which has 14,000 students, officials ordered an evacuation after receiving a bomb threat, but the campus was reopened by 1 p.m., officials said. At Hiram, with 1,300 students, crews with bomb-sniffing dogs checked all of the buildings. It was not clear who made the threats or whether they were connected, officials said.

title: Taking It to the Grave
description: I married the love of my life at a young age. We were high school sweethearts, together for 12 years and married for 6. Sadly, she passed away when we were 26. Five years later, I met a wonderful woman to whom I am now married, and we have two beautiful children. My second wife understands the deep love I shared with my first wife and respects our bond. When I die, should I be buried with my true love or in a family plot with my second family? Brian, New York

title: How the Poll Was Conducted
description: The latest New York Times/CBS News Poll is based on telephone interviews conducted Sept. 8 through 12 with 1,301 adults throughout the United States. Of these, 1,170 said they were registered to vote.

title: The First Issue in Any Massage
description: ITS often the first, and most awkward, question at a spa: Do you prefer a male or female massage therapist?

title: As Succession Talk Stirs, Ford Focuses on New Car
description: DEARBORN, Mich.  If Mark Fields is ruffled by speculation that he is the favorite to become the next chief executive of Ford Motor, he isnt showing it.

title: The Lion, the Artist and the Studio
description: Croton-on-Hudson, N.Y.

title: He Struck Gold in Cast Iron
Cracks Spur Board to Urge Check of Dreamliner Engines
description: The National Transportation Safety Board on Friday called for frequent inspections on engines in Boeings new 787 Dreamliner planes after cracks were found in an engine shaft on two jets and possibly on a 747-8 cargo plane.

title: Still Dreaming Her Dream
description: Pay attention to Charity Hope Valentines middle name. The heroine of the musical Sweet Charity is prone to wishful thinking. Shes also a giving person, and the object of her striving is love, so Charity and Valentine are also cleverly apt names. Or painfully obvious ones.

title: Standing Up at an Early Age
description: In recent weeks, Baltimore Ravens linebacker Brendon Ayanbadejo has been praised in many quarters for supporting the legalization of same-sex marriage. His stance is not new, but it reached a wider audience after a Maryland legislator urged the Ravens owner Steve Bisciotti to silence him.

title: A Label That Has Regained Its Luster
description: REMEMBER the Chrysler K-car? Dave Schiff, a founder of Made Collection, a new flash-sale site that sells only American-made goods, hopes not.

title: Throwing Stones at Glass Ceilings
description: The Good Girls Revolt: How the Women of Newsweek Sued Their Bosses and Changed the Workplace. By Lynn Povich. 288 pages. PublicAffairs. $25.99.

title: When Good Things Happen to Bad Seasons
description: If you live in a baseball market where your team is already out of it, its likely that for a while there has been talk about next year, about rebuilding. I played for my share of those teams, and I know that this is the time of year when you can get a sense of what that rebuilt team might look like once they stop rebuilding. Because, as team rosters expand from 25 to 40 in September, this is when many young players get a true shot. They are penned into the lineup and allowed to play, to make mistakes, to compete against the best, every single night. The team is playing for the future, but the future gets to play, now.

title: The Willing Nanny, the Happy Family: Too Good to Be True
description: The e-mail arrived two weeks ago.

title: Standing Out From the New Girls
description: ON Sept. 5, the day before New York Fashion Week began, she shimmered onstage at the Style Awards at Lincoln Center, glamorous in an above-the-knee white cocktail dress by the designer Christian Siriano, ballerina bun piled high and burgundy lips.

title: California Tries to Guide the Way on Health Law
description: SACRAMENTO  The meeting came to order, the five members of the California Health Benefit Exchange seated onstage with dozens of consumer advocates and others looking on. On the agenda: what to name the online marketplace where millions of residents will be able to shop for medical coverage under President Obamas health care law.

title: Fed Responds to a Grim Reality
description: WASHINGTON  When the Federal Reserves vice chairman said in a 1994 speech that the central bank had a role in reducing unemployment, colleagues were publicly dismissive. The very word employment did not appear in a policy statement until 2008. The Fed was focused on inflation, officials said time and again.

title: Feeling the Oompah as Oktoberfest Beckons
description: FRANKLIN SQUARE, N.Y.

title: Cutting Government, Blindfolded
description: Mitt Romney has been rousing military-minded voters with warnings of giant defense cuts in January, but hes only telling half the story. An alarming White House report issued Friday shows that the full impact of next years ham-handed budget cuts would affect virtually every government function, not just the Pentagon.

title: County Judge Strikes Down Some Restrictions on Public Unions in Wisconsin Law
description: A county judge in Wisconsin on Friday struck down much of the 2011 state law pushed through by Gov. Scott Walker that severely restricts the ability of public employees to bargain collectively.

title: Mets Put Brewers Surge Into Wild-Card Picture on Pause
description: MILWAUKEE  The flat-screen televisions in the middle of the Milwaukee Brewers clubhouse were strangely dark on Friday afternoon.

title: Lottery Numbers
No Rush to War
description: Amid the alarming violence in the Arab world, a new report about the costs of a potential war with Iran got lost this week. It says an attack by the United States could set back Irans nuclear program four years at most, while a more ambitious goal  ensuring Iran never reconstitutes its nuclear program or ousting the regime  would involve a multiyear conflict that could engulf the region.

title: Ospreys in Okinawa
description: Tens of thousands of people rallied on Sunday in Okinawa to protest plans to deploy the MV-22 Osprey, the trouble-plagued tilt-rotor aircraft, at the United States Marine Corps base in the city of Ginowan. The Marines want to bring in 24 Ospreys to replace a fleet of Vietnam-era helicopters, but Okinawans, turning out in one of the largest anti-American protests in years, are bristling.

title: Walmart Opts Out of New York Mall After Facing Labor Opposition
description: The prospect that Walmart, the worlds largest retailer, would open its first big-box store in New York City suffered a setback on Friday, with the company saying it would not be a part of a new mall being constructed in Brooklyn.

title: American Retailers Face Challenges in Expanding to Canada
description: TORONTO  Nordstrom and Target are about to open stores in Canada, J. Crew and Tory Burch just did so, and Ann Taylor and Kate Spade are scouting locations.

title: Turkish Cooking in a Friendly Setting
description: BEREKET, our waitress explained, means good luck,  not a bad name for a venture that is less than three years old. The friendly, unpretentious staff and surroundings made me want to second that wish. In a later phone conversation with the restaurants manager, I was told Bereket also means an excess, as in more than enough of a good thing. Take your pick.

title: Legislators Tainted by Scandal Find Defeat at the Polls
description: In a state with a scant history of electoral upsets, it was not in any job description, but it might as well have been: Once an incumbent, always an incumbent.

title: Money-Laundering Inquiry Is Said to Aim at U.S. Banks
description: Federal and state authorities are investigating a handful of major American banks for failing to monitor cash transactions in and out of their branches, a lapse that may have enabled drug dealers and terrorists to launder tainted money, according to officials who spoke on the condition of anonymity.

title: Two Days in September
description: Anniversary No. 1: Exactly four years ago, Lehman Brothers filed for bankruptcy protection. In the days and weeks that followed, we saw the unfolding of the dramatic  and ultimately successful  effort by the federal government to rescue the banking system. But, once the dust settled, we began to see something else: like the stock market crash of 1929, Lehman wasnt an isolated event. Rather, it was a signal that deep problems had enveloped our economy  problems that wouldnt be solved quickly or easily. That is why the Lehman bankruptcy still resonates. It was the moment everything changed.

title: Votes Arent All Tallied, but Conclusions Are Drawn
description: Senator Stephen M. Saland, a lawyer from Poughkeepsie, has served in the New York State Legislature for 32 years. In 2010, he won re-election by 19 percentage points. And since then, he has raised $788,000 for his campaign war chest  more than 40 times what his challenger in the Republican primary raised.

title: No Fury Like a Woman Bored
description: On average, Oslo gets about 2.5 inches of rainfall in September  around one inch less than Hartford. But you wouldnt know that from the loud onstage downpour underway as you take your seat for Jennifer Tarvers production of Hedda Gabler at Hartford Stage.

title: While Ryan Throws Hardballs, Romney Makes Friends on Morning TV
description: PAINESVILLE, Ohio  One of the advantages of the partnership between Mitt Romney and Paul D. Ryan is their ability to offer varied messages on the campaign trail  unusually varied, as shown on Friday. The running mates punched a list of campaign goals  rallying the conservative base, turning up the heat on President Obama and reaching out to women watching morning television  when each day counting down to Nov. 6 matters.

title: Bed-Stuy Pride
description: The garish yellow awning out front still says, Bs West Indian, but the restaurant Do or Dine, which opened in June 2011 in Bedford-Stuyvesant, Brooklyn, has outgrown its original winking misdirection. In July, one of the chef-owners, Justin Warner, won Season 8 of the cable reality show Food Network Star. And by now the high-concept, lowish-budget restaurant has become a destination for Manhattanites, as well as a standby for locals, with or without oversize baseball caps. How do you tell the difference? Manhattan customers are very used to being catered to in their whims, said Luke Jackson, 33, another owner, whereas locals are more concerned with essential pleasures: the food and the atmosphere. All choose from a menu whose puckish inventiveness (foie gras doughnuts, banana split-pea soup) has drawn sighs of delight and exasperation. Last Tuesday, the disco mirror ball spun and the sound system played ghosts of hip-hop past.

title: Prosecutors Still Interviewing Campaign Donors in Liu Fund-Raising Inquiry
description: A federal prosecutor said on Friday that investigators were continuing to interview donors to the campaign of the New York City comptroller, John C. Liu, which suggests that the authorities are trying to amass more evidence to put pressure on the defendants in the fund-raising case.

title: Olajuwon Will School Knicks in Low-Post Moves
description: Hakeem Olajuwon, a two-time N.B.A. champion and a leading teacher of low-post moves, usually conducts his instruction on his ranch in Katy, Tex. But next week, Olajuwon will visit the Knicks training facility in Greenburgh, N.Y., to give lessons to the teams big men.

title: Soul-Searching in a Christian Community Over Views on How to Live
description: BREMERTON, Wash.  In 2005, John and Linda Parsons decided to downsize. They were each about 50 years old, with two sons nearing college age. The time seemed right to leave their house on Bainbridge Island, near Seattle. They would sacrifice square footage for a lower mortgage.

title: Organizers Say Ironman Will Not Return to New York City
description: Ironman, the organizer of the worlds best-known triathlon, will shut its race in the New York area after just one year.

title: Meet the Quiet Jets, Who May Be a Lot Like the Old Jets
description: FLORHAM PARK, N.J.  The new Jets ditch practice to attend leadership retreats. They score 48 points in victory and then act as if they were shut out. They speak of good vibes and great feelings and how last year was last year and this year is just, well, different.

title: How the Chicago Public School District Compares
description: The Chicago Teachers Union ended its strike on Tuesday after reaching a tentative deal with Chicago Public Schools.

title: Twitter Turns Over Users Messages in Occupy Wall Street Protest Case
description: Twitter on Friday turned over to a judge a printed stack of messages written by an Occupy Wall Street protester in October, around the time he and hundreds of others were arrested after walking on the roadway of the Brooklyn Bridge.

title: Cherry Ice Cream Smile
description: SATURDAYS PUZZLE  Theres a lot going on in this puzzle for me, and thats a big compliment considering that we are talking about a themeless Saturday puzzle.

title: As N.H.L. Nears Lockout, Doan Re-Signs With Coyotes
description: With N.H.L. teams on track to begin a lockout at midnight Saturday, the league engaged in a bevy of activity almost everywhere except the bargaining table.

title: Diplomats Bodies Return to U.S., and Libyan Guards Recount Deadly Riot
description: WASHINGTON  As four flag-draped coffins bearing the bodies of the Americans killed in Libya arrived in the United States on Friday, new details emerged of Ambassador J. Christopher Stevenss final hours, alone, locked in a smoke-filled room in a diplomatic mission under siege.

title: Talking to the City With Chalk
description: ON Thursday evening, Robin Lane was out there with his stick of chalk, standing at his spot on the northeast corner of Second Avenue and 33rd Street in Kips Bay, Manhattan.

title: South Africa Warns Against Violence as Protests Fester
description: JOHANNESBURG  In an attempt to stanch a spreading crisis in South Africas platinum and gold mining regions, the government said Friday that it would crack down on illegal gatherings and arrest people who congregate with weapons.

title: A Concert Finder for the Open-Minded
description: APP Timbre

title: The Brooklyn Game Had Its Own Beat
description: Before I was to play in the public school gym or the local Y, and at about the same time I had my first crush on Annette, the Mouseketeer, I used to gaze at the tall, gray steel backboard with the orange rim. For my first shot, I used a dodgeball. I didnt have, let alone own, a real ball, a Voit.

title: After Life in New York, Banker Returns to India for Turn at Fashion
description: NEW DELHI

title: Lia Lee Dies; Life Went On Around Her, Redefining Care
description: In 1988, when Anne Fadiman met Lia Lee, then 5, for the first time, she wrote down her impressions in four spare lines that now read like found poetry:

title: The American Diplomatic Compound in Benghazi
description: Libyans found the body of J. Christopher Stevens in a safe room in the American Diplomatic Compound in Benghazi.

title: A Suicide in a Troubled Jail Mirrors New Orleanss Ordeals
description: NEW ORLEANS  Over the past year, in churches full of citizens railing at the state of the city jail, and in courtrooms where the thousands of young men who populate that jail rotate glumly through the sentencing process, a middle-aged woman could be seen sitting quietly. Her name is Donna Gauthier and she had not given much thought to the criminal justice system, other than to assume that if you had the misfortune of ending up in it, they would at least take care of you.

title: Some Romney Proposals Await Fuller Detail
description: Mitt Romney says he will cut government spending by some $500 billion a year by the end of his first term, while protecting military spending. But he has not detailed many of the deep cuts to domestic programs that budget analysts say would be needed to achieve that.

title: Google Has No Plans to Rethink Video Status
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Google said on Friday that it would not comply with a White House request to reconsider the anti-Islam video that has set off violent protests in the Arab world in light of its rules banning hate speech on YouTube, which it owns.

title: Romney Stumbles in Explaining Iran Policy
description: WASHINGTON  Mitt Romney has a clear red line in mind, a point beyond which Iran cannot go toward producing a nuclear weapon. It is sharply different, his campaign insists, from President Obamas.

title: Answers to Questions About New York
description: Debtors Delight

title: Afghan Insurgents Attack Base Where Prince Harry Serves
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Insurgents using guns and rockets or mortars launched an audacious attack on the largest NATO base in Helmand Province shortly after midnight Saturday morning, killing two American service members, according to a spokesman for the international forces here.

title: School Confronts Porn Arrest of Doctor
description: A prestigious Massachusetts prep school and a pediatric hospital said on Friday that they had no indication that any of the children they served were harmed by a doctor who worked for both institutions and now stands accused of receiving child pornography.

title: Shave, Shul and Schumann
description: David M. Posner is retiring next year as senior rabbi at  Temple Emanu-El on Fifth Avenue at 65th Street, a Reform Jewish synagogue that counts Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg among its 3,000 members. Rabbi Posner, 64, who grew up in Brownsville, Brooklyn, started there immediately after his ordination from Hebrew Union College in Cincinnati, in 1973. He lives with his wife and childhood sweetheart, Sylvia  he calls her Syl  in a building that is a 15-minute walk from work, and said he expected to feel both happiness and relief after delivering his last High Holy Days sermons beginning on Sunday.

title: Advantage, Obama
description: Elections often turn on character moments and the slopes of lines.

title: Two Aces, One Unsettling Pattern
description: Since making his first start against the Yankees in early June 2009, David Price has held up his billing as the Tampa Bay Rays unquestioned ace  a 6-foot-6 left-hander and former top overall draft pick with the jerky delivery and the fastball that sings.

title: Events in New Jersey
description: A guide to cultural and recreational events in New Jersey. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to njtowns@nytimes.com.

title: The Champs-lyses, a Mall of America
description: PARIS  Andr Malraux, the novelist and minister of culture under Charles de Gaulle, told a French-American journalist in the 1960s that the Champs-lyses  then considered the most beautiful avenue in the world  had an American basement. Today, American business and its brands are prominently aboveground on a Champs-lyses that has largely lost its distinctive character and has become far less French.

title: Events on Long Island
description: A guide to cultural and recreational events on Long Island. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to lical@nytimes.com.

title: Events in Connecticut
description: A guide to cultural and recreational events in Connecticut. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to ctcal@nytimes.com.

title: Events in Westchester
description: A guide to cultural and recreational events in the Hudson Valley. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to westweek@nytimes.com.

title: SEAL Veteran With Zest for Adrenaline
description: LAS VEGAS  Tyrone S. Woods, one of four Americans killed this week when militants stormed a diplomatic compound in Benghazi, Libya, was one of those adrenaline junkies who was built to do what he did, said Dr. Timothy Rasmusson, his former brother-in-law.

title: Peter Lougheed, Ex-Premier of Alberta, Dies at 84
description: Peter Lougheed, the Alberta premier who harnessed his provinces vast oil and gas resources to transform its economy, died Thursday in Calgary, Alberta. He was 84.

title: Inflatable Dams
description: To help prevent the dumping of raw sewage into New Yorks waterways during a storm, the city has installed inflatable dams in two locations.

title: The Face of Indefinite Detention
description: BEFORE he died on Sept. 8, Adnan Farhan Abdul Latif had spent close to 4,000 days and nights in the American prison at Guantnamo Bay, Cuba. He was found unconscious, alone in his cell, thousands of miles from home and family in Yemen.

title: A Leader in China Reappears in Public
description: BEIJING  Chinas next designated leader, Xi Jinping, reappeared in public on Saturday, two weeks after mysteriously disappearing from view.

title: Mexico: Bodies Found on Bridge
description: The bodies of nine men, one of them hanging from a bridge and all shot in the head, were found Friday in Nuevo Laredo, across from Laredo, Tex., the authorities said. Ruben Daro, a spokesman for the Tamaulipas State prosecutors office, said the bodies were all found near the bridge, with a message left near them, though he would not disclose what it said. In May, five men and four women were found hanging from another bridge in the city. This latest crime occurred a day after the top leader of the Gulf Cartel, one of Mexicos largest, was captured by the Mexican Navy in Tamaulipas, leading security analysts to warn of possible violence resulting from the power vacuum.

title: In the Bowels of the City, Blocking Wastewater Overflows
description: It happens dozens of times a year, undermining water quality, closing beaches and endangering aquatic life: Hit by major rainfall, New Yorks sewers release raw sewage and polluted storm water into New York Harbor. These overflow events account for an estimated 27 billion gallons of pollutants annually in the citys waters.

title: Corrections: September 15, 2012
description: INTERNATIONAL

title: A Lonely Redemption
description: ESSEX, N.Y.  Striding barefoot through the fields of his farm in the Adirondacks, S. B. Lewis, known as Sandy, is talking without pause, gesturing this way and that in a soft summer rain.

title: Seeking Chic, Brilliant Intern to Thread Needles (No Pay)
description: In February, Xuedan Wang, a 2010 graduate of Ohio University, received modest attention after she filed a lawsuit against the Hearst Corporation claiming that the company violated labor laws when it did not pay her for the work she had done as an intern at Harpers Bazaar, one of its magazines, over four months last year. Speaking to New York magazine last week, on the occasion of Fashion Week, Ms. Wang, who goes by Diana, explained that she had spent more than half of her life dreaming of Bazaar and approximately 12 months working at a pharmaceutical company in Columbus in order to save enough money to realize her Manhattan vision.

title: Billboards Protecting Their Heads
description: Dr. Marcus M. Reidenberg, 78, has for a few years been engaged in an ongoing photographic project: documenting the uniquely decorated hard hats of welders, carpenters, bricklayers and others around New York.

title: Sid Watkins, Safety Innovator in Formula One Racing, Dies at 84
description: Formula One racing is one of the worlds fastest motorsports, and in the 1970s it was one of the most dangerous. Fiery crashes occurred so frequently that drivers were often seriously injured or killed.

title: A Comedian and a Cardinal Open Up on Spirituality
description: The comedian Stephen Colbert and Cardinal Timothy M. Dolan of New York bantered onstage Friday night before 3,000 cheering, stomping, chanting students at Fordham University, in what might have been the most successful Roman Catholic youth evangelization event since Pope John Paul II last appeared at World Youth Day.

title: Newswallah: Bharat Edition
description: Jammu and Kashmir: A man suspected of helping to plot the 1999 hijacking of an Indian civilian aircraft, Indian Airlines Flight 814, was arrested by the police Thursday in the Kishtwar district of the state, IBN Live Web site reported. Mehrajuddin Dand, who is in police custody for four days, admitted to working with the organized-crime boss Dawood Ibrahim, who is one of the most wanted men in India, the report said, quoting unnamed sources.

title: Beginning a Journey That Could Make Family History
description: My full name is Leobardo Espinoza Jr., but everyone here calls me Leo. Its shorter to say and easier for everyone to understand. I was born in California and moved to Topeka, Kan., when I was in the sixth grade.

title: The Early Word: Toss-Up
description: Todays Times

title: Sept. 14: Obama Forecast Declines on Poor Manufacturing Report
description: President Obamas odds of winning the Electoral College fell for the second consecutive day on Friday according to the FiveThirtyEight forecast. His chances of winning the Electoral College are now listed at 76.2 percent, down from 78.6 percent in Thursdays forecast.

title: Morocco Emerges as Key U.S. Ally in Troubled Region
description: LONDON  Anti-American protests that have spread across the Arab world are overshadowing Washingtons latest steps to cement its ties with one of its closest allies in the region, Morocco.

title: Small Business Health Insurance: Costs Still Going Up
description: The news for small businesses  not particularly surprising and not particularly good  in the Kaiser Family Foundations latest study of employer-sponsored health insurance is that the trend lines are unchanged. Costs continue to go up, and the number of companies offering insurance does not.

title: Do Tax Cuts Lead to Economic Growth?
description: Washington

title: Undaunted by Arrests, the Opposition Marches Against Putin
description: MOSCOW  Russias opposition movement drew tens of thousands to another large anti-Putin demonstration on Saturday, sending the message that its ranks are undaunted by a battery of new government sanctions and the two-year prison sentences handed down last month to the punk-rockers of Pussy Riot.

title: Tax Cuts and Economic Growth
description: My Capital Ideas column in this weeks Sunday Review mentions a new report from the Congressional Research Service  a nonpartisan government group that provides analysis to Congress  on the relationship between tax cuts and economic growth.

title: Mitt Romney, Liquidationist
description: How times have changed. Back in 2004, Greg Mankiw declared, in the Economic Report of the President, that

title: An Inside Look, but Through the Clubs Lens
description: The Fox Sports executives behind Being: Liverpool, a six-part series about the British soccer club that starts Sunday afternoon, recognize that it will be compared to HBOs Hard Knocks and 24/7.

title: A Rally for Warren, as Massachusetts Senate Race Intensifies
description: Elizabeth Warren, the Democratic candidate who has seemed on the ropes in the hard-fought Massachusetts Senate race, has planned a major rally for Saturday in Boston with Gov. Deval Patrick.

title: After Days of Unrest in Muslim World, a Fragile Calm Takes Hold
description: CAIRO  Under intense pressure from Washington, Egyptian security forces arrested hundreds of protesters around the American Embassy in Cairo on Saturday as political leaders struggled to deal with the fallout caused by the week of unrest.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Sports Editor:

title: House Honors Americans Killed in Attack on Consulate in Libya
description: A bipartisan resolution is expected to pass through the House next week, recognizing the four Americans killed in the attack this week on the American Consulate in Benghazi, Libya. Speaker John A. Boehner and Representative Eric Cantor of Virginia, the Republican leader, drafted the resolution late Friday evening, along with Representative Nancy Pelosi, the House minority leader, and Representative Steny H. Hoyer of Maryland, the Democratic whip, to honor those killed in the attack and to condemn the anti-American violence that rippled throughout Egypt and Yemen.

title: Highlights and Analysis: Third Saturday of College Football
description: The stars remained aligned for another Saturday of college football. Paul Myerberg is in Manhattan. Tim Rohan is in East Lansing, Mich., for tonights game between Notre Dame and Michigan State. Ray Glier is in Fayetteville for Arkansas-Alabama. Stick around for updates and analysis.

title: Forward Passing, Behind the Back
description: It has always amazed me how little literary attention has been paid to professional footballs early days. Baseball historians have put the game under a microscope. There is probably a book out there that will tell you what Babe Ruth ate for breakfast on the day he swatted his 714th home run. The story of the N.F.L.s formative years, on the other hand, is still largely untold.

title: For a 2011 Draft Pick, the Sitting and Fretting Could Finally Be Over
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  Marvin Austin thought about it. How could he not? As the days and weeks and months went by, Austin, the Giants defensive tackle who was drafted in the second round in 2011 but has not played an N.F.L. regular-season snap, could not help wondering if his professional career might end before it ever began.

title: Take the Bus, and Watch the New Ideas Flow
description: This interview with  Jarrod Moses, founder and chief executive of the United Entertainment Group, a marketing agency, was conducted and condensed by  Adam Bryant.

title: A Players Concussion, a Familys Ordeal
description: FORT WORTH  Mitch White watched football last Sunday, a framed New Orleans Saints jersey mounted on a wall over his shoulder at his home. White watches football differently from most people. He likes to analyze the offensive line, fitting for a tackle out of Oregon State who was a sixth-round draft pick of the Saints in 2001. And on most days, around the hour the early games reach halftime, White needs to lie down for a nap.

title: New International Envoy, Meeting With Syrian President, Says Crisis Is Worsening
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  The new United Nations peace envoy to Syria, Lakhdar Brahimi, said after a meeting with President Bashar al-Assad on Saturday that the civil war held consequences for the region, and the whole world, while acknowledging that he had not yet formulated a plan to address the escalating violence.

title: On the Sideline, the Jets Odd Couple Coach Alike and Think Alike
description: FLORHAM PARK, N.J.  Two football coaches go shark fishing off the coast of Florida. One is Rex Ryan, the other is Mike Westhoff. They sit on Westhoffs boat for hours, sharing laughs while casting lures, but the sharks are not biting. They catch nothing. Well, almost nothing.

title: South Africa Raids Homes for Weapons of Miners
description: CALITZDORP, South Africa  Hundreds of police officers swarmed the living quarters of workers at a platinum mine 60 miles northwest of here on Saturday, searching for illegal weapons as part of a new push by the government to end a series of violent wildcat strikes that have unsettled the nation.

title: Mira Nairs Reluctant Fundamentalist
description: The director Mira Nair discusses her latest film, The Reluctant Fundamentalist.

title: Variety: Split Decisions
description: SECOND SUNDAY PUZZLE  Many people look forward to the Split Decisions puzzles, and its really a shame that they dont come along more often.

title: Pope Makes Plea for Religious Freedom
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Pope Benedict XVI on Saturday implored young Christians not to emigrate from Lebanon, saying they were meant to be protagonists as the country moved forward, and urging them to forge closer bonds with Muslim youth.

title: A Wide-Open Field, and the Nascar Chase Is On
description: The Nascar driver Jeff Gordon vowed to grow a mustache if he managed to climb from deep in the standings to earn a berth in this years Chase for the Sprint Cup. After he eked out the final spot in the 12-car field in the last race of the regular season, Gordons stubble is showing heading into Sundays playoff opener at Chicagoland Speedway.

title: Fundamentals From Mira Nair
description: TORONTO  The director Mira Nair has comedies, multicultural dramas and period pieces in her filmography, but she hadnt tackled the thriller genre until now. Her latest film, The Reluctant Fundamentalist, opened at the Venice Film Festival before playing here in a gala presentation. It was acquired by IFC Films this week for distribution. An adaptation of of Mohsin Hamids novel, the film follows a young Pakistani man (Riz Ahmed) who goes to the United States to pursue the American dream. But after the 9/11 attacks, the way he is perceived in the country, and subsequently the way he perceives the country, shifts. In the video above, Ms. Nair, who hails from India, speaks about the film and ways she hopes its subject will create both a dialogue and a bridge of understanding between the United States and Pakistan.

title: No Deal in N.H.L. Dispute as Lockout Deadline Passes
description: After weeks of fitful negotiations, rejected offers and prickly rhetoric, the deadline for the N.H.L. to avoid a lockout passed without a resolution.

title: Man Linked to Film in Protests Is Questioned
description: LOS ANGELES  One of the men behind the anti-Muslim film trailer on YouTube that has set off violent protests at Western embassies across the Middle East was taken in for questioning by federal probation officers early Saturday morning, law enforcement officials said.

title: U.S. Is Preparing for a Long Siege of Arab Unrest
description: WASHINGTON  After days of anti-American violence across the Muslim world, the White House is girding itself for an extended period of turmoil that will test the security of American diplomatic missions and President Obamas ability to shape the forces of change in the Middle East.

title: A U.S. Envoy Who Plunged Into Arab Life
description: J. Christopher Stevens, the American ambassador to Libya who was killed in an assault on a diplomatic mission there last week, was happy to gossip, but was revered for listening. A northern Californian with a toothy grin, he had a passion for the Arab world and its language, and he went out of his way to use it, whether with officials or shopkeepers, in an effort to show respect.

title: Now, Wie Seeking to Be First on the Leader Board
description: HOYLAKE, England  With no golf to occupy her, Michelle Wie went shopping Friday in Liverpool and bought two pairs of pants. Not unlike other labels she has acquired, one pair did not fit.

title: A Chinese Leader Returns Amid Tumult
description: BEIJING  The reappearance on Saturday of Xi Jinping, a top Chinese leader who had vanished from public view, removes one question mark facing the Communist Party, but a wave of protests against Japan is a sign that internal power struggles are far from over.

title: Kendrick, Phillies Handyman, Sparks Playoff Push as Starter
description: The end of July had been so seismic for the Philadelphia Phillies that it was easy to miss their first trade of August. By then, they had already traded two veteran outfielders, Shane Victorino and Hunter Pence, and re-signed an ace starter, Cole Hamels, for six years. They were rebuilding for the future and recommitting to their present, all at once.

title: Finding What Needs Fixing
description: WHEN I was in seventh grade, my father sold his word processing company in Washington, D.C. My parents always wanted to live on a boat in retirement, and I was the last child at home, so it was feasible.

title: In Britain, a Stunner of a Summer, Quite
description: HOYLAKE, England  British sports are in the midst of a glorious Indian summer, the tennis player Andy Murrays victory in the United States Open final taking place on the same day Britains 65 Olympic medalists and 120 Paralympic medalists were honored in a London parade. Then the best golfers in the world descended on Royal Liverpool Golf Club for the Womens British Open, the years final major.

title: How to Solve a Career Cliffhanger
description: THE numbers didnt add up: Ten years of writing soap operas on network television. Four Emmy Awards. One Writers Guild Award for script of the year. Then four months out of work. And zero job offers.

title: With the Crowds Gone, Its Down to Serious Fishing
description: EDGARTOWN, Mass.  Striped bass are nocturnal, and every year at this time, Kathi Pogoda becomes nocturnal too.

title: Texas Tech Confronts Coaching Turbulence
description: Kirby Hocutts first major public appearance as the athletic director of Texas Tech in March 2011 was to introduce the mens basketball coach, Billy Gillispie.

title: After Injury, Beard Embraces New Outlook, and Team
description: During Alana Beards pregame introduction and after every basket she made, the crowd at Verizon Center in Washington cheered.

title: 30 Seconds With Dwyane Wade
description: Dwyane Wade, a seven-time N.B.A. All-Star, has won two championships with the Miami Heat and an Olympic gold medal. But he wants the top of his rsum to read like the title of his new memoir, A Father First: How My Life Became Bigger Than Basketball.

title: Some Republicans Try Out a New Campaign Theme: Bipartisanship
description: WASHINGTON  A woman who appears in an advertisement supporting Representative Jon Runyan, a New Jersey Republican, boasts about how he works with both parties.

title: Padres to Honor Jerry Coleman
description: The Milwaukee Brewers unveiled a statue of their longtime radio voice on Aug. 31, and now the San Diego Padres are doing the same. The Brewers honored Bob Uecker, and the Padres planned to honor Jerry Coleman on Saturday.

title: Forgoing College to Pursue Dreams
description: EDEN FULL should be back at Princeton by now. She should be hustling to class, hitting the books, acing tests. In short, she should be climbing that old-school ladder toward a coveted spot among Americas future elite.

title: Death at Guantnamo Bay
description: Adnan Farhan Abdul Latif, a Yemeni citizen and one of the first detainees sent to Guantnamo Bay, Cuba, in January 2002, died there earlier this month. There is no official autopsy report yet, but in his decade in prison he had gone on hunger strikes and made several suicide attempts.

title: In Dueling Ads, Candidates Seek to Politicize Issues of China and Manufacturing
description: United States-China relations continue to surface as an issue on the campaign trail, particularly in battleground states like Ohio where manufacturing is a major force in the local economy. Now both President Obama and Mitt Romney are running television commercials that trade accusations over who is softer on China, and who is more to blame for sending American jobs there.

title: Role-Playing at the Range, Bin Laden in Their Sights
description: NEW HOPE, Minn.  Gripping a modified AR-15 assault rifle, Nathan Schneider threw open a bedroom door and crossed the threshold, his barrel blazing as a man dressed like Osama bin Laden fell motionless on the floor.

title: European Bank Overhaul Meets Opposition From Finance Ministers
description: NICOSIA, Cyprus  A plan by the European Union to overhaul bank supervision and help troubled lenders directly ran into a wall of opposition on Saturday as finance ministers from major nations like Germany, Poland and Sweden raised objections.

title: Keeping Score: Steals Drought Unlikely to End Soon
description: Billy Hamilton, a shortstop in the Reds minor league system, thrilled the baseball world this season by stealing 155 bases, a professional record. But as exciting as his play was, there remains the question of how he would fit in the majors now that stolen bases are largely a thing of the past.

title: A Push for Clemency as an Execution Nears
description: PHILADELPHIA  The scheduled execution of a convicted murderer has prompted pleas for clemency from thousands of people who argue that he should be spared because he had been sexually abused by his victim.

title: Sunday Breakfast Menu, Sept. 16
description: Rising unrest in the Arab world will dominate this weeks Sunday shows, with each broadcast focusing almost exclusively on diplomacy and the fallout from the attack that killed four Americans at the United States Consulate in Benghazi, Libya.

title: Tucson Schools Overhaul a Program to Help Struggling Hispanic Students
description: TUCSON  The forecast for the year ahead is dire, so officials in the public school district here, the oldest in the state, summoned parents to an urgent meeting one evening to lay out the options: close schools and increase class sizes or impose across-the-board pay cuts, making it harder for the district to recruit quality teachers.

title: The Talk of China
description: Beijing

title: Its Not About the Video
description: THE greatest mistake to be made right now, with our embassies under assault and crowds chanting anti-American slogans across North Africa and the Middle East, is to believe that whats happening is a completely genuine popular backlash against a blasphemous anti-Islamic video made right here in the U.S.A.

title: Neocons Slither Back
description: WASHINGTON

title: Scandal Poses a Riddle: Will India Ever Be Able to Tackle Corruption?
description: NEW DELHI  His business rivals never fully understood how Manoj Jayaswal got so rich so fast, except that he often seemed joined at the hip with powerful politicians. He hosted them at lavish parties, entertained them at his daughters opulent Thai wedding and stood among them at Indias presidential palace, where a year ago he was praised as a leader in the India growth story.

title: The Foreign Relations Fumbler
description: DIPLOMACY is a minefield, and Mitt Romney spent the last week blowing up his foreign policy credentials to be president. He raised doubts about his capacity to deal with global crises, and we were left hoping that if that 3 a.m. call ever went to him, hed have set up call forwarding.

title: Young Lives, Lost in the Fog of War
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  These days, Abdul Farhad tries to sleep with the lights on in his bedroom and his eyes wide open, because as soon as he closes them he is back in his shop in central Kabul and it is 11:30 a.m. on the eighth of September.

title: Sometimes, a Candidate Is Meant to Look Plastic
description: Those cashing in on the Republican and Democratic conventions included vendors selling pins, T-shirts and dolls. Will saving these trifles make anyone rich in the future?

title: Afghans Act to Fill Top Security Posts
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Afghan lawmakers approved all three of the presidents nominees for the governments top security jobs on Saturday, avoiding a prolonged power vacuum as the country confronted multiple reminders of the fragility of its security.

title: World Hunger: The Problem Left Behind
description: THE drought-induced run-up in corn prices is a reminder that were nowhere near solving the problem of feeding the world. The price surge, the third major international food price spike in the last five years, casts more doubt on the assumption that widespread economic development leads to corresponding gains in agriculture.

title: G.M.O.s: Lets Label Em
description: ITS not an exaggeration to say that almost everyone wants to see the labeling of genetically engineered materials contained in their food products. And on Nov. 6, in whats unquestionably among the most important non-national votes this year, Californians will have the opportunity to make that happen  at least in theory  by weighing in on Proposition 37.

title: Berlusconi Magazine to Publish Duchess Photos
description: ROME  An Italian magazine owned by former Prime Minister Silvio Berlusconi announced Saturday that it planned to publish photographs of the former Kate Middleton, the Duchess of Cambridge, sunbathing topless, just as its sister French magazine did on Friday.

title: The Road to Retirement
description: Even before the Great Recession, Americans were not saving enough, if anything, for retirement, and policy experts were warning of a looming catastrophe. The economic downturn and its consequences  including losses in jobs, income, investments and home equity  have made that bad situation much worse.

title: Kick-Starts From a Phone and the Fed
description: HELP for the beleaguered economy came last week from two powerhouses: the Federal Reserve and ... Apple.

title: Surviving the Pain at the Roots
description: I came out of the womb scratching. Mitts had to be put on my hands so I would stop clawing my skin. When I was seven and got mad I would bite myself, raising welts on my arms. This was already well into the time when I would have to touch certain spots on the cabinets, on the sidewalk, with my fingers and toes. At 12, after a seriously traumatic event, I began to pull out my hair. Every day since then, for the past 18 years, the hairs on my body have gone one by one, in the thousands, as I have tried to cope with overwhelming anxiety from a chaotic series of experiences that from birth have made me feel inside as if my very life is at stake if I do not pick and pull and bite and scratch.

title: In Britain, One Player Blows Away the Field
description: HOYLAKE, England  Fairways as narrow as tongue depressors did not much bother Jiyai Shin, who hit all but one Saturday during the delayed second round of the Womens British Open. Royal Liverpool Golf Clubs humpback greens were no worry, either; Shin did not miss any en route to a masterly eight-under-par 64, which left her at minus nine at the tournaments halfway point.

title: Mitt Romney and Foreign Policy
description: My Sunday column argues that Mitt Romneys foreign policy lapses last week are indicative of a larger problem: This is a world he doesnt get, or gets wrong. Romney has clearly thought a good deal about domestic issues in the six years hes been studying to be president, but theres not much indication of interest or expertise in foreign affairs. And thats putting it mildly.

title: Dont Show Me the Money!
description: THESPIAN friends perform The Seagull in their garden. Only minutes into the first act, a lovely young woman named Masha, sick of hearing the lovesick schoolteacher Medvedenko whine about his penury, blurts out, All you ever do is talk and talk about money. Thats when it dawns on me: Im sick of the subject, too. For the rest of Act I, I find myself ruminating about the glut of financial data that daily clogs the news: Libor and MF Global Holdings; HSBCs money-laundering of Mexican drug-cartel money; the London Whale whose huge trades cost J.P. Morgan Chase billions; leveraged buyouts and mortgage-backed securities and derivatives and stimulus packages, Bain Capital and the tottering euro and the Greek bailout. Saul Bellow referred to this quotidian fretting about world affairs as crisis chatter. Todays crises are all about what is euphemistically called the financial services industry  that is to say, theyre all about money.

title: The Vast Potential of Data-Driven Discovery
description: To the Editor:

title: When Its on Paper, It Belongs to You
description: To the Editor:

title: In Search of Political Champions for the Poor
description: To the Editor:

title: Sunday Dialogue: Has America Lost Its Way?
description: Readers discuss whether the country is on the right track.

title: When the Privacy Button Is Already Pressed
description: IT could usher in a new era of online privacy. Or it might bowdlerize the Internet as we know it.

title: A Synthetic Windpipe
description: Doctors have begun performing surgeries to replace windpipes, or tracheas, with plastic scaffolding seeded with a patients own cells.

title: Smartphone Ads and Their Drawbacks
description: AT two inches wide and one-third of an inch tall, a display ad shown on a smartphone isnt much of a canvas for a creative marketer seeking to promote a product or service.

title: A Condo Was Sold, Until It Wasnt
description: HORROR stories abound across Foreclosure Nation. But once in a while, a new one comes along to remind us just how dysfunctional our mortgage market is.

title: Mining the Power (and the Profit) of Conversation
description: BEFORE there were TED Talks, there were Della talks.

title: For Indias Children, Philanthropy Isnt Enough
description: MEENA DEVI is only 10 years old, but shes the head of her household. She cooks, cleans and takes care of her 11-year-old brother, Sunil, while a 14-year-old brother, Anil, works at a faraway brick kiln in a neighboring state. The three have been orphans since their mother died of starvation three years ago. They have an aunt in their village, but the most shes ever done is send over food to their mud hut.

title: Matchup: Buccaneers (1-0) at Giants (0-1)
description: 1 p.m. Eastern, Fox

title: Matchup: Jets (1-0) at Steelers (0-1)
description: 4:25 p.m. Eastern, CBS

title: An Adverb That Defies Certainty
Thousands Attend Rally for Chicago Teachers as Union Nears Contract
description: CHICAGO  As union and school board lawyers toiled in private here on Saturday to finish a contract that could soon lift the first teacher strike this city has seen in 25 years, a rally  not quite victory party, not quite vitriolic protest  was roaring just miles away.

title: The Computer as Music Critic
description: THANKS to advances in computing power, we can analyze music in radically new and different ways. Computers are still far from grasping some of the deep and often unexpected nuances that release our most intimate emotions. However, by processing vast amounts of raw data and performing unprecedented large-scale analyses beyond the reach of teams of human experts, they can provide valuable insight into some of the most basic aspects of musical discourse, including the evolution of popular music over the years. Has there been an evolution? Can we measure it? And if so, what do we observe?

title: At Rally, Elizabeth Warren Takes More Aggressive Stance
description: 9:35 a.m. | Updated BOSTON  During a rally on Saturday, Elizabeth Warren questioned the record and credibility of Senator Scott P. Brown, energizing a crowd of more than 700 people as the Senate race in Massachusetts turned more aggressive and pointed.

title: He Said, She Said, and the Truth
description: IN journalism, as in life, balance sounds like an unassailably good thing.

title: Dear Bankers: Thanks for Wrecking Our Lives...
description: On the anniversary of Occupy Wall Streets encampment at Zuccotti Park, excerpts of letters to bank executives.

title: Obama Ad Tries to Answer: Are You Better Off Than Four Years Ago?
description: A new ad from President Obama confronts head on one of the most potentially damaging questions lingering over his re-election hopes: Are you better off than you were four years ago?

title: Dear Bankers: Thanks for Wrecking Our Lives ...
description: TOMORROW is the first anniversary of the Occupy Wall Street movements encampment at Zuccotti Park. Some of the protesters there created a Web site for Americans who couldnt join them in Lower Manhattan. Called Occupy the Boardroom, the site invited people across the country to write detailed letters to the executives and directors of banks. The sites developers promised to deliver them as e-mail and in person.

title: Ed Hochuli
description: Ed Hochuli is a trial lawyer and one of the 121 referees the N.F.L. has locked out of work because of disputes over pay and pensions. Known for his bodybuilder biceps, he was the model for the official in the Madden N.F.L. video games. After some  replacement referees blunders in season-opener games, fans are calling for his and his colleagues swift return.

title: A Military Success Story
description: As the country approaches the first anniversary of the repeal of dont ask, dont tell on Sept. 20, politicians and others who warned of disastrous consequences if gay people were allowed to serve openly in the military are looking pretty foolish.

title: Must Great Leaders Be Gregarious?
description: DISTANT. Aloof. Concealed inside a layer of self-protective ice, as Jonathan Alter put it. President Obama has been roundly criticized for his introverted personality.

title: Dont Tell Anyone, but the Stimulus Worked
description: Republicans howled on Thursday when the Federal Reserve, at long last, took steps to energize the economy. Some were furious at the thought that even a little economic boost might work to benefit President Obama just before an election. It is going to sow some growth in the economy, said Raul Labrador, a freshman Tea Party congressman from Idaho, and the Obama administration is going to claim credit.

title: The Power of Political Communion
description: AS the 2012 presidential race enters the homestretch, both parties vow that this election is not just a choice between different policies. It is a cosmic decision between two different visions, two different value sets, as Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. told delegates at the Democratic National Convention. Behind the competing catchphrases lurks another contest, one that illuminates this war of worldviews. It is a tale of two Catholicisms.

title: An Annual Ritual on Marthas Vineyard
description: With the summer crowds gone, the Massachusetts island starts its 67th annual Striped Bass and Bluefish Derby, which draws hundreds, if not thousands, of competitors.

title: A Giant Crossword
description: SUNDAYS PUZZLE  At first glance, this one scared me.

title: Charlatans and Cranks
description: I guess readers didnt get the reference in my last post. Charlatans and cranks was a phrase Greg Mankiw used in the first edition  but only the first edition  of his textbook to describe

title: In Prosecutors, Debt Collectors Find a Partner
description: The letters are sent by the thousands to people across the country who have written bad checks, threatening them with jail if they do not pay up.

title: Man Is Accused of Jihadist Plot to Bomb a Bar in Chicago
description: An 18-year-old suburban Chicago man, who the authorities say was enamored with Osama bin Laden and intent on killing Americans, has been arrested after attempting to detonate what he thought was a car bomb outside a Chicago bar, officials said Saturday.

title: A Rally for Educators in Chicago
description: It was the largest show of union force since the strike began, even as schools were expected to reopen Monday.

title: Harvard Wins Opener, but Scandal Spoils Mood
description: BOSTON  The 139th season of Harvard football opened with a first-time matchup and a major academic scandal overshadowing the university, its defending Ivy League champion football team and its N.C.A.A.-high 40 other varsity sports teams.

title: Attack by Fringe Group Highlights the Problem of Libyas Militias
description: CAIRO  Ansar al-Shariah, the brigade of rebel fighters that witnesses say led the attack on the United States diplomatic mission in Benghazi, holds that democracy is incompatible with Islam. It has paraded the streets with weapons calling for an Islamic state, and a few months ago its leader boasted publicly that its fighters could flatten a foreign consulate.

title: Yankees Beat Rays to Keep Pace in East
description: In the Yankees clubhouse on Friday, Ivan Nova fidgeted. He said he felt restless and anxious, believing he had more to prove in his rocky season.

title: Challenged on Medicare, G.O.P. Loses Ground
description: ORLANDO, Fla.  Maria Rubin is one of the coveted independent voters in this swing state  so independent that she will not say whether she is voting for President Obama or Mitt Romney. She does share her age (63) and, more quickly, her opinion on Medicare: Im not in favor of changing it, or eliminating it.

title: Rays Pitcher Wins Expectations Game
description: The cap on Fernando Rodneys head  perpetually tilted, ever off-kilter  has been about the only thing askew for him this season.

title: Jerome Kilty, Who Made a Career of Interpreting Shaw, Dies at 90
description: Jerome Kilty, an actor and playwright known for writing epistolary dramas  most notably Dear Liar, his adaptation of 40 years of amorous correspondence between George Bernard Shaw and one of the London theaters most temperamental actresses  died on Sept. 6 in Norwalk, Conn. He was 90.

title: Several Arrests at Occupy Wall Street March
description: On the first of three days of events planned for the one-year anniversary of Occupy Wall Street, about 250 people marched down Broadway from Washington Square toward Zuccotti Park, accompanied by a large number of police officers on foot, in marked and unmarked cars, and riding scooters.

title: Michael Wreszin, Biographer of American Radicals, Dies at 85
description: Michael Wreszin, a biographer of radical 20th-century American intellectuals who were prominent antiwar activists, among them the social critic Dwight Macdonald, died on Aug. 12 in Manhattan. He was 85.

title: Tide Put Beating on Razorbacks; So Do Razorbacks
description: FAYETTEVILLE, Ark.  Tyler Wilson, Arkansass No. 1 quarterback, marched into the auditorium where the Razorbacks hold their postgame news conferences still in his shoulder pads and still wearing his No. 8 jersey. He did not play in Saturdays humiliating 52-0 loss to No. 1 Alabama because of a concussion, but he had plenty to say in a 67-second rant.

title: A First: Organs Tailor-Made With Bodys Own Cells
description: STOCKHOLM  Andemariam Beyene sat by the hospital window, the low Arctic sun on his face, and talked about the time he thought he would die.

title: Struggling at Plate Since Injury to Head
description: MILWAUKEE  There are moments, Mets Manager Terry Collins said, when Jason Bay swings a bat like the dangerous hitter he used to be. The grand slam Bay drove to right-center in Miami off Mark Buehrle on Sept. 2, igniting a Mets victory, was one of those moments.

title: Tony Goldman, SoHo Pioneer, Dies at 68
description: Tony Goldman, whose investors eye for spotting battered neighborhoods prime for rejuvenation led him to help revive SoHo in Manhattan in the 1970s and South Beach in Florida in the 80s, died on Tuesday in Manhattan. He was 68.

title: Worlds No. 2 Player Leads Armenia to a Gold Medal
description: Eastern Europeans have dominated chess for decades, and one reason may be that they come from countries where the average citizen is simply more passionate about the game.

title: A Gentle Giant Stays Behind
description: On Sept. 15, 1862, Gen. Thomas J. Stonewall Jackson and his Confederates trapped the 12,700-man federal garrison in Harpers Ferry, Va. We were as helpless as rats in a cage, moaned one Union soldier. The federal commander, Col. Dixon S. Miles, had little choice but to surrender. Moments after the decision, the explosion of a stray artillery shell resulted in his mortal wounding. A subordinate made the final arrangements.

title: Lottery Numbers
Sept. 15: Waiting on Wisconsin
description: Saturday was a much quieter day for polling than weve grown accustomed to and the FiveThirtyEight forecast was unchanged to the decimal place, with President Obama given a 76.2 percent chance of winning the Electoral College, the same as in Fridays forecast.

title: College Football Replay: Sept. 15
description: The day in college football included an upset of No. 13 Virginia Tech and a near-upset of No. 12 Ohio State.

title: Giving Conservative Films a Head Start, Right Here
description: In assessing the box office performance of new releases, Hollywood bean counters have long considered both foreign and domestic grosses. But maybe they should add a third category: Texas.

title: Sadler Reminds Texas Who He Was
description: In 2002, Representative Paul Sadler of Henderson, one of the most powerful Democrats in the Texas Legislature, announced he was not running for re-election. He was the chairman of the House Public Education Committee and a force that even the states governor had learned to be mindful of when it came to anything involving schools.

title: Looks Can Be Deceptive and Lead to Surprises
description: Ross Ramsey, the executive editor of The Texas Tribune, writes a regular column for the Tribune.

title: Championing the Farm to Table Food Movement
description: On a mission to advance the local food movement, a Democrat from Austin is finding common ground with Republicans and rural Texans.

title: How Olajuwon Became Invested in the Knicks
description: Mike Woodson made a request early. Even before he knew he would be coaching the Knicks again, Woodson looked into the future. He needed help. He called Hakeem Olajuwon, his longtime friend and a Hall of Famer known for teaching fundamentals.

title: The Week in Political Pictures: Sept. 9-15
description: A look back at the week in politics, including reactions to an attack on the United States Consulate in Libya.

title: In Event of Lockout, Swedish League Faces Challenge in Attempt to Bar N.H.L. Players
description: The Swedish Elitserien has been the only top European league to say that it will not sign N.H.L. players to short-term contracts if the N.H.L. locks them out, as is expected to happen when the current labor deal expires at midnight Saturday. But many believe the Elitserien would have to join other leagues in welcoming N.H.L. players under contracts of any length, since the Elitseriens contract with its players union does not include bans on short-term deals.

title: Mejia Bunts Well and Pitches Poorly in Mets Loss
description: MILWAUKEE  The suicide squeeze bunt that Mets pitcher Jenrry Mejia dropped down in the fourth inning Saturday night not only gave him a lead against the Milwaukee Brewers, but also gave him an odd distinction. Thirty-five games into his major league career, Mejia picked up his first major league run batted in before his first major league win.

title: Corrections: September 16, 2012
description: NEW YORK

Pike, an uncle of the groom and an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony at the chapel of the St. Georges School, where the bride and groom first met while in high school.

description: Courtney Ann Quick and Charles Eakin Burdette were married Saturday in Siasconset, Mass., on the island of Nantucket. The Rev. Daniel P. OReilly, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony at the Siasconset Union Chapel.

Thomas Cleveland of Briarcliff Manor, N.Y., was married Saturday in New York to Angus Washburn Smith, a son of Adrienne Sullivan Smith and Thomas R. Smith Jr. of Bronxville, N.Y. The Rev. R. John Nelson, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony at the Mandarin Oriental hotel.

description: Hector Luis Charriez and Antonio Ruberto Jr. were married Friday evening at the Chateau at Coindre Hall, an events site in Huntington, N.Y. The Rev. Linda Hendrick, a minister affiliated with the Sanctuary of the Beloved, officiated.

description: Bethany Leslie Johnson-Kerner, the daughter of Alexis A. Bruner, a cousin of the groom and a Lutheran minister, taking part.

description: Patricia Victoria Debiaggi and Jameson Lee Mones were married Saturday at the Basilica of St. Patricks Old Cathedral in New York. Msgr. Donald Sakano, the cathedrals pastor, performed the ceremony.

title: Japan Wont Stop Work on Reactors, Official Says
description: TOKYO  Japan will not stop work on several planned reactors, the trade minister was quoted as saying on Saturday, casting further doubt on whether this resource-poor nation will follow through on a contentious plan to phase out nuclear power.

title: Henry Scores Two, but You Have to See This One
description: What did you do on Saturday? Thierry Henry did this:

title: Notre Dame Makes a Statement by Stuffing Michigan State
description: EAST LANSING, Mich.  Two years ago here, a smirking Mark Dantonio shook Brian Kellys hand. In Kellys third game as Notre Dames coach, Dantonio had called a fake field goal in overtime to win, beginning a two-year run that redefined Michigan State as calm, cool and clutch. After that, the Spartans won 10 of their next 11 games decided by 10 points or fewer, while Kellys Fighting Irish went 8-5 in each of his first two seasons as Notre Dame faltered in its seemingly endless quest to regain a place atop the college football mountain.

title: College Football Around the Country
description: CHRIS THOMPSON The Florida State running back scored on runs of 74 and 80 yards on successive carries to lead the No. 5 Seminoles to a 52-0 victory over Wake Forest.

title: A Conversation With: Anand Sharma
description: After a week in which Indias government announced a series of controversial reforms, including raising diesel and cooking gas prices, and opening the door to foreign investors in the countrys retail, broadcast, aviation and power sectors, Anand Sharma, the minister of commerce and industry, sat down for a brief interview to explain the moves.

title: Audacious Raid on NATO Base Shows Talibans Reach
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  An audacious Taliban attack on a heavily fortified base in southern Afghanistan did far more damage than initially reported, destroying or severely damaging eight attack jets in the most destructive single strike on Western matriel in the 11-year war, military officials said Sunday.

title: For a Film Enthusiast, Judging a College By Its Smell
description: The first thing that I noticed about Occidental College was the smell.

title: Opposition Makes Pick in South Korea
description: SEOUL, South Korea  A former human rights lawyer and ally of former President Roh Moo-hyun was chosen on Sunday as the main opposition partys candidate for the presidential election in December.

title: Letter From Bad Check Restitution Program
description: Thousands of letters are sent each year to people across the country who have written bad checks, threatening them with jail if they dont pay up. They often bear the seal and signature of the local district attorneys office but are actually from debt-collection companies.

title: Beijing Mixes Messages Over Anti-Japan Protests
description: BEIJING  Anti-Japanese demonstrators took to the streets again on Sunday in cities across China, with the government offering mixed signals on whether it would continue to tolerate the sometimes violent outbursts.

title: How Could QE Work?
description: One good question some of my readers have been asking is how the Feds new policy might actually boost the economy  that is, how could changes in expectations turn into a real increase in demand?

title: To the Mom Who Cant Stop Following Her Child Around the Playground
description: Dear Fellow Mom at the Playground,

title: Game of Thrones Sets Pace at Creative Arts Emmys
description: Game of Thrones received six awards at the Creative Arts Emmys on Saturday night, kicking off a competition among several cable dramas that will conclude next Sunday with the 64th Primetime Emmy Awards.

title: A Call From The Kremlin
description: MOSCOW  Secretly I had felt that I had made Vladimir Putin up. I had spent years studying his interviews, his speeches and his ad-libbed statements, and he had come out flat and gray. Some people claimed he had a secret dimension, others said he possessed charm  I saw no evidence of it. But then, I had never talked to the man: As a journalist, I had apparently been blacklisted by the Kremlin at the very beginning of his reign  I could not even get accredited to a press conference.

description: London

title: Russias Political Weekend: We Will All Answer for This.
description: The anti-Putin opposition was on the streets again on Saturday in Moscow, as our colleagues Ellen Barry, David Herszenhorn, James Hill and others documented in full. One of the people they quoted, Gennady Gudkov  described by Ellen as a rumpled veteran of Russias post-Communist fray  was stripped of his parliamentary seat on Friday. In this video of his farewell speech, in Russia (http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=n8c_vqEdI0o&feature=youtu.be), he told the attentive if scant members of the Duma, Russias parliament, exactly what he thinks is going on behind the scenes in their country.

title: Marios Schwab: Spring 2013 RTW
description: London

title: American Idol Confirms Addition of Nicki Minaj and Keith Urban
description: The Fox network on Sunday morning made official the long-reported final additions to the judging lineup for American Idol, televisions dominant show of the past decade, and the new names were, as expected, the rap star Nicki Minaj and Keith Urban, one of the most popular singers in country music.

title: Underwater, a Train, a Dinette and Dont Forget the Chevy
description: Nicki Pombier Berger, who is listed as one of the speakers at an event called Underwater New York, is unequivocal: She is terrified of diving. She has never wanted an up-close-and-personal look at what she will be talking about at the South Street Seaport Museum, namely, the stuff that has piled up over time at the bottom of the Hudson River or the East River or New York Harbor  the jetsam of New York.

title: For Both Campaigns, a Need to Control the Message
description: There is almost nothing more valuable to a presidential campaign than controlling the message.

title: Disruptions: Let Silicon Valley Eat  Ramen Noodles?
description: You dont have to spend much time in Silicon Valley to start hearing that the people dont care about money. People here are just trying to make the world a better place. Entrepreneurs and venture capitalists eat ramen noodles for dinner and drive old, clunky Hondas to work. If they do make money, thats just a tiny cherry on top of their altruistic Tofutti soy whip sundae.Thats what people here would like the world to think. Lets be realistic, these start-ups arent nonprofit organizations.

title: Israeli Leader Says Iran Is Closer to Building a Nuclear Bomb
description: WASHINGTON  Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel reiterated on Sunday that the best way to prevent Iran from acquiring a nuclear weapon was to draw a red line that, if crossed, would trigger military intervention. He also denied that he was injecting himself into one of the most divisive foreign policy issues of the American presidential campaign.

title: Israeli Leader Makes Case Against Iran on U.S. TV
description: WASHINGTON  Having been rebuffed privately by President Obama last week, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel took to the airwaves in the United States on Sunday to warn that Iran was only six or seven months from having 90 percent of what it needed to make an atomic bomb.

title: Romney Cancels Appearance After Crash
description: BOSTON  Mitt Romney abruptly canceled his sole campaign event on Sunday, in the swing state of Colorado, after an airplane crash at the small airport where he had been scheduled to land.

title: Fashion Week Casting | Acne

title: Resident Evil: Retribution Leads Box Office
description: Resident Evil: Retribution, the fifth installment of this video game-based series, was No. 1 at North American theaters over the weekend, while two art-house films  The Master and Arbitrage  attracted crowds in limited release, a reflection of how starved filmgoers are for sophisticated cinema.

title: No Easy Answers on How to Fix the Banks in Europe
description: NICOSIA, Cyprus  Beleaguered countries like Spain have been counting on a quick and neat way to fix their banks without taking on more crippling debt.

title: Acne: Spring 2013 RTW
description: London

title: Replacement Official Removed From Crew for Being a Saints Fan
description: The N.F.L. said it has been generally pleased with the performance of replacement officials. They were not pleased Sunday, however, to see one of them wearing New Orleans Saints apparel on his Facebook page  hours before he was supposed to be part of the crew at the Saints game against the Carolina Panthers.

title: Earnings in United States Are Beginning to Feel a Pinch
description: The boom in American corporate profits, which has far outpaced the gains in the broader economy since the end of the last recession, is faltering.

title: A Doctor Tied to Her Patients and the Mob
description: The Fox series The Mob Doctor, which begins on Monday night, is an odd hybrid, a medical drama merged with a Mafia morality play. Its hard to tell from one episode how sustainable this gimmick will be, but from the pilot one thing is sure: the writers never encountered the adage less is more.

title: Butterflies Roam at a Concert Hall in Infancy, Still Without a Roof
description: You will not immediately be able to know, when it opens a little over a year from now, that there is anything very special about the Original Music Workshop. Aside from a few large windows, from the outside it will look like any of the old factory buildings scattered throughout Williamsburg.

title: The Daily Shoe | Acne
description: T plucks the best shoes right off the runway.

title: In Connecticut, Wall Street Community May Limit Obama Victory
description: We continue our Presidential Geography series, a one-by-one examination of the peculiarities that drive the politics in all 50 states and the District of Columbia. Here is a look at Connecticut, the Constitution State. FiveThirtyEight spoke with Paul Bass, the editor of The New Haven Independent; Gary Rose, an associate professor of political science at Sacred Heart University; Ronald Schurin, an associate professor of political science at the University of Connecticut; and Kevin F. Rennie, a columnist for The Hartford Courant and a former Republican state senator and representative.

title: A Little Bit of Europe Big Enough for New York
description: Twice on Friday night, Andreas Stadler, the director of the Austrian Cultural Forum in New York, delivered the same speech, more or less, at the Czech Center on the Upper East Side. Each time, he was welcoming an audience to a concert presented on the second night of Moving Sounds, a festival of contemporary-classical and electronic music that the forum has mounted annually since 2009.

title: I Get Mail
description: Yes, its a psychology journal.

title: For Open Winner, It Only Looks Easy
description: HOYLAKE, England  A wave that formed 35 years ago with the Japanese star Chako Higuchis victory in the 1977 L.P.G.A. Championship crested on the Wirral Peninsula on Sunday when Jiyai Shin of South Korea won the Womens British Open in a rout.

title: LeGrand,  Buc for Life, Receives Warm Ovation Before Giants-Bucs Game
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  Eric LeGrand might be the only person who can wear a Tampa Bay Buccaneers jersey for the coin toss at MetLife Stadium and be cheered by Giants fans.

title: Ron Paul on Money Market Funds
description: Brad DeLong has a post on Paul Ryans hysterical reaction to QE3, which is worth reading just for this:
