description: KASHMIR  Shaida Banu attends stitching lessons in Silikot village near the Line of Control on the Indian side of Kashmir. A tailor teaches embroidery and patchwork in a large schoolroom with sewing machines and a chalkboard. Not far is a cordoned-off plot of mines laid out to prevent militants entering from the Pakistan side.

title: News Quiz | September 26, 2012
description: See what you know about the news below. To prepare, you might scan the articles or summaries on todays paper. Good luck!

title: Even Panda Diplomacy Isnt Working
description: HONG KONG  The overhead pictures of Taiwanese and Japanese ships circling each other and shooting off their water cannons have made the seagoing confrontations appear almost playful. Chinese ships have had similar standoffs with the Japanese Coast Guard.

title: Reformers Do Win Elections in India
description: Mamata Banerjee and other chief ministers who are opposing the new economic policies of the Manmohan Singh government probably have not read Chapter 3 of the latest book edited by two renowned Indian economists Jagdish Bhagwati and Arvind Panagariya.

title: Belgian Has Come a Long Way to Hit It a Long Way
description: MEDINAH, Ill.  Of the 12 players on the European team this week, only one is a Ryder Cup rookie, Nicolas Colsaerts of Belgium. But that does not mean he is bereft of Ryder Cup experience.

title: Syrian Insurgents Mount Fierce Attack on Military Compound in Damascus
description: DAMASCUS, Syria  Suicide bombers struck a military headquarters in a busy square in central Damascus on Wednesday morning, the second insurgent assault on a government military installation in two days and the largest attack in the capital since July, when explosions killed several key aides to President Bashar al-Assad.

title: How the Poll Was Conducted
description: The latest Quinnipiac University/New York Times/CBS News polls included a total of 4,153 telephone interviews conducted from Sept. 18 through Sept. 24 with adult residents of Florida, Ohio and Pennsylvania. Of these, 3,771 said they were registered to vote.

title: Polls Show Obama Is Widening His Lead in Ohio and Florida
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio  For weeks, Republicans in Ohio have been watching with worry that the states vital 18 electoral votes were trending away from Mitt Romney. The anxiety has been similar in Florida, where Republicans are concerned that President Obama is gaining the upper hand in the fight for the states 29 electoral votes.

title: The Latest Quinnipiac University/New York Times/CBS Poll
description: The full results of the latest Quinnipiac University/New York Times/CBS Poll surveyed voters in Florida, Ohio and Pennsylvania.

title: IHT Quick Read: Wednesday, Sept. 26
description: NEWS The pressures facing the Spanish government of Prime Minister Mariano Rajoy mounted on several fronts on Tuesday as thousands of demonstrators besieged Parliament. Raphael Minder reports from Madrid.

title: Markets Falter in Europe Amid Protests on Austerity
description: ATHENS  After a period of relative calm, European markets shuddered once again on Wednesday as protests erupted across Greece and demonstrators surrounded the Spanish Parliament for a second day to protest the austerity program of Prime Minister Mariano Rajoy.

title: Test Yourself | Math, Sept. 26, 2012
description: Test your math skills with this question created by Scott Matthew at Math for America from the infographic Likely Voters Weigh In on the 2012 Presidential Election.

title: Former Murdoch Aides Appear in Court
description: LONDON  Two of the most senior former executives at newspapers owned by Rupert Murdoch, both once close to Prime Minister David Cameron, appeared at the Old Bailey courthouse in central London on Wednesday facing charges relating to the phone hacking scandal convulsing parts of the British press.

title: Football Follies: Mixed Up Signals Make for Absurd Game
description: According to the article, WHAT happened during the play that best defines this N.F.L. season?

title: Euro Update: The Perils of Pointless Pain
description: So, Im in jet lag city, which means that its time for a euro update. (Ive been pretty focused on the US election, since it is, after all, my country; but still keeping an eye on the other side of the pond).

title: An Election and Exiles
description: On this day in 1980 the Mariel boatlift came to an end. For me as a reporter, it is one of those events where life intersected with history. And it is the anniversary of the first Kennedy-Nixon debate, which began the ascent of televisions role in politics.

title: If the Shoe Fits, Dont Wear It Unless Its Comfortable
description: All women love shoes. Except me. Im a middle-aged, middle-class woman who doesnt give a rip about footwear. I might be the only one.

title: Losing Fear and Learning to See
description: SANTIAGO, Chile  The motor boat cut through choppy waters before reaching Isla de Asia, off Perus coast. We arrived half-drenched and shivering to a stunning scene: Quechua-speaking laborers with pickaxes trying to collect hardened guano, the bird dung so coveted in the 19th century as a fertilizer that nations waged wars over the islands where it is found.

title: What Are Your Sleep Habits?
description: A piece from the Sunday Review about rethinking sleep has been on the most e-mailed list all week. It states that getting eight consecutive hours of sleep every night may not be as essential as we think. Instead, the author proposes, taking short naps throughout the day may actually be more beneficial and improve cognitive function.

title: Death By PowerPoint, Continued
description: Update: OK, the word is that this was really clumsy satire.

title: Part 3: Answers From Princetons Dean of Admission
description: Updated: Ms. Rapelye is no longer taking questions.

title: Mutual Respect, Not Bad Blood, Links Ryder Cup Captains
description: MEDINAH, Ill.  The Ryder Cup, golfs biggest magnifying glass, has long exposed the cracks between its participants, the captains in particular. They, more than their players, are the real faces of this event, holing none of the putts but bearing the brunt of the attention and promotional burden in the two-year buildup to each Cup.

title: Week 3 Film Review: Rams Offense Overmatched
description: Andy Benoit puts some Week 3 games under a microscope, with the benefit of film analysis.

title: Labor-Market Scars Left by Redistributive Public Policy
description: Casey B. Mulligan is an economics professor at the University of Chicago.

title: Rian Johnson Builds a Better Time Machine
description: Looper is a film about fate, regret, decisions, revenge and the old maxim that the child is the father of the man, but mostly its about time travel, so lets travel back in time: to 10 years ago, before the director Rian Johnsons celebrated 2005 debut film, Brick (or his follow-up, The Brothers Bloom), to the moment he first had the idea for Looper. Back then, it was conceived as a short film, about 10 minutes long, which he never actually shot. But the script would eventually provide the opening voice-over for Looper: Time travel has not yet been invented. But 30 years from now, it will have been.

title: The Creators of Homeland Exorcise the Ghost of 24
description: Homeland, the geopolitically astute spy thriller on Showtime, features three bedeviled protagonists: Carrie Mathison (Claire Danes), a brilliant and bipolar C.I.A. agent; Saul Berenson (Mandy Patinkin), her mentor; and Nicholas Brody (Damian Lewis), a former prisoner of war who tried (and failed) to assassinate the vice president. Much of what made Homeland successful in its first season was the artful way in which the show plucked from real-time history, a trick that the shows creators, Howard Gordon and Alex Gansa, honed while working together on 24. We talked to them about the challenges of writing a show that so closely mirrors the real-world shadow wars.

title: Andre Braugher Has a Homework Assignment for You
description: How exactly do you prepare to play the defiant captain of a nuclear submarine who goes rogue? If youre Andre Braugher, you read. I got a stack of books and tried to figure out who sea captains are, what life on the sea is like and what goes into the making of a captain who can endure this kind of exile, he says of preparing for Last Resort, an ABC series about a sub captain who commandeers a tropical island. Its an apprenticeship by proxy. Should you ever find yourself in a similar position, here is Braughers recommended reading list:

title: What Back to the Future and Terminator Owe to La Jete
description: Chris Marker, who died earlier this year at 91, was an enigmatic figure, reluctant to be photographed and prone to biographical embellishment. A creature of the European postwar avant-garde, Marker would seem an unlikely influence on modern Hollywood. But his 28-minute photo-novel, La Jete  a shuffle of mostly still black-and-white images now marking its 50th birthday  has spawned more would-be blockbusters than any comic book or series of fantasy novels.

title: For Veterans, a Surge of New Treatments for Trauma
description: Suicide is now the leading cause of death in the army. More soldiers die by suicide than in combat or vehicle accidents, and rates are rising: July, with 38 suicides among active duty and reserve soldiers, was the worst month since the Army began counting. General Lloyd Austin III, the armys second in command, called suicide the worst enemy I have faced in my 37 years in the army. This Thursday, the Army is calling a Suicide Stand-Down. All units will devote the day to suicide prevention.

title: What Do You Do With the Brilliant Jerk?
description: My most recent experience with a Brilliant Jerk occurred when I was helping a group of 25 doctors thrash out their shared values as they tried to become a real company.

title: Daily Report: Relic of an Era, Revitalized for Tech Start-Ups
description: Once a dormant area of empty warehouses, the River North section of Chicago has evolved into a nexus of dining, nightlife and, most recently, an aspiring rival to Silicon Valley. Its 45 square blocks are home to the headquarters of Groupon, the Chicago offices of Google and several hundred technology start-ups.

title: N.F.L. Has Bigger Problems Than Officials
description: Is football the next boxing? Michael Silver of Yahoo Sports makes that connection in recommended reading today:

title: Stone Links: Thinking Dutch
description: The Dutch, it seems, like their philosophy. In an essay for Filosofie Magazine, Frank Mulder discusses the public role of philosophy in the Netherlands.

title: Imagining a Warmer Arctic
description: From more snowfall (which can act as an insulating blanket, keeping ice warm) to more storms and stronger winds and waves, a look at the implications of a potentially ice-free Arctic. [Scientific American]

title: Fallen South African Politician Charged With Laundering
description: JOHANNESBURG  Julius Malema, the firebrand former leader of the African National Congress youth wing, appeared in a court in his home province of Limpopo on Wednesday to face a charge of money laundering in connection with state contracts with an engineering company linked to him.

title: Iran Will Boycott Oscars to Protest Anti-Muslim Video
description: The boycott appears straightforward: Mohammad Hosseini, Irans culture minister, on Tuesday confirmed that his country would not submit a film for consideration at next years Oscars in protest of Innocence of Muslims, the anti-Islam YouTube video that has sparked deadly riots. He specifically cited the failure of Oscar organizers to take an official position on the incendiary film.

title: Breaking Down LaRon Landrys Pick-Six for Jets
description: Jonathan Bales will pick a big play from each week and break it down. In Week 2, he analyzed Victor Cruzs 80-yard catch-and-run for a score against Tampa Bay:

title: Off the Runway | More on Where to Go Between the Shows in Paris
description: Fashion folk who simply never O.D. on their mtier will want to high-heel it to the Cit de la Mode et du Design (34 Quai dAusterlitz, 75013) to catch the last days of Cristobal Balenciaga, Fashion Collector, which features looks by the master alongside historical garments he collected. Next door, Rei Kawakubo designed the unusual scenography for Comme des Garons, White Drama, which showcases her all-white S/S 12 collection ensconced in large-scale bubble formations. Through Oct. 7.

title: Former Prime Minister in Japan Elected to Lead Opposition Party
description: TOKYO  Shinzo Abe, a nationalist former prime minister, was elected to lead Japans main opposition party on Wednesday, giving him a chance of regaining the nations top job  a prospect that could worsen the countrys tense relations with China and its other Asian neighbors.

title: In Spain, Its Not Just the Economy
description: LONDON  It is becoming increasingly evident to Spains nervous European neighbors that the mounting crisis enveloping the government of Prime Minister Mariano Rajoy goes much deeper than the economy.

title: The King of Good Times Dismantles His Empire
description: NEW DELHI  Suddenly, everything in the sprawling empire of Vijay Mallya seems to be up for sale.

title: Cambodias Landless Class
description: PHNOM PENH  In a union officefor garment workers on the outskirts of the capital on a recent afternoon, Tith Srey Mom and her sister Mach were pondering what to do next. After losing a 10-year legal battle to keep their 200-square-meter plot of land, they were being evicted. All legal avenues had been exhausted. All they could do was wait for the police to come and forcibly remove them.

title: Using a Social Media Rating to Help People, Not Judge Them
description: Today, we are expected to maintain a good credit rating. A few years from now, we might be judged by how much we post on Twitter or update Facebook.

title: A Groundhog Breaks the Rules
description: Dear Diary:

title: Sept. 25: Romneys Narrow Path Without Ohio
description: With President Obama consistently holding a lead in polls of Ohio, Mitt Romney may need to devise a strategy to win the Electoral College without it.

title: The Breakfast Meeting: The Nook as iPad Lite, and Lessons From the Olympics
description: Roughly 217 million people watched Olympic coverage on NBC networks during the London games and eight million people downloaded NBCs mobile apps for the Olympics, according to new figures released by the network, part of a vast trove of consumer research based on viewing during the games. Watching video on tablet computers  no surprise  also surged and the most popular events on any device were womens gymnastics and the womens soccer final. The good news for the network: the popularity of the live feed during the day didnt seem to cannibalize viewers from NBCs primetime package.

title: Romney Makes Direct Claim of Compassion as 47 Percent Drives Ads
description: 11:10 a.m. | Updated Mitt Romneys 47 percent remarks are continuing to drive ad messages on both sides in the presidential race.

title: Libors New Masters
description: Libors New Masters | The British banking group that controls a crucial lending rate is preparing to give up that responsibility, a person with direct knowledge of the matter tells DealBooks Mark Scott.

title: A Guy Thing
description: Jonah Takagis mixed-media coffee tables and pendant lights can be found at edgy design stores like Matter and the Future Perfect. But the 33-year-old designers house is full of Ikea basics and estate-sale finds, not unlike most of his fashionable 30-something guy friends. So its with them  and himself  in mind that he started Field (field-online.com), a new male-centric housewares collection designed by, well, himself and his friends, which include Hallgeir Homstvedt, Jonathan Nesci and Oscar Diaz. I saw an opportunity to make new vintage pieces, ones that will age well and hold their own alongside a cast-iron desk or shop lights, says Takagi.

title: Deaths Rise for Drivers, Bikers and Walkers on City Streets
description: For years, the New York City Transportation Department has held a trump card in the roiling debate over its many roadway interventions: When officials said the measures, like pedestrian plazas and bike lanes, had made streets safer, the numbers appeared to back them up.

title: New Polls Show Ohio and Florida Senators Maintaining Lead Over Challengers
description: TAMPA, Fla.  In the battle for control of the United States Senate, the Democratic Party has little room for error and is particularly intent on protecting senators who are standing for re-election in presidential battleground states.

title: A Year Later, the Braves Celebrate
description: Every once in a while the sports calendar reminds us that so much can change as we make only one trip around the sun. On Tuesday night it was the Atlanta Braves marking time and metaphorical distance, putting a mere 12 months between their mesmerizing twin swan dive (with the Red Sox) out of last years baseball playoffs and clinching a spot in this years. It is instructive to think back over that 12-month stretch, remembering when baseball had a wild-card format that allowed for such thrilling finishes. (Sigh.) And in the N.F.L., remember when fans were giddy to have their favorite game saved from the teeth of a greedy league lockout? The N.B.A.'s was just getting rolling back then and N.H.L. owners were still dreamily planning for their chance to mess up their sport.

title: Luxury Cosmetics Maker Weighs the Benefits of Selling Items on TV
description: EvePearl is a Manhattan makeup studio, boutique and e-commerce business with 10 employees that sells cosmetics containing skin-care nutrients. The products are developed by the companys namesake and founder, a 46-year-old Emmy-winning TV makeup artist. She created her first foundation and concealer products seven years ago while working for Barbara Walters, Meredith Vieira, and the rest of the hosts on The View.

description: PARIS  Organizers of the 2012 Paris motor show said more than 100 new models would be introduced on Thursday during the first of two press preview days. title: Does Louisville Need More Highways?

Even so, we remain a nation in thrall to suburbs, highways, cars. On a recent visit here I was struck by this paradox.

title: Andy Williams, Crooner of Moon River, Dies at 84
description: Andy Williams, the affable, boyishly handsome crooner who defined both easy listening and wholesome, easygoing charm for many American pop music fans in the 1960s, most notably with his signature song, Moon River, died on Tuesday night at his home in Branson, Mo. He was 84.

title: The Domino Effect in Nature, and Visual Storytelling
description: My friend Randy Olson, the filmmaker and science-communication evangelizer devoted to prodding folks out of the nerd loop, has been at it again  this time running one of his three-day video-making boot camps for graduate students in the TerreWEB program (on communication of global-change science) at the University of British Columbia. One student, Megan Callahan, came up with a particularly effective video on the interconnections in ecosystems. Randy sees this film, describing the domino-like relationship of species in an ecosystem, as the best single video to emerge in his years-long coaching effort. Id like to get your view, and Im sure he would, too. Heres his Your Dot post, along with a link to more on his blog, The Benshi:

title: When Parents Cant Enroll in Medicaid, Children Stay Uninsured
description: The Census Bureau just released new data on poverty, income and health insurance for last year, and the numbers arent pretty. Overall poverty remained at the highs weve seen for the past three years, with the picture still particularly bleak for children: 15 percent of Americans and 1 in 5 children live in poverty. Lack of insurance is closely tied to that number. Nearly 14 percent of children living in poverty lacked health insurance last year, compared with under 10 percent for children overall, a number that stayed flat despite the decrease in the rate for everyone under 65.

title: 3 Myths About Booking Travel From the Source
description: FRONTIER AIRLINES caused a stir recently when it announced that travelers who do not book directly with the airline will pay higher fees, receive half as many frequent flier miles and will not be allowed to select a seat in advance of check-in. Whether cutting out the middleman is consumer-friendly is a matter of debate. But the news got me thinking: should travelers assume that the best deals always come from online  even offline  travel agencies?

Ms. Boianjiu, 25, spent two years in the military and later studied at Harvard. In a recent e-mail interview, she discussed the ways shes reflected in her characters, her sense of humor, whether she feels obligated to speak out about politics and more. Below are edited excerpts from the conversation:

title: Adapting Gas-Fired Power to a Greener Grid
description: Making electricity from natural gas is cleaner than making it from coal or oil, but as gas gains a bigger market share in the business in the United States and elsewhere, the idea of what constitutes a good generator is shifting. General Electric announced a line of new models on Wednesday, with two interesting environmental twists.

title: Trainers in Afghanistan Arm Themselves Against Both Sides
description: In The Times today, Matthew Rosenberg (@mrosenbergNYT) reports from Bad Pakh, Afghanistan, on the new protective strategy used by military advisers to the Afghan Army: keep body armor on and weapons loaded, all the time. He writes of the advisers in a base in Bad Pakh: Their guard was up even though they were there for a day of training Afghan soldiers without once leaving the confines of a fortified base  even when chatting with the Afghan officers over a lunch of goat meat and yogurt.

title: McCaskill Hits Akin for Legitimate Rape Comments in New Ad

But now that the final deadline for Mr. Akin to withdraw has passed, with Mr. Akin locked in as the Republican nominee, she is swinging as expected.

title: Priest Investigated in Ivory-Smuggling Inquiry in Philippines

title: N.F.L. Reaches Labor Deal With Referees

title: How Is Romney Still Competitive?
description: The latest poll from Ohio shows that President Obamas lead over Mitt Romney has grown, to 10 percentage points. Mr. Romney is going to have a lot more trouble getting to the White House without winning Ohioin fact, no Republican president has ever won the race without it.

title: Opening the Religious Tent to All
description: So much has happened in our lifetimes that seemed impossible not so long ago, beside our own aging. Who could have guessed 40 years ago, when a band of gay Jewish men came together in Greenwich Village to worship because they were welcome nowhere else, that today gay marriage would be legal in this state and others? Who could have guessed 20 years later, after AIDS had killed a generation of gay men, faster than they could be properly mourned, that Congregation Beit Simchat Torah would be a real synagogue, with a lesbian rabbi? Who could have guessed that before longBeit Simchat Torah would be a magnet for both gays and straights, Jews and Christians, especially on the High Holy Days  Rosh Hashanah and Yom Kippur  when most synagogues are open only to members with tickets? And that their open-door policy would draw crowds so large it meant using New York Citys historic Town Hall for the first holiday and the cavernous Jacob Javits Convention Center for the second? Attending on the first night of Rosh Hashanah, and welcomed as a practicing heterosexual, I noted that the audience had at least two things in common: A belief that religion could and should be an open tent. And enough years on this earth to know that there is a time to sow and a time to reap, and that the second required both grace and courage. Among the readings was the poem Autumn by Yevgeny Yevtushenko. Here are the first three stanzas, in slightly different translation. A complete version of the poem, in yet another translation, can be found here if you scroll to the bottom.

title: How to Prepare for Retirement
description: As boomers move toward retirement  the oldest of our generation are now 66  the complexities of preparing multiply. Unfortunately, matters have become considerably more complicated since the Great Recession. Of all demographic groups, people ages 55 to 64 have suffered the most financially, losing 10 percent of household income. Ive had several friends say that theyre never going to be able to retire, that theyll have to work until they drop. Hopefully not. Todays expert is Doug Wheat, a certified financial planner with Family Wealth Management, based in western Massachusetts. One of the things that drew him to this work was having to manage his mothers finances after his father died. Among the questions he is prepared to discuss are:

title: At U.N., Egypt and Yemen Urge Curbs on Free Speech

She was the highest-ranking Obama administration official to publicly make the connection, and her comments intensified what is becoming a fiercely partisan fight over whether the attack could have been prevented.

title: The Wealth of Washington
description: In a post pivoting off my weekend column on Washingtons extraordinary recent growth, Dylan Matthews of Wonkblog marshals data showing that the soaring wage premium for Washingtonians doesnt correlate directly with increases in the federal governments share of G.D.P. The two have spiked together in the last few years, but the D.C. economy achieved separation from national trends in the Reagan and Clinton years and lift-off under George W. Bush, a long three decade period when governments share of the national income was relatively flat. What does correlate, though, is the growth in Washingtonian wealth and the steady expansion of lobbying: As Matthews notes, the growth in inflation-adjusted lobbying spending, as measured byOpenSecrets, tracks the D.C. wage premiums rise since the 1990s quite well.

People arrived at Rochas on Wednesday shaking like poodles, and left to face lagoons of water in the streets. One woman came prepared with a beige vinyl souwester that matched her skirt. I hugged the sidewalk on the Champs-lyses, staying under the trees, and got back to my hotel just before it let loose again. I opened a bottle of red wine.

title: Climate Change, Metal and Waterways

Strong evidence links this trend to climate change, according to a recent study led by the United States Geological Survey and University of Colorado at Boulder.

title: Richard Rhodes Writes a Play About Reagan, Gorbachev and Nuclear Weapons

Mr. Rhodess Reykjavik, about the historic 1986 meeting between Ronald Reagan and Mikhail Gorbachev in that city, will have a free staged reading on Thursday at 6:30 pm at the Baruch Performing Arts Center. Mr. Rhodes and several other experts in nuclear disarmament will appear at a panel discussion following the reading.

The boy, Avery Gerena, 16, of Staten Island, told the police that he did not know the office was Mr. Grimms when he threw a rock through its window, according to a criminal complaint.

title: Model-Morphosis | Zoe Colivas at Rochas
description: The photographer Greg Kessler captures the transformations of the Spring 2013 Fashion Week in Paris. Here, the model Zoe Colivas of Elite Paris before (left) and after (right) transforms, with makeup by Lucia Pieroni for Cl de Peau and hair by Eugene Souleiman for Wella.

title: Pictures of the Day: Greece and Elsewhere
description: Photos from Greece, Syria, India and Senegal.

title: A Map App, as Sleek as iPhone 5, Is Often Off
description: Last week, I used Apples new Maps app on my iPhone to guide me to a speaking engagement.

title: A Maps App With Problems
description: Apples new Maps app for iPhones and iPads devices was built from scratch, and it is full of problems.

title: Musical Memories of Andy Williams
description: To be honest, I wasnt a fan of Andy Williams. But I wasnt a critic, either. Coming of age in the 1960s, I was pretty much rock n roll, 24/7. Andy Williams, Perry Como, Bing Crosby, Tony Bennett  they blurred together for me. It seemed like they all owned the same cashmere sweater. I had the same problem with Dinah Shore and Doris Day. While its true they sang music you could slow dance to  meaning you got to lean against a girl  for me, it was bar mitzvah music, the slow, grown-up stuff you were forced to listen to until the real music came on. Slow dancing for me was John Lennons Julia.

title: Andy Williams, a TV Star When Variety Shows Were Just Hanging On
description: In this YouTube clip, Andy Williams is with Antnio Carlos Jobim to sing The Girl From Ipanema.

title: Gareth Pugh: Spring 2013 RTW
description: Paris

title: A Day of Protest at the United Nations
description: Iranian President Mahmoud Ahmadinejads appearance at the United Nations attracted protesters who shared the streets with those representing other causes.

title: In Louisville, a Mixed Message
description: The city plans to enlarge its downtown highways, even as it hopes to attract 20-somethings and empty nesters with urban amenities.

title: The Sheltering Dress
description: Both Dries Van Noten and Marco Zanini of Rochas showed a dress style that was eye-catching in its capaciousness. Neither a tent nor a caftan, it swept to the floor. Mr. Van Noten showed his printed chiffon version as a cover for clothes.

title: Its Finally Pink on Top of Music Charts
description: This week on the music charts, Pink finally reaches No. 1 and Gangnam Style by the South Korean rapper Psy goes from viral-video status to genuine hit single (although its video is still plenty viral).

title: Finding Fame, and Sometimes Fortune, in Social Media
description: Social media have made it easier than ever to catapult from obscurity to prominence. In recent years, the Web has blossomed into a more egalitarian version of American Idol, where nobodies compete for attention alongside somebodies.

title: The Reguero Theater Gets Its Close-Up
description: Weve received many comments from readers about the pictures by Andrew Moorethat accompanied John Jeremiah Sullivans cover storyabout Cuba. One in particular, from Virgina Schofield, piqued our interest. Schofield, who is 73, grew up in Cuba and has a special connection to the Reguero Theater that Moore photographed in Morn (above). Her maternal grandfather, Miguel Reguero, spent his small inheritance to build that theater, and her mother occasionally played the piano in productions there. When the enterprise bankrupted Schofields grandfather, he moved the family to La Gloria, where her mother met Walton Schofield, whose parents were from England. I always say my last name is Schofield because of that theater, Schofield says, referring to the circumstances that led her parents to meet.

title: The Caucus Click: Guarding the National Debt
Video: Street Protests at the United Nations
description: Hundreds of demonstrators gathered outside the United Nations on Wednesday, chanting slogans and beating drums as President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad of Iran gave his final address before the General Assembly.

title: Leaving Polarization at the Door
description: Robert Rauschenberg, who died four years ago after a career as big-spirited and optimistic as any in postwar art, was not considered first and foremost a politically motivated artist.

title: For the Absent-Minded, a Few Forget-Me-Nots
description: I have a certain notoriety among friends because of my poor memory, which is particularly bad when it comes to to-do lists. Its so bad, in fact, that Ive resorted to all sorts of mental and linguistic tricks. Its not uncommon to hear me leave the house muttering monkeys, Ferrari, alien death ray to help me remember to buy peanuts, park the car inside and make an appointment with the doctor.

title: A Sherlock Holmes, Out of Rehab and Teaming Up With a Lady Watson
description: When CBS added Elementary to its fall schedule a lot of people asked whether television really needed another Sherlock Holmes show when the one we already have, courtesy of BBC and PBS, is so good.

title: Right Place and Sound for a 70s Time Warp
description: Lets do something kind of old, like me? suggested Dave Chandler of the doom-metal band Saint Vitus on Tuesday night from a stage that had been built more or less in his honor. I wrote it right around the time that dirt was invented?

title: Proposal Sets Circumcision Regulations in Germany
description: BERLIN  Germanys Justice Ministry took a firm step on Wednesday toward safeguarding the right of parents to circumcise their male children, distributing its proposal to state officials and other experts to be debated before it is drafted into law.

title: Column on Romney-Ryan Meant as Satire Is Taken as Fact
description: No, Representative Paul D. Ryan has not given the nickname Stench to Mitt Romney, despite a host of credulous journalists and bloggers who accepted as fact a column that Politico intended as satire.

title: Scenes From the London Design Festival
description: Having just marked its 10th year, the festival is poised between being a regional showcase bubbling with spontaneous interventions and a smooth international canvas.

title: Newly Released Books
description: Characters in this months selection of new books make great company: a wily ex-con, a master gardener, female Israeli soldiers and the real women who sued Newsweek so they could be writers. Even an abusive father and a hostage taker bring something to the party.

title: Photos of The Moment | Rochas
description: var data;function jsonSlideshowCallback(response){data = response;}NYTD.options = {source: data,cropType: 'blog480',appendTo: 'fullScreenSlideShow',showHeadLine: 'false', renderstyle: "embeddedSlideShowTmag"}

title: Nuclear Sub Goes Rogue, Visits Island
description: There is something cheering about a nuclear strike. Its bad, sure, but things could be worse.

title: Andreessen Horowitz Taps Former D.C. Mayor as Special Adviser
description: The venture capital firm Andreessen Horowitz is adding another Washington insider to its team, reflecting Silicon Valleys growing focus on regulatory matters.

title: Shopping Snapshots: Sept. 26
description: The Swedish label Dagmar is now a hit in the states; fashion hits a new level of feline craziness; and Dalia Oberlanders fascination with art and baubles informs her new retail Web site.

title: Planting the Flag
description: LONDON

title: Starting the Season With an Autumn Evening of Sweet Serenades
description: By now the versatile Hungarian master Zoltan Kodaly may be better remembered as an ethnomusicologist and educationist, as The New Grove Dictionary of Music and Musicians labels him, than as a composer, a few orchestral favorites aside. Even steady concertgoers can traverse entire seasons in New York without hearing his music. So the Chamber Music Society of Lincoln Center deserves praise for its continued championing of the Serenade for Two Violins and Viola (1920), which it recorded for Delos in 1993.

title: Green Ribbons at an Organic Fair
description: UNITY, Me.

title: Todays Scuttlebot: Google Oceans, and Promises The Jetsons Made Us
description: Some interesting items that the tech reporters and editors of The New York Times found on the Web recently.See more here.

title: Old Friends Whose Past Is Always Present
description: THAT the playwrights Hannah Bos and Paul Thureen, mainstays of the fast-emerging company the Debate Society, create such meticulously realized and unified worlds is even more remarkable when you consider their history  something that, for a moment recently, they seemed reluctant to do. You shouldnt tell that story, Ms. Bos, 33, instructed Mr. Thureen, 34, when the conversation turned to the eight months they dated, at Vassar College in the late 1990s.

title: In It for the Long Haul in Bushwick
description: Five friends made a commitment to fix up a raw space in Bushwick and live there for a decade.

title: Making Family Out of Friends
description: IN a slowly gentrifying section of Bushwick, Brooklyn, where gunshots are no longer heard and the local brothel has been turned into a family home, five friends made a 10-year commitment.

title: China Politics Stall Overhaul for Economy
description: BEIJING  When it comes to confronting economic slowdowns, the Chinese government has not been shy about making bold moves. Faced with the contagion of global recession four years ago, policy makers created a $585 billion stimulus package that helped inoculate the nation against the economic malaise still sapping the United States and Europe.

title: Market Ready
description: Q. I dont have a dishwasher. Should I install one before selling my apartment?

title: And You Think You Have a Diabolical Landlord?
description: In New York City, the notion of selling your soul to get into a magnificent building is not an unfamiliar one. Eternity in hell for a classic six on Riverside Drive with a view of the Hudson? Deal!

title: Russians Eagerly Participate in Medical Experiments, Despite Risks
description: MOSCOW  Like a dream patient conjured up in the boardroom of a pharmaceutical company, the Russian grandmother accepted the risks of the drug she was taking without complaint and cheerily endured even extraordinary side effects.

title: Eero Saarinens Unstoried Talent
description: Among the plethora of monographs available on decorative objects, one subject has been overlooked: the furniture designs of Eero Saarinen. While the architectural projects of Saarinen, the Finnish architect and industrial designer, have been covered, there is only the occasional reference  often inaccurate  to his furniture, said Brian Lutz, the author of Eero Saarinen: Furniture for Everyman (Pointed Leaf Press, $85). Mr. Lutz is well positioned to tell this story, having worked for the modern furniture companies Knoll in New York and Artek in Finland. His research took almost 10 years and involved numerous conversations with important figures in the production and development of Saarinens furniture, including Florence Knoll Bassett, Niels Diffrient and Don Albinson. The 224-page book, which will be officially released Oct. 16, features a preface by Ms. Knoll Bassett, a foreword by Mr. Diffrient and more than 200 photographs and illustrations. Information: (212) 941-1800 or pointedleafpress.com.

title: Sipping, Looking and Maybe Buying
description: Aurora and Anthony Mazzei, a married couple who live in Manhattan, specialize in clever ways to present design. Operating under the name Fair Folks & a Goat, they have opened a tea salon in an Upper East Side apartment and a bed-and-breakfast and a cafe in New Orleans, stocking each location with design pieces for sale.

title: Fashion-Forward Housewares
description: Zara, the clothing retailer, has become an indispensable resource for those who want to look on-trend without spending a fortune. And on Oct. 9, they can look to the company for dcor as well, when Zara Home comes to the United States.

title: Cutting Architecture Down to Size
description: David Adjaye is the latest architectural luminary to try his hand at product design. Star, his limited-edition collection of copper forms lined with black Swarovski crystal fabric, was introduced this month at Maison et Objet in Paris.

title: Sales at Andrianna Shamaris, Karkula and More
description: During Poltrona Frau Groups warehouse sale, Friday to Sunday, pieces from Cassina, Cappellini and Poltrona Frau are up to 70 percent off (the Peacock chair by Dror for Cappellini, left, originally $7,174, will be $5,022); 200 McKay Road (Railroad Avenue), Huntington Station, (212) 228-8186, cassinausa.com.

title: Rented Computers Captured Customers Having Sex, F.T.C. Says
description: If you rented a computer, you probably should not have been blogging without your shirt on.

title: Labor Day Regional in Atlanta
description: The big Labor Day Regional in Atlanta took place Aug. 28 to Sept. 3. The most successful players were the team of Judith Bianco of New York City, Jim Krekorian of Pensacola, Fla., Kevin Bathurst of Palm Beach Gardens, Fla., and Justin Lall of Las Vegas. They won three events and were fourth in another.

title: The Keyboard Trumps the Brush
description: Wade Guyton, who creates art on computers, is the subject of a midcareer survey at the Whitney Museum.

title: Romneys Tough Path as He Trails in Ohio
description: With President Obama consistently holding a lead in polls of Ohio, Mitt Romney may need to devise a strategy to win the Electoral College vote without it.

title: Last Call for College Bars
description: ITS hard to look cool slurping blue-hued vodka through neon-colored straws from a fishbowl, and four sorority sisters, all Cornell University seniors, have long since stopped trying.

title: Mugler: Spring 2013 RTW
description: Paris

title: Gay Couple Sues Conservative Group, Saying It Stole Their Kiss
description: On a May afternoon in Brooklyn in 2010, Thomas Privitere and Brian Edwards of Montclair, N.J., clasped hands and kissed in a park overlooking the Brooklyn Bridge. The moment was captured by a photographer they had hired, and the men liked the photo so much they used it to announce their engagement.

title: Nissan Aims to Improve Communication With Leaf Owners
description: Spurred by a group of owners in Arizona, Nissan Motor is establishing an independent board to study how the automaker may better communicate with customers about the performance of its purely electric Leaf.

title: Molecular Mixology With Chef Dave Arnold
description: Centrifuges, blowtorches and liquid nitrogen invade the kitchen.

title: Gov. Brown Should Sign the Trust Act
description: Gov. Jerry Brown of California has until this weekend to sign the Trust Act, a bill that seeks to restore concern for public safety and sensible law-enforcement to an immigration system that has strayed from those ideals.

title: Week 3 Film Review: The Santonio Holmes Show
description: Andy Benoit puts a few more matchups under the microscope, with the benefit of film review:

title: And the Boutique Makes Three
description: GILLETTE AND ZAK WING vividly remember the day in 2009 when they were walking down Atlantic Avenue on the cusp of Brooklyn Heights, peering into an abandoned store front and casually fantasizing about opening an antiques business. A local real estate agent was walking by and noticed the couple. He basically said, You want it? Its yours. Mrs. Wing said.

title: Near Ajaccio, a Hilltop Retreat
description: An 18th-century Corsican palace with seven bedrooms is on the market for $3.6 million.

title: House Hunting in ... Corsica
description: AN 18TH-CENTURY CORSICAN PALACE WITH SEVEN BEDROOMS

title: Skin Creams Capture the Eyes of Men
description: WHEN Lt. George Del Grande of the Belleville Fire Department in New Jersey turned 40 last month, he took it in stride because he felt as physically fit as ever and had recently earned his certification as a personal trainer.

title: Homes for $300,000
description: Properties in Texas, Ohio and Rhode Island.

title: What You Get for ... $300,000
description: SAN ANTONIO

title: Jaguar F-Type Plays the Rainy-Day Coquette in Paris
description: 7:37 p.m. | Updated

title: Iranian Channel Decries Assassination of Its Correspondent in Syria
description: Irans state-run Press TV reports that one of its correspondents was shot and killed by sniper fire on Wednesday in central Damascus, in an attack that also wounded the satellite news channels bureau chief in the Syrian capital.

title: All Black Everything: A Brooklyn Nets Style Guide
description: A detailed look at how the Brooklyn Nets new logo came to be.

title: American Banks Undamaged by Cyberattacks
description: Bank of America, JPMorgan Chase, Citigroup, U.S. Bancorp and PNC have been hit by a wave of cyberattacks that have caused Internet blackouts and delays on online banking sites.

title: Resorts Snow Wont Be Pure This Year; Itll Be Sewage
description: FLAGSTAFF, Ariz.  Klee Benally, a member of the Navajo tribe, has gone to the mountains just north of here to pray, and he has gone to get arrested. He has chained himself to excavators; he has faced down bulldozers. For 10 years, the soft-spoken activist has fought a ski resorts expansion plans in the San Francisco Peaks that include clear-cutting 74 acres of forest and piping treated sewage effluent onto a mountain to make snow.

title: 5 Reasons to Intervene in Syria Now
description: WHETHER you agree or disagree with President Obama, there is no doubt that he has formulated a coherent approach to the use of American power. The Obama Doctrine involves getting into a conflict zone and getting out fast without ground wars or extended military occupations. This approach proved its effectiveness in Libya last year.

title: Fighting Over Gods Image
description: THE murders of four Americans over an amateurish online video about Muhammad, like the attempted murder of a Danish cartoonist who in 2005 had depicted the prophet with a bomb in his turban, have left many Americans confused, angry and fearful about the rage that some Muslims feel about visual representations of their sacred figures.

title: Political Shifts in Bavaria, Land of Tradition, Could Have Wide Repercussions
description: MUNICH  With two mighty blows from a large wooden mallet, Christian Ude, the popular mayor of Bavarias capital here, tapped the first keg of Oktoberfest and officially opened this years festival. As tradition dictates, the first beer went to the man he hopes to unseat in next years election, state premier Horst Seehofer.

title: As Power Flows to Regional Bosses, Questions Rise on Indias Economy
description: NEW DELHI  It seems like eons ago, but Prime Minister Manmohan Singh and his coalition government once inspired very high expectations. They were going to stoke Indias economy, improve education, help the poor, build modern transportation and energy systems and, perhaps most improbably, prove that India, the most populous and messiest of democracies, could be successfully governed.

title: The Replacement Officials Handbook
description: An illustrated look at 10 missed calls we will not miss by the N.F.L.s replacement officials.

title: Build-A-Bear Goes High Tech
description: BUILD-A-BEAR WORKSHOP stores, a childrens destination for more than a decade, are moving beyond stuff, fluff, dress and accessory formulas to increase the interactive choices that children have when they create a favorite bear or other furry creature.

title: Things I Saw  No. 33
description: Suggestions for what youd like Jason to see and draw may be sent to thingsisaw@nytimes.com.

Mapping Arctic Resources
description: To the Editor:

description: To the Editor:

description: To the Editor:

description: To the Editor:
